review: Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have only been on Loryna a month. Please avoid taking this birth control. I took one month and can't take it . I thought I was going crazy I don't even recognize my own house. I have severe anxiety to the point where I'm crying all day. And on top of it I'm having symptoms of IBS that I hope clear up cause I just can't deal with that. The stomach problems are so bad I've lost 15 pounds in less than a week cause of the extreme gastrointestinal symptoms.  I'm just hoping I can clear all this up please pray for me. I stopped taking the pills it has only been a day I just hope I can recover from the negative side effects this pill has caused. Correction I will recover its going to take time but I will get through this. AVOID LORYNA  at all cost and any birth control that contains that synthetic hormones drospirenone.
Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is great! My last birth control made me not want to have sex! This one does and it’s made my boobs bigger!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I think this birth control is okay. It makes me really moody sometimes especially on my period I only get nauseous, heavy bleeding, headaches and cramps but other then that it’s not bad I have gained plenty of weight being on it and I get paranoid ONLY on my period. It seems impossible to get off the weight but it could be because I’ve been on pills for 5 1/2 years straight to make sure it’s a better chance I don’t have a child. When not on my period I get really sad sometimes for no reason at all.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):As I read through the comments I want to remind everyone that we all have different bodies. Personally I have a high level of hormones and tend to break out often. I have tried multiple brands and have had pretty bad symptoms. I tried this brand and like all BC the first few weeks I had symptoms especially nausea as my body was getting adjusted. I’ve been taking this brand for about 2 years and now have beautiful skin and short/ less painful periods. If you have similar issues as I did I would highly recommend giving this brand a try. Hope this was helpful for other women who suffered from acne and elevated hormone levels.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is the absolute worst birth control! I was taking the name brand Yazmin for years and I  never had any issues with it. I moved and the the pharmacist gave me the generic brand Syeda. I didn’t have any issues with it until 2 months in. I started experiencing the WORST anxiety and panic attacks, spotting, and the worst cramps. I have never had any of these issues before nor did I ever have anxiety or panic attacks until I started taking this. Do yourself a favor a steer clear of Syeda.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):When I started I didn’t feel any side effects, I expected tender breasts, I had no weight gain, no mood swings, even three months in and my skin started to clear up.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I see so many negative reviews for Loryna but I thought I would write a positive one because there's probably a girl out there who was just like me and scared to death to switch birth controls because of all the horrid reviews. I took generic Ortho Tri Cyclen (Trinessa) for several years because I have acne alongside my need for BC. Ortho made me into a lunatic. It ramped up my emotions to the point of me damn near becoming psychotic. When I gave birth to my daughters I tried the Copper IUD, had it almost 3 years but got sick of the CONSTANT bleeding I was having. decided to get back on Ortho Tri Cyclen (this time called Tri-Lo-Mili) and immediately became a raging psychopath after only a few days of taking it. Now granted, I would've stuck it out, but I remembered how I was during the 3 years of Trinessa and the feelings were the exact same. I switched to Loryna and the first day there was immediate mental relief. I've had 0 negative side effects. Love this BC so much.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I never ever write user experiences but I HAD to with this one. I had a baby in March 2020 and went onto the pill July 2021 (writing this in March 2022) - I went onto the pill and loved that it basically got rid of my period, I hardly ever bled. But I was SEVERELY anxious, borderline depressed. I went to see a psychologist and a psychiatrist for the first time in my life (I am 28) and I was basically diagnosed with delayed post partum depression. I never went onto the antidepressants because my gut told me not to. I am now off the pill for a mere 8 days and I feel better than I have felt over the past 9 months. I cannot believe the impact the Yaz had on my mental health!!!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Yaz because I wanted to switch from my old birth control. My gynecologist suggested Yaz because of the less days off of hormones. I finished out my last pack of my old pill and switched to Yaz. About 2 days into it I had severe stomach cramping. I didn’t put two and two together, I missed work for 2 days and honestly thought I was constipated. The cramping continued once I returned to work, it was throughout the day and food seemed to subside it at times. It would really hurt in the middle of the night and in the mid-afternoon. I debated going to the hospital or doctor to figure out what was wrong.Fast forward through the whole pack, I got the the placebo pills. Within two days the stomach cramps were gone. I thought whatever was wrong was better. I took my first hormone pill on  Sunday, and Monday I had intense cramping again. Not everyone is the same, so it may work for you, just was not a good experience for me

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Took it for about 4 years, before I had the Diane for some years which is similar. Now I’m off it for also 2 years, using a copper IUD. Looking back, the Diane had me more depressed. The Yasmin gave me amazing spotless and vital skin, bigger boobs, nice smooth shiny hair, less peach fuzz on the rest of my body, stable mood, easy periods. The whole last year with the copper IUD has been horrible. In the 2 years without the pill my boobs shrunk incredibly, my sex drive is less, hair is very hard to manage and has a different structure, my skin has a lot of acne and wrinkles and the peach fuzz got a lot worse again. Really considering getting back on the Yasmin.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Loryna for about 9 months now. I have PCOS and struggled with heavy periods (sometimes twice a month), horrible cramps, mood swings and acne. Since starting Loryna I'm now able to skip my periods all together getting rid of almost all my negative side effects (still get pretty emotional around the time my period would come). I did gain about 10 lbs and my motivation to workout is almost pretty low. I used to go to the gym 5 days a week and eat healthy. I now crave unhealthy foods more and dread the gym. Maybe this is just an excuse lol but I had to stop for about two weeks due to my prescription being shipped to a previous address and immediately my motivation to workout and eat healthy came back. But back to a positive note: my skin has never been clearer and I would recommend this birth control to a friend in a heart beat.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on this pill for 2 years. The first year and a half was good. Lost weight, cleared acne etc. However, now I am severely tired all the time, my periods are still 7 days long, I have extreme anxiety which is causing relationship breakdowns and constantly crying. I don recommend this pill.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I used this horrible pill for 10 years. It caused me to have horrible mood swings, rage outbursts, changed personality and suicidal thoughts. Last year after having harmed myself I thought I'd quit the pill and turns out the self harm and horrible angry jealous anxious thoughts went away. I'm still a nervous wreck though. I felt like I had no control over my emotions, I was scared I would harm myself, my pets or loved ones. Stay away from this pill, please. Especially if you already suffer from anxiety and depression. Don't wait for the symptoms to go away.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Nikki just around 5 months ago and it works great for me! I began taking it for my extremely irregular periods and the more obvious reason. Since taking it, my acne has significantly cleared up and my period has become completely regular now, coming at the exact same time every month with minimal cramps. It's also free with my insurance. The only downsides are that I cry more easily now (although I've always been a sensitive person so that's pretty normal for me) and I have more frequent migraines, but I've always had migraines and I'm not sure if it's the pill that has caused that.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yasmin for over 15 years. I have never had any issues other than switching from the Name Brand to the generic. This pill never gave breakouts or adverse reactions. My only issue is that my insurance company refused to cover the cost since it is the Name Brand. I have tried the generic and it is not the same. It produced greater PMS symptoms and also gave me hormonal acne. I am now 33 and considering going off the pill altogether in fear of starting something new. Has anyone else stopped Yasmin? If so could you please share your experience? I am a bit nervous - (not about having a baby) but any side effects from stopping the hormone??

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Everyone has different experiences, Yaz was not the pill for me. I was on it for 3 months, and while I was diligent about taking it and it did prevent pregnancy, the side effects I had to switch pills. My mood swings were AWFUL. One minute I’d be fine, and then I’d be biting someone’s head off for no reason and then I’d be sobbing for no reason. It also made my period symptoms worse. The cramping was bad! I had zero sex drive and my bleeding was heavier then I had experienced since middle school. It also did nothing to help with my acne, which I was really hoping it would. I am almost 26 and I’ve been on birth control since I was 14, but stopped for a year or 2 before I got into a serious relationship. This pill does not work for everyone.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I decided to try YAZ after a bad experience with a different contraceptive pill when I was 18. I'm now 21 and have been on Yaz for 6 months with no luck. Whilst it cleared my acne well, the depression and anxiety that came with it has been unbearable. I have never suffered from any mental health issues in the past and it wasn't until reading these reviews about similar experiences that I realised I'm not crazy. I started having serious issues with my partner and I actually started blaming and resenting him, thinking he was the reason for my change in self confidence, happiness and overall mental wellbeing, I didn't even consider the pill until now. Not only that, but the anxiety has caused me to lose 5kg (making me quite under the healthy weight range) as I feel too sick in my stomach to have an appetite. I have also been continuously spotting for the last 4 out 6 months, contributing to my already low iron levels. Time to cease using YAZ.
Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It didn’t cause depression for me. I lost weight and my boobs got bigger. It’s easy to use

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):hi guys, I just started Nikki, and I had no side affects whatsoever I feel great. I do not feel any different, but I've actually have a higher sex drive??? hahaha if you are afraid of trying this please don't.  I was scared to and I'm doing fine, but I guess it depends on everyones different bodies. OH one more thing, I think I'm losing weight with this!!!!!! Like gurrrrllll idk if I'm crazy but I'm literally weighting myself everyday now hahah.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on BC before but had issues with depression. I tried Loryna and am 2 months in and can’t take it anymore! I have had headaches, probably gained weight, increased hunger, depression worse than I’ve ever experienced- crying over absolutely nothing off and on the first month then it stopped for a few weeks and it’s back worse than ever with intense mood swings! I have had brain fog, fatigue, and the mood swings/irritability that happened in the 2nd month have affected my life and relationships! I feel unable to control my emotions and I’m sure I seem crazy to the guy I recently started seeing! I hope this pill hasn’t ruined my relationship but I know it’s made me a crying, irritated, bloated lunatic! I’ve worked hard to be an easy going, emotionally stable adult but this pill makes me feel like I’m 2 sheets to the wind ugly crying and angry like I’m on a whisky bender. I don’t even drink anymore. I do not recommend!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am three weeks into my pill pack, and for the past six days, I've cried every day, lashed out at my friends, and contemplated suicide. I've dealt with anxiety and depression in the past, but before starting it, I was in a very good spot mentally. I can't say for certain that this pill caused my psychotic break but I've never experienced something like this before. Thank you to all the women who have posted on this, sharing the same struggle. While the pill affects people differently, if you've struggled with mental issues in the past, I highly recommend looking for a different option.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking Yaz a little over two years now, and it’s decent, but I honestly feel like it hasn’t done much for me. I started when I was 15, and my cycles are the same as they were before. My acne did clear up, but I also got older and stopped soccer, so I wasn’t sweating all summer, so there could’ve been that correlation too. There’s been no help with my mood or emotions and it’s starting making me very bloated, even though I’ve had the same exercise regime. I do think it’s made me more prone to anxiety and intrusive thoughts, but it hasn’t been debilitating. I think I’m going to look for other solutions, mostly because it isn’t really doing much for me besides making me a little unstable.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Yaz for about 5 years now, loved it at the start, I have reasonably clear skin I skip my periods and don’t have spotting I don’t have any mental side effects however it has given me major gastrointestinal problems pretty much IBS when reading reviews and info make sure you find long term info other than that major issue it’s not to bad except the price $$$

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I took Yasmin for almost 20 years, from age 18 years old to 37 years old. I never experienced ANY unwanted side effects. My period came every month like clockwork, I could literally time it to the clock. My periods were 5 days (only Monday thru Friday) and light. I never once experienced any spotting or breakthrough bleeding. I scheduled my life around its perfect predictability. I can count on one hand the number of times I missed a dose. I’ve recently had to stop taking Yasmin for my age and other risks for VTE. I miss it dearly and am at a loss about what to transition to because all other non-estrogen methods do not regulate cycles and are not predictable like Yasmin.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill sent my daughter into 18 months of a pure nightmare - of suicidality, depression, and overall psychotic behavior. Uncontrollable mood swings every single day. Doctors could never find a solution - until I finally found a professor in Australia doing the profoundly critical work on this pill. She has reams of data supporting others suffering from this pill. And we attended a stand up comedy night - and one comedian did a bit on how insane YAZ makes you - and the entire auditorium cheered in unison - hundreds of women- acknowledging this shared perspective. My daughter and I gasped with an A-HA moment. Within 5 weeks of coming off this pill - after 18 months taking it - my daughter was a totally different human being. She is now on Lolo. and things are great.YAZ should be illegal.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been taking Yaz for almost 10 months now and it has been the best pill I have ever been on. I am taking it for hormone replacement as well as acne issues.During the first month of taking the pill, my skin went through a horrible purge which lasted about three weeks. After that was over, my skin began to improve daily. I rarely get breakouts now (occasionally a single pimple), my hair is so thick and healthy and my sleeping has improved immensely.I have found my moods have been really stable whilst on this pill and have had zero issues with spotting.I have lost about 12 kg since I commenced this pill and that was during lockdown and with minimal additional exercise. I highly recommend this pill if you need to regulate your hormones  and want to improve your skin, hair and lose some weight in the process!

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Syeda for almost 5 months. I like it , periods have been fine. BUT I have severe breast pain before my period, never experienced the heaviness and tenderness with other birth controls as bad as while on this. I have noticed weight gain but nothing crazy. I for now am going to continue taking it

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Makes me feel very very moody. Lots of crying and feeling unhappy. I’ve been on it over a year and it’s time to change because this one isn’t making me feel good at all.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Loryna was the first-ever birth control I've ever taken and I've been using it for around five months. At first, I had nausea spells and my boobs were really tender but that went away within the first month or so. Before taking it, I had the worst cramps imaginable and there was never a time where my skin was clear. Since taking it, my periods are light, I don't cramp at all, my skin has cleared up tremendously (still breaking out on chin/cheeks a bit but that could be from me wearing a mask at school/work/etc. ) and my boobs actually went up a cup size. The reason I'm actually switching to another pill though is because of my mood swings and the weight gain. I have been extra irritable and sensitive to the point where IDK how I acted before the pill and since taking the pill, I've gained 15 pounds. I am scared of switching since Loryna was good for me, but I want to see if there is a pill that will help my mood, clear my skin up more, and get myself back to my regular weight.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill was fine at first.. but it gave me so much anxiety after about a month. I don’t recommend this to anyone anymore. My depression has become so bad and the weight gain is out of control. i’ve never had this experience with birth control so I don’t recommend this to anyone that’s suffering with anxiety already. It is effective in the sense that it will prevent pregnancy, but the effects are ridiculous so please be safe if you use this!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had taken this pill for PCOS for 6 months and that was probably the worst time of my life when I suffered from severe anxiety and depression. While I lost 6 kgs weight and had clear skin, on the other hand I lost my sleep and sanity! The most difficult phase was my mental condition after I stopped taking the pill that I had to seek medical help to get out of that condition! It is strongly advised not to take this pill especially if you are already suffering from any kind of mental health issue.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Loryna has been the only bc that works for me. I have switched and had multiple issues with other medicines, and always switched back to loryna. These low reviews did not sit true with me.  It’s been great for me!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I wish I would have read these reviews before I had taken this birth control. I feel like doctors don't warn us enough about the side effects so many women report about this. Then again for profit medicine is just about the bottom line not the welfare of the patients. I lost an alarming amount of hair, I've been religious about rogain to help it come back, I changed my doctor to someone who is helping me get my hormones back to normal, and I recovering from clinical depression that it caused. My hair has just started to come back 8-9 months later. This medication really impacted my life and wellbeing. My story is just one of millions I've found out and not even the worst which scares me and should scare others. I've never felt like a medication should be banned so strongly. Please do not take this medication if you value your physical and emotional health.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 19 sexually active in college, etc. This pill does it’s job preventing pregnancy for sure, but as soon as my cvs switched me from Gianvi to Loryna I have been very disappointed. It works, but my sex drive has never been lower. It’s almost as if nothing excites me and because of this I have been extremely depressed since my switch this past summer. The first pack I took really affected my body and I was bloated worse than ever, but thankfully that did go away eventually. My periods haven’t really changed. Don’t know if i’d recommend because it affects people differently. the main reason I want to switch is because of my significantly decreased sex drive and depression

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve never had a problem with birth control until I started taking Syeda. Worst pill for my body and I’m worried it won’t protect against pregnancy. I have so much acne- new ones come every day! Bleeding all month, so tired, can’t stop eating, migraines increased and major insomnia. I’ve gained a lot of weight in 2 months .  Took for 2 months and just stopped. My doctor said my Nikki birth control wasn’t covered anymore by insurance so she put me on Syeda . If it has the same ingredients as Yasmine and Yasmine was recalled because they found it doesn’t prevent pregnancy efficiently, then why would anyone take this??!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on this pill for about 2 months now and my period has been going for 15 days and counting. It’s been a constant heavy flow with cramps out of this world!  This medication is very concerning because I am over all a very happy person but I have gotten severely depressed within the past month to the point where my mind is uncontrollable with bad thoughts. I do not recommend this product to anyone.
Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Should be banned. Mood swings, depression, nightmares, weight gain, aggressiveness to name just a few. Almost ruined my relationship.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've taken birth control since I can remember but when my dad lost insurance I was off of it for maybe 6 months and felt the best and was the most happy I had ever been. I started taking Nikki about 4 months ago and I feel like a zombie. I cry at least twice a day and am constantly angry or depressed when nothing is wrong. I am extremely aggressive for no reason. After coming to the internet for help because I could not take this any longer I threw my pills in the trash! It's amazing how much it has changed my life in such a short amount of time. Please, do not take these.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Please don't take Yasmin. It cleared my skin up don't get me wrong. But the mental health effects aren't worth the risk. My already poor relationship with food developed into bulimia and I also became really depressed on this pill. I questioned my relationship with my boyfriend, I had no energy to do anything, for days at a time I couldn't bare to leave the house. Please don't do this to yourself.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Before loyrna I was on so many different bc I tried Lo Lo Estrin FE, Sprintec, etc. I struggled with BAD hormonal acne and mood swings. My doctor prescribed Loryna for my acne and I was hopeful. The first three months were pretty nauseating and I lost weight but at about 6 months I started to notice a difference in my skin and mood as well as a big increase in my breast size. I’m currently a year into it and my skin is PERFECT, my periods are short and so manageable, my moods are much more leveled out and I feel great. I had a great experience with this bc and don’t be scared to try it!!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yaz for 4 years now, I first went on it to clear up my acne and because my periods were really heavy. Since starting it my acne has completely gone away except for when it comes around to my period I get a few whiteheads, and my periods have been way less heavy and don't last as long, I haven't had any negative side effects besides my boobs growing a size.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on rikka before and it made me so angry all the time and depressed so, I have gone to my doctor told her about the irregular moods I had she had told Nikki will be a good match for my irregular moods she said " It would help calm the moods down". I was so excited about it because I wanted to feel normal again after the first week of taking Nikki I was calmer feeling normal. Then, through time has been going by I have been feeling so bad, depressed, Anxiety attacks throughout the day I will have anxiety attacks 6 times or more a day and I will literally cry a lot when I said A LOT I MEAN A LOT. I would be more sensitive than ever. The angry I was so fired up I would get mad so fast and easier I really didn't like it. Nikki makes you feel sick, pregnant, bloated, and  I would have bad headaches that I wouldn't even process throughout the day. Also, I have been taking Nikki for 8 months and I feel like Nikki changed my whole emotions and me as a person I thought I was tripping but, it was fr.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I really thought this birth control was working great for me at first, as my acne was clearing up and unlike other birth controls like Larissa, it did not make me feel like I was in a fog 24/7 and depressed. It stabilized my moods. However, after working out (day 5 of the first day pack) I noticed a vein in my pointer finger, discoloration, and pain that was getting worse. I have never had a vein show in my finger, so I immediately realized I had 2 blood clots: one in my middle finger, and one in my pointer finger. I have tested negative for Factor Five (a blood clotting disorder) and do not smoke. I was already hesitant to start this birth control considering the lawsuits, but my PCOS/ endometriosis is a huge problem and leaves me in pain 24/7 that I’m desperate to try anything that works. I feel like this was a blessing in disguise because thank god it was only a blood clot in my finger. Some women have died from blood clots in the brain and heart from this drug. Listen to reviews.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz caused severe mood swings for me. I have been on 20mg escitalopram for GAD for 1 year. Medication worked well for me. When I started taking yaz, escitaloprams effect was counteracted and severe anxiety returned. Within the first 10 days I had 3 panic attacks and chest tightness. I found myself frequently angry and fought with close friends over nothing. I couldn't do my job properly due to the feeling of overwhelming anxiety. Please do not go on this medication if you are on escitalopram or have severe anxiety.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Been on this pill for 3 years now. Really really worked. Balanced my appetite, helped me maintain my weight, got a lot of compliments on my skin, and no effects on my mental health compared to Levlen which really messed my mental health and weight up. I went on this pill because all of my close friends suggested that it was good. However, 3 years latter my eyesight started getting worse and I went to the optometrist recently and she told me that combination pills causes your sclera to thin overtime! What! I have to wear glasses now and I used to have 20/20 vision! I constantly have dry eyes and can't fight any allergens or foreign particles with my eyes, have constant itchy eyes and blisters on the skin around my eyes due to constant itching! If I knew this would be a side effect I would not have taken it. There’s nothing anywhere that says it.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I took it for a week and the first couple days were fine, but by around the third day of taking Ocella I started to feel extremely irritable. Every little thing would make me super upset, that usually I wouldn't get so upset over. I also felt super anxious and depressed. It's like every ounce of positive feeling and self love has disappeared out of my body. I stopped after a week because it is not worth feeling this way. I know it can affect everyone different but I personally have had a bad experience.

Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Loryna for almost a year with NO symptoms except breast enlargement and they switched me over to vestura. It was horrible. I was crying for no reason and I’ve just NEVER been the type. Been discontinued for a reason ladies.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is the worst birth control I have ever tried. I have had nonstop migraines that no painkiller could help, even at the ER. It’s been a whole week of so much pain. Get off this immediately.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I suffered with painful periods and extreme bloating and gastro  issues week before and after periods.I take Yaz (Eloine in UK) as advised with 4 day break, I have no period at all which is great. Also all my problems with endo belly are gone. My mood is stable on Eloine/Yaz. Was very worried about putting on weight but I feel there is not much I can blame on the pill (I hope!), I have put a bit on but I could blame not exercising and not so great diet at times. No bloating any more.Breast increased quite a lot, think my body shape changed a bit too. My skin and hair are good.I’m 33. Been on it over 2 years now. I tried once to have a break from this pill, first month was ok, second I had all my symptoms from the past and heavy period so I came back to this pill after 2 months, stopping it and starting made my mental health really bad, I was depressed, panicky, anxious and had extreme  anger  at times, however it settled with taking the pill and I’m very stable.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Been on it for approximately 10 years. I had no crazy side effects. Maybe a bit of weight gain, libido loss. It took away the minimal acne I did have. One thing I have been noticing maybe the last couple of years is terrible migraines on the placebo week. Like constant, will not go away with 6 (spread throughout the day) advil/tylenol/excedrin. Because of this I am considering getting off of it and giving my body a break.  But all in all I wouldn't say this birth control was terrible.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My pharmacy gave me Syeda in place of Ocella. I had taken Ocella for years and zero problems with it. After only taking Syeda for a short period of time I felt weird /anxious and had insomnia. I do not recommend Syeda.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Yaz a few months ago after I had terrible effects from Blisovi and I am beyond pleased with this birth control. Works well as a contraceptive but that’s not all. I had HORRIBLE cramps, long periods, and excessive bleeding before starting Yaz. It’s been a couple months now and I’ve never felt better. I haven’t had any cramping whatsoever, my periods have gotten so short that they last one to two days (It typically lasted 3-4 days before Yaz), and the bleeding is light and basically just spotting. I also haven’t had any bad side effects like I had on Blisovi, no more mood swings, month long cramping, not as depressed, no more nausea during and before periods. This pill has completely changed my periods and it no longer feels like the nightmare it was lol. Would definitely recommend Yaz :)

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have had to go on Yasmin twice in the past few years In 2020 in around January I believe is when I first started taking the pill. the reason I had to go on it was because I had my period for 17 days and when I went to the doctor this was the only option given to me. I was definitely a lot more irritable on the pill and smaller things would make me cry. It worked for what I went on it for though, I had a regular period cycle. Due to things shutting down during covid in around May I wasn't able to get my prescription refilled which I was secretly thankful for because the side effects bothered me a lot. Again in 2021 in April I had my period for a month straight the reason I waited so long to go to a doctor this time was bc I knew they were going to put me on birth control which they did again it worked for what It was prescribed for I am still on it now in November 2021. I feel like. I've gotten used to being depressed and often thinking of suicide.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This was the most horrendous experience of my life. Yasmin totally destroyed my brain chemistry/hormone levels, leading to a multitude of crippling changes to my personality, confidence and ability to live. I am shocked this is allowed to be given out to otherwise healthy, happy young women. It could be repurposed as an instrument of torture. My advice is DO NOT TAKE IT.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking this pill on the 27th October, it’s now the 5th November and I have never felt so depressed and anxious In my whole life. As someone that struggles with anxiety anyway I'm aware of the everyday struggles but with this it’s totally severe. I feel as if I can’t do anything without obsessive thoughts that something is going to happen and having this impending doom feeling though there is absolutely nothing wrong within my life? As a whole other than very sore boobs I have had no other side affects but after only 1 week taking this pill I am stopping before it gets any worse.  ⚠️DO NOT RECOMMEND⚠️

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking Yasmin over 5 years ago to clear my chin acne caused by PCOS. While it did clear my skin and made my periods lighter my mental health deteriorated more and more. I thought I was going crazy, crying uncontrollably over small things, snap at people, have suicidal thoughts. I also had heart palpitations which I thought was anxiety. It wasn’t until I spoke with others who also experienced the same and saw these reviews that I put 2 and 2 together, and have stopped taking it. Clear skin is not worth the emotional rollercoaster this pill causes!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):For anyone considering Yaz, I just need to stress the importance of exercise while on this pill. I am currently on my 2nd packet of Yaz, and so far it has been extremely up and down. The first month was great, my period was light, less cramps, no mood swings, weight loss. However the middle of the second month anxiety and depression hit me so hard. I kept having horrible self-depricating thoughts, would often cry myself to sleep and find it difficult to have a fun time, and I got kicked out of my friend group. Even my relationship with my boyfriend went really bad, however he was very understanding through it all. Yaz has calmed down a little, however I still get irritated very easily and usually overthink more than normal. Not as much depression though, it's more just anger and irritation. However, I found exercising regularly with high intensity cardio (running, biking etc) really improved those nasty thoughts and moods.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Terrible experience. Was on it for 10 days before coming off. Had extreme anxiety and depression, crippling panic about my relationships. Mood was stable before. Feel a huge wave of relief now that I’m coming off if it.
Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):this is awful, it has me feeling sick like a dog

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've not been taking this pill for very long but its been the worst few days. I am taking it for Irregular and bad periods and now  I've suddenly started to feel depressed. I constantly get really upset and sometimes shake. This pill is supposed to help acne but I had completely clear skin and now its already breaking out on my cheeks and chin. No weight gain or weight loss but awful depressive mood that you cant get rid of. I don't think I will be able to continue much longer on this pill for my mental health. I'm not sure if its something that will settle with time  but i feel awful.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I got switched from Yasmin to Syeda and I had never heard of Syeda so I read all of these reviews and STILL decided to try it out which was the biggest mistake of my life. I didn’t notice all that much my first month on it but I started the first week of my second pack and I am going to burn the rest I cannot believe how awful my skin has gotten in such a short period of time I have large painful cystic acne on my cheeks and the most insane redness! I’ve also gotten Keratosis bumps on my legs which I have never had before. My mood has changed so much I feel like I’m not even in my own body at times. I know it works for some but honestly I wouldn’t even give it a go just stick to what’s working for you. Wish I listened to the awful reviews on this because I am suffering from it now:(

I’ve been on and off this birth control for a few years now. It seems I’m one of the lucky few that have been put on this, experiencing little to no negative side effects (nausea sometimes and weight loss). This pill helps me feel alive, brings back my spark, energy, glowing skin and sex drive!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Take the pill with food, do not take it with empty stomach. The side effects are strong, dizzy, moody, and others. I lost weight with this pill, comparing others.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been off hormonal birth control for almost a year. 2 days on Yasmin, and I feel ill. Similar to how I feel when I am about to get my period. I have had to take 3 tums today to keep my acid reflux at bay. I don’t think I’m going to keep taking this. I hope I did not throw whatever cycle I was adjusting to out of whack too much because of this. Time to abstain as protection

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yaz for slightly under a year for birth control and for regulating my periods. During this time, I had light, almost painless periods. I also enjoyed ultra clean and glowing skin. However, I started getting very bad migraines. I already suffered from migraines before this but I was getting 2-3 migraines a week. My hair also dropped out in CLUMPS. After speaking with my dermatologist I gathered enough courage to finally quit Yaz in September 2020. I started breaking out like crazy and my skin was much, MUCH worse than it ever was prior to being on it. My skin is still like a war zone more than 1 year after quitting it and I deeply regret putting myself on Yaz. I had a light period and it disappeared for a few months. I had to be put on 2 months of norethisterone to trigger my period. It came, but it disappeared again for a few more months. It was only in September 2021 that my period finally came back on its own with super painful cramps; I feel like a hormonal teenager again.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control has got me all messed up. Literally. I was prescribed Yasmin when I had breakthrough bleeding with Freya. I was on Yasmin a little over a year and during that time, I started to question all of my relationships. I cried everyday. My hair was falling out and breaking. I felt crazy. My anxiety was through the roof, I didn't sleep and rarely ate, especially because my self esteem became so slow. Now after stopping Yasmin, it has messed up with my fertility. I had normal periods and a normal cycle before going on the pill, all together I was on birth control for 2 years. Now I get a period every 2 and a half months, sometimes shorter, sometimes longer. They vary too, sometimes I'll only spot for a few days and another time I'll bleed for the whole 7. I have been off Yasmin for over a year now and I'm at a loss on what to do. No one will give me solutions except to go back on birth control or start fertility drugs. When did the only solution go to taking drugs ?? Be warned.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):BEWARE! I’ve never had issues with birth control pills before or mental health issues. Within a month I noticed a huge change. Depressed, horrible anxiety, crying everyday and felt completely worthless. It got to the point where I was terrified of what was happening  and so was my family. I finally linked it to the pill and stopped. I felt SO much better once it was out of my system and back to how I was before. I understand everyone responds to medications differently but please be cautious in regards to this medication. Very scary.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this for about 3-4 years. The first year - two was great, I had clear skin and periods were fine, no depression. My Dr recommended this to help clear my acne. It did about that. EXCEPT, after 3 years I would get recurrent BV and yeast infections from antibiotics. Gyno had no idea why I kept getting so many. One at least every month! Break through bleeding that would happy for a week to a few days before my period. Zero sex drive. I finally stopped taking Nikki bc I couldnt stand bleeding for a week every month before I would get my actual period. It has been 2 months off it and I have no more break through bleeding. Although my first period off Nikki was extremely painful and heavy

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I didn’t notice any difference in myself until I stopped taking it, been off it for nearly 1 year. Looking back I was a different person I used to cry for no reason at any time, serious mood swings & huge breasts, Yasmin really affected my mood and confidence. When coming off I lost a lot of weight. However since coming off I’ve now got bacne which I never had before. Pros : not getting pregnant and clear skin on my back Cons : everything else

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am still on my first month of Yaz (day 20) but as the changes to better are so obvious I want to share my experience. Before Yaz I ate Diane 35 for PCOS symptoms for couple of years. I got so used to being moody and never knowing if the next day would be ok or filled with unexplained anxiety, crying and in general just annoyed about everything . I had started to feel that I am just a difficult moody person and I was looking to seek psychological help, as my moodiness started to negatively affect my relationship as well. Due to the high blood clot risks of Diane I decided to change the pill to Yaz. Within the first week of Yaz I felt that a cloud had been lifted from top of my head and I could see the positive sides of life again. I don't remember if I've been this calm and able to enjoy life during the time of taking Diane. I had some nausea, fatigue and stomach problems during the first days, but the positive effects on my mental state make all those side effects insignificant

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Absolute trash. Spotting every day since I started and crying and angry at literally every little thing. Do not take this horrible pill. Brand Ocella is much better.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):For 9 years I took Yasmin.  In terms of my periods, they were definitely lighter and more manageable but toward the last five years of taking it I had severe aching pains in my legs and glutes each time I had a period while on it.   Throughout this time I also suffered from vitamin deficiency’s, iron, b12, vitD and as a result I now have Osteopenia (low bone density), I also have stomach inflammation which my naturopath says is a result of taking this pill.  I lost a lot of my hair, have very dry skin, and brittle nails.  I’m no longer taking it, wished I got off it sooner.  Definitely not a pill worth taking for the long term.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I wanted Nikki tab to work for me, I really did. The first month or two was great. No acne, no weight gain, nothing. Then, about three months in- I had MAYBE one good week out of the month. After that, I was emotional, depressed, and having suicidal thoughts daily. Headaches & breast soreness/swelling started as well as other fluid retention. I do appreciate that it still never caused weight gain or acne, if I wasn't so emotional, I would have kept taking it. Everyone is different, so maybe it won't make you emotional.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was switched to this by my pharmacy and promised it was the same just a generic version of Yasmin. Lies. Increased appetite and EXTREME anxiety. I have never experienced anxiety like this in my life. Also insomnia. I had no clue what was going on. I thought it was stress from uni until I googled the name and anxiety and boom. Everything made sense. I will never take it again.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was 19 year old when I had to have an emergency life saving surgery as cyst bursted in my stomach. My stomach was filled with blood and I had no idea about my condition. After I recovered I was prescribed a pill that made me feel very ill, gained weight, was hungry all the time. When I was introduced to Yasmin. Literally saved my life. Lost all the weight I put on in no time as regulated my appetite, was feeling happier, more energy, no painful periods, regulated my periods. I was taking it for about a year and I fully recovered and I got pregnant 2 years later with a healthy baby boy. Haven’t had problems since.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Loryna for over 4 months now, and my experience has been great. Previously I was on a generic of sprintec and had issues with nausea, vomiting, mood swings, and difficulty losing weight. Since I've switched to Loryna all of those problems have disappeared and I have no side effects! This hbc works great for me, (21, 155lb, active lifestyle) and I’d recommend it to anyone interested!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 33 and have acne and terrible cramps. My doc put me on a pill to stop the pain and she said Yaz was great. My sister told me she developed acne on Yaz so she went off and that a friend of hers had suicidal thoughts. Well, maybe this should have deterred me, but I felt I should try because everyone’s different! So I tried the brand name and in the first few days I felt light headed. I also felt sort of snappy when I’m normally really easy going. WELL, on the morning after taking my 4th pill I FELL APART. I was pacing up and down the hall crying for no reason. I also could barely move or get up, my mental and physical abilities shut down. Thank god I wasn’t working. I called my doc through my tears and she said go off right away! She said I should try a pill that is opposite in formulation from the one that gives you bad side effects. If you try Yaz stop if you get those serious side effects!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I’ve been on this pill for almost two months now and I love it ! At first I was pretty emotional over food, mood swings, headaches and nausea. But on my second set of pills I’ve been feeling much better. Some side effects I get is occasional headaches, I get hungry more frequently (which was a good thing) I have bad eating habits and this made me want food more and I've had no weight gain on this pill. I think my boobs are growing which is not a bad thing. I was pretty scared to go on the pill knowing people get scary side effects but all reactions are different for everyone. Don’t scare yourself with the bad reviews. You know your body best. I love this pill and I hope it works great for you :)

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Nikki for a month and it is awful. Severe depression, bloating, can’t lose weight, GAINED weight. I missed a single pill and I’ve been spotting now for a month and the whole reason I was put on this rubbish was to control my period. I’ve had enough.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been taking the pill for a month and a week and it’s been the worst experience of my life. I am easily irritated, mean and severely depressed. I have negative thoughts and am full of mean thoughts and comments. I’ve got horrible anxiety about things that normally wouldn’t have bothered me and I’m a whole different person… and not a nice one either. I'm 24 years old and today I decided to stop taking the pill altogether. Hopefully my mental health improves.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Gianvi for one year before stopping. At first everything was great, regulated periods, clear skin, great sex drive. But as the months went on everything kept getting worse and worse. By the time I went off the pill, my placebo weeks were debilitating. I was wearing incontinence pads because my period was so heavy, I had cramps and back pain that kept me in bed and on tramadol. After going off I spent 3 1/2 months going through hormone withdrawal and landed in the hospital because of the withdrawal effects. Its not been 5 months and I have not stopped bleeding since going off Gianvi. My gynecologist and pcp have tried everything to stop my bleeding.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Favorite birth control of all time! I originally switched to ocella when my insurance quit covering Yasmin, and I’ve been on it for 10 years now! After 10 years I started having some brown spotting, so I may start to look elsewhere, but virtually no problems with anything on this pill. It makes me feel normal. I’ve had a really good experience with this pill! Period very regular and light, no mood swings, acne, or weight gain!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I love Yasmin! No real issues with it for the past couple years, except a little nausea here and there, but nothing that can’t be managed! No acne, no anxiety/depression, no mood swings, no weight gain! I will be sad if the day comes that I have to switch!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Started taking this in September 2019 and by November I was extremely depressed and deeply sad/emotional. I was suicidal for the first time in years and quit my job and moved city. Depression stayed until March 2020 then pandemic hit and I became very suicidal and addicted to alcohol for first time in life. Started depression medicine and felt a bit better. Came off the pill in June until November and was the happiest I've ever been but didn't link it to being off the pill. Went back on the pill and 1 month later had serious depressive episodes and suicidal ideation. Only now in August 2021 am I linking my Depression to this pill after hearing a friend had the same experience. Stay away from this medicine!

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I switched to Syeda after I had a horrible experience with nexplanon 3 months ago. I haven’t noticed any side effects from it so far. No weight gain, or mood swings. I am glad I finally found what works and doesn’t cause side effects.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Took Yasmin for 18 months. Experienced severe breast pain for the last 3 months and came off as I was in agony, despite tests coming back normal. 2.5 months after stopping the pill, my hair began shedding like crazy. 9 months later, I’m still loosing my hair and it’s so thin! Still no real answers for this, suspected telogen effluvium from the pill. It’s not growing back and my estrogen is rock bottom. Talking this pill is the single worst thing I have ever done for my health and I beg anyone out there considering to take this because it improves skin and doesn’t cause weight gain to think twice. As I took it for these reasons and am now incredibly depressed.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yasmin for a little over a year. I’ve noticed depression out of this world when I was always a happy go lucky person. I’ve lost my sense of humor as well. I never had this with past birth controls. I am going to the doctor tomorrow to switch back to an older one that I was on in the past. I wouldn’t recommend this to friend / family / or foe.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill was great with helping my acne and my cramps. My skin became really clear and overall my periods where a much better experience on this pill. Unfortunately the cons outweighed the pros. I’m not the type to ever have panic attacks I never have anxiety really but ever since the pill I had the worst anxiety attacks out of no where, it made me extremely paranoid. I’ve been off the pill ever since and I feel so much better never had another panic attack. I also gained a lot of weight on this pill but when I stopped the weight shedded off slowly and I’m back to normal now!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Absolutely horrible for me. I took this for over a year, and it gave me so much acne in the beginning. Horrible mood swings. This medication filled me with pure anger!! Loryna COMPLETELY destroyed my sex drive the entire time I was on it. It made my skin EXTREMELY oily. I hate this medication and I'm never taking it again.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It was okay. It was the first pill I was on so I thought all the side effects were normal. I’ve been spotting brown blood since I started it back in late March and very recently I started bleeding bright red blood during and after intercourse. As soon as that started happening, I got really bad migraines that wouldn’t go away. I just switched today. Other than that, it was good. I didn’t gain weight, I didn’t get acne, tender breasts were a thing but it wasn’t unbearable. I was also skipping the placebo pills so I didn’t have an actual period or breakthrough period at all.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yaz for about 7 months or so I think. I was experiencing this itch the whole time I think in different parts of my body. At one point there were itchy rashes all over my body (shoulders, chests, legs, arms, stomach, vulva, etc.) - The doctor couldn’t find the cause of the itchiness and I kept going back to the doctor for months! I don’t know if it was related to this pill or something else. My usual birth control pill came back in stock again, I asked my doctor if I should go back to that one again and he said probably not and he said Yaz is better for acne. But then my head was thinking that I didn’t have an acne problem, I had an itching problem. Later on I noticed that itch was listed as one of the side effects of Yaz in the papers it came with it. I would be interested to hear if anyone else had a similar experience.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on loryna for 2 weeks and LOVE IT. Before, I had painful hormonal cystic acne from nexplanon and the estarylla pill so I went off birth control for 4 months to take a break but I always had at least 5 cysts no matter how strict I was with my skincare. Since starting loryna, I noticed a HUGE difference. I only have 1 breakout right now and its flat. ITS A DREAM!! I feel confident in my skin again and tear up because it's been so long since I felt like this. I noticed my libido increased and boobs have grown which is great for my itty bitties. Also love that this pill didn't give me water retention/bloating. The only negative thing with Loryna so far is nausea every once in a while after taking it but nothing bad. I think I found my fav birth control and I'm so happy!!! I will update this once  am a few packs in tho.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I only rated it 1, because 0 was not an option. As soon as I started to use it, I developed headaches. I had a headache all day, every day. I also started to get migraines and I have never had a migraine in my life, nor did I really suffer from headaches. I got anxiety attacks to the point where I didn't want to walk through or pass a group of people in the supermarket. I cried every single day of my life and became extremely angry. I almost became an atheist, since all I was feeling was this immense darkness and pressure over me. Religion is very important to me, but just didn't see the need for it anymore. I started to hide under my desk just to escape the world. Saying that it was a horrible experience doesn't even justify what it put me through.

I’m only 3 days in and I feel horrible my body just feels out of whack this isn’t to discourage anyone, more so to see if I am the only one. I am a bit nauseous, breast are tender, I did experience spotting.  Also my body is sore like I’m really second guessing this but it feels like the cyst that form when I ovulate . I’m having a really hard time and I’m in tears writing this because that’s how bad I feel it’s only been today since it started hopefully it’s subsides
Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):been on it for over 4 years and have never had a problem! I love it

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Cerazette (Pop Pill) and I loved it but my doctor changed me to Yazmin as she said my spotting and irregular periods was due to a lack of estrogen. She said to take it for 3-6 months to regulate it again. I was only on Yazmin 6 weeks and it had ruined me. I often suffered with my mental health and I presumed it was bad until I started this pill. All I have done is cry and snap at my boyfriend and family, I have no sex drive and no desire to have sex which is not like me, my anxiety is through the roof and I've never been so depressed. I've been removed from it already. My migraines are back. They went while I was on Cerazette but I can honestly say that I thought I knew depression until now. Constant intrusive and dark thoughts and a lack of motivation. I'm only 23.. I shouldn't be this miserable.Do not take this pill!!!! It is horrible

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Nikki about 3 1/2 weeks ago, I swapped off of Slynd because it was the worst thing to happen to me. My weight has fluctuated so much so it’s hard to tell if I lost weight but I definitely feel better about myself. My skin was really bad the first 2 week and I've recently had bad skin which is why I switched to this pill. Not even but one little blemish on my face and I feel great. It is hard to tell on emotions because my last ones affected them so much but I am happier. I hoping to lose weight on this pill instead of gaining.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on this for 1 month, within days felt so sick like I was pregnant. After 2 weeks I felt extreme dread, anxiety, paranoia. I was sad to think this pill wasn’t working for my moods. 5 days before my period, I felt extreme stress paranoia and nearly fainted, each day become worse and the day before my sugar tablet I was severely depressed, crying not stop, panic attacks, feeling like I wanted to end my life. I’m going to see my doctor today to get their opinion because I feel like this is the pill. I am scared to stop it also as the past few days have already felt like I am coming down off drugs (sugars tablets) I feel so helpless and that I will never get better.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking Syeda in an attempt to regulate my period. I lasted 3 weeks on it. The worst side effect was horrible insomnia. I also had constant headaches, nausea, mood swings and anxiety. I haven't taken one of these pills in 10 years. I have had 3 children and a tubal ligation. The effects these medications have on your body are astounding and grossly downplayed. Many a relationship has been ruined by the side effects of the combined pill, anxiety, depression, mood swings. Do yourself a favor and get an IUD if you need hormonal birth control. I can't believe woman still have to rely on this stuff.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Felt absolutely horrible while taking this pill. I lost my will to do absolutely anything and experienced severe anxiety. I couldn’t enjoy any kind of activity and I did everything like a task. I even took antidepressants and started doing therapy and now I finally decided to stop the pill and hope to bounce back to myself quickly. So please stay safe everyone and be careful with this pill.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It’s disgusting that this pill is allowed to be given to girls. The side effects are a list as long as your arm and half of them aren’t even on the leaflet. I have felt like I have been losing my mind, I genuinely have been worrying about being sectioned because of the insane mood swings, fits of rage, depression, anxiety, all destroying my relationships. Hair loss - my hair is almost gone, so brittle and so thin and comes out by the shedloads in the shower. Also brittle nails- they’ve just been snapping off completely so I’ve had to wear plasters because it hurts so much. Had a blood test to see if I’m deficient in anything but of course I’m not. Confusion and grogginess - my work life has taken a massive hit because I’ve felt so dopey and forgetful and tired. Weight gain - a ridiculous amount. Sex drive- completely gone. This is the worst pill I’ve ever been on, yes your skin gets quite clear but this is NOT worth ruining your life for!!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I don’t usually write medication reviews but I felt like this one needed to be heard. I switched to Yaz from using Freya before. I switched because I was having a lot of hormonal headaches, acne, etc. The first month was terrible. EXTREME nausea, dizziness, no energy whatsoever and the worst symptom of all- the absolute worst anxiety of my life. After the initial month of dealing with the physical side effects, I was still left with crippling anxiety. Uncontrollable, always had a knot in my stomach, tightness in my chest, always on edge, couldn’t do day to day activities without feeling anxious. I stopped taking Yaz after month 3 because I couldn’t handle it anymore and I already feel much better.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Pros: Very few: Cheap and face was clear throughout using it.Cons: I noticed some changes in my body and mental health and wrote them down to talk to my doctor about at an upcoming appointment. I had been on Yaz for 14 years with none of these issues, but had to switch due to my insurance covering Yaz anymore and California not accepting the Bayer Savings Card. I didn't think my issues were from Loryna until I read these reviews. I had fuller breasts, was constantly bloated, gained weight with the weight specifically in my abdomen (despite no diet or exercise change), decreased aerobic fitness, decreased sex drive, and felt more "down" and self critical. I stopped taking it and within four days saw improvements- breast size decreased, feeling less bloated, more positive, and my sex drive increased. I ran this morning and it was my fastest time in months. Again, I had none of these symptoms during my 14 years on Yaz. I'm so glad I stopped taking Loryna!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Please please please do NOT take this pill , I am normally a very upbeat happy person the past few months have been terrible, I was on Yasmin pill I had really low mood, low energy, not wanting to get dressed and go out , bad depression!. I never even put it down to the pill at first was thinking why do I feel like this.  Then 4 weeks ago I thought to my self it’s gotta be the pill, I stopped the pill got the none hormone copper coil fitted and have never felt better - I'm feel back to my normal self again . Writing on any site is not the sort of thing I would normally do but I thought I had to share so dangerous the way it makes you feel xxx

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I just started taking this drug about 4 days ago. Was on YAZ before. Did this because it was free for me. I honestly enjoyed YAZ and it was good. Just heard this was the same thing... But yesterday I have never experienced the worst mood swings of my life. I never have had so much anxiety about the dumbest things. I just took it a couple minutes ago and then was thinking about why my heart was beating so fast. Come to these reviews and realize it’s this awful pill that has never made me feel so mentally dysfunctional. Will be tossing these awful pills out, for your own safety I do not recommend. I’m normally a very happy person and these pills have definitely made me overthink my whole life and obtain not even an hour of sleep because I was jittering the whole night... Typically I sleep 9 hours and fall asleep right away in less than 10 minutes. WORST EXPERIENCE WITH A PILL EVER.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yaz for one and a half months, and I had to get off it mid-pack. There are some good points, It made my period really light, and I had no cramps at all. Unlike other BCs that I have taken in the past, Yaz gave me the least breakthrough bleeding. There was little spotting the first few days and after it was gone which I thought was pretty great. However, it made me incredibly sad. I was soaking in this great despair and had no idea what the was going on with me. I am usually a positive lady and never felt like this in my entire life. My sex drive was lower than usual and I also got a yeast infection for the first time ever. I have a head full of hair and I started to lose so much within a month that I am completely shocked. My OBGYN advised I should be on the pill for at least three months so that my body gets used to it. I tried but the depression and hair fall are too much to bear in the middle of a global pandemic!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 41 and have suffered since my first child with cystic acne and PMD. I’m on my 6th month and am feeling amazing. My cystic acne is gone. I have no PMS symptoms and my period is literally nothing where it was previously heavy clotting and severe cramping. I do take Bupropion for anxiety and maybe that had something to do with not having the mood swings and emotional side effects others described?  I’m so pleased with how these hormones have balanced my body. I won’t change or alter this medication!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been taking this pill for about a month now, although of the bad reviews I have seen on it, I still decided to try it out. I only have 2 bad things to say about this pill and it’s that my breast have been hurting non stop since taking this pill, as well as it is also known to help acne, I find that my skin has gotten more pimples on my face. Maybe it’s because I’m approaching my period, or maybe it’s just the pill. But my breast have been non stop hurting which is unusual for them to hurt more then 1 week. Other then that I have not been into a depression like most people, or feeling too moody. I’m pretty much always in a good mood. I will try and continue this pill to see where it takes me, but if my breast still stay like this I won’t have a choice but to stop taking this pill.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I love this birth control I have taken on and off for many years, after a month of adjusting and taking it on time I do not have aide effects. I have less severe PMS and lighter periods. I was taking Yaz for PMDD I do not think it worked any better than Loryna..I have Great sex drive and have not gained any weight. I do feel as though my breast feel a tad fuller even though I have adjusted to the pill with time. I think this helps with water weight gain something I have suffered from due to PMDD. My skin stays clearer. Do not smoke on this pill. I would definitely recommend to those with severe PMS
Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Side effects included horrible sweats and I had horrible body pain, nightmares constantly when trying to sleep and frequent migraines.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking Yasmin only 2 weeks ago and I’m already stopping, I feel angry all the time, crying, not myself, I feel like a dark cloud is over me and feel like I have depression. It’s been nerve wracking leaving the house, going to work and it’s like I’m loosing my mind. I went on it to help with PCOS because of my irregular periods and PMS, feel like I can’t win, can’t find a pill that works for me and struggle with mood swings and hormones when I’m off the pill too. Would rather not be on Yasmin though, worse feeling down every day and like a different person. Do not recommend, looks like it’s rare that this suits anyone.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have only been taking this pill for two months. For the first month and break it was fine but ever since the second break I feel like I have gone insane. I am so so glad that I found this chat. I was feeling so low, had so many intrusive thoughts and irritable anxiety. I have been feeling very depressed and just want to hide in bed. No matter what I did or how much I tried to make myself feel better nothing worked and now I am considering getting therapy for the level of anxiety I have reached.  It also personally did not help with my skin, I’m not sure if that’s because I haven’t taken it long enough but for the sake of my sanity I can’t take it anymore. I am in my early 20s and it makes me so sad to think there are teenage girls who probably continue to feel this way and take this contraceptive pill.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I took this medication for about six months to treat PCOS and Autoimmune Thyroiditis. It successfully managed most of my symptoms, however I did notice that it caused me to have extreme anxiety, cramps, and bloating before my period, possibly to the level of PMDD (Premenstrual dysphoric disorder). It is definitely one of the better medications I have taken to treat my symptoms, but for me there were better options out there.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've gained 20 pounds in the 5 months I've been on this, I cry and am depressed and finding myself working extra hard to do activities that I normally love.  I have never had recurring yeast infections and have to treat them once a month now.  I also lost my sex drive and I suddenly have really bad melasma. I am stopping immediately and hopefully notice some improvement soon. Plus side to this was short and light periods but after the first 2 months zi had random spotting every month.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Personally it gave me HUGE AMOUNTS OF ANXIETY AND DEPRESSION. Before starting the pill I was a super happy normal person. After taking this birth control it was like my daily life was a struggle with anxiety and I was lucky to have a day without any symptoms. Absolutely horrible experience for me. I was taking it to control my PMS and severe cramping I get during my period and it did an amazing job with that but not worth the anxiety.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control is life changing, both in positive ways and negative. My hormones have completely straightened out more than what I was experiencing prior to starting this birth control back in February. Acne is cleared, the facial hair that has been growing has subsided. However....the negative part of this birth control...at least for me...is how reliant my emotions and mentality are on this prescription. I've forgotten to refill my prescription once and I was off of the pill for 5 days, I missed 5 days and I was  so crazy, insane, so much crying to my boyfriend, everything was wrong and off for me. I'm definitely more careful with this prescription and I take it regularly with my other meds every single morning.  Just be careful to not miss days! Other than that this has been the best birth control I've taken so far.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Actually one of the only contraceptive pills me and my body have gotten along with, did help to clear up my skin (although I believe spots were caused from a previous pill) however had to stop taking after having 2nd dose of AstraZeneca vaccine as I had resting heart rate of over 100bmp constantly and heart palpitations. This pill on average can make women 3x more likely to have blood clots and I don't think enough research has been done into the side effects of that mixed with Covid vaccines.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I don’t usually do reviews on birth control, but I thought I’d share. I used Yasmín (Ocella as the generic) for just over a year and in the past few months of using it, I have experienced horrible mood swings and anxiety. I have never been an anxious or moody, depressed person so this came as a shock to me and I knew it was the pill. I already feel significantly better after one day of going off  of this pill. Would NOT recommend to anyone struggling with anxiety.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m having the worst experience with Yasmin. I started taking it in March and I almost immediately experienced the side effects but I thought it would get better once my body adjusted to it. For a while I was better and out of nowhere things changed. I am overly emotional, I cry all the time, I have zero control over my emotions, I’m sad and depressed and it’s started to affect my relationship coz I’m starting to lash out at my boyfriend, I’m insecure and jealous and I believe the tricks that my mind is playing on me. I’m overly sensitive and take things way to personal. I have no control over my thoughts whatsoever and I have really dark thoughts. Today was my last day on the pill, definitely would not recommend it. Avoid it at all costs for your peace of mind.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Absolutely horrendous - went from 55kg to 68 kg and I’m only 5ft2 * in a matter of 3 months. I feel terrible about myself and I can’t fit into any of my clothes it’s ruined my summer. I’ve stopped taking it today so I hope that I can get myself back to feeling good enough to go out !

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Was fine for the first month, but started to notice my anxiety was worse, boobs grew (not completely a bad thing), gained about 10lbs, no sex drive and felt ill and awful about myself all the time. Do not recommend Yasmin for younger girls especially in their lates teens/early 20’s. Have not felt like myself since, have found it’s made me more stressed and anxious 24/7. Took my last pill Saturday and am not taking the next pack, not worth all the side effects.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):MOST USELESS PILLS EVER!! I took Ocella for years and my periods were light and guaranteed to start Placebo Pill Tuesday  or Wednesday. My insurance company started making us do mail delivery in ‘18 or ‘19 & changed my pills to a generic that didn’t even have a name, then started sending me Syeda in ‘19 & in May of ‘19, it’s like I’m not even on birth control pills anymore. I randomly start spotting, bloating, and cramping  at some point during the 3 week of active pills & have absolutely NO idea when or if I’ll start my period & have started my period while still on the active pills! I’ve started on Placebo Pill Monday, occasionally Wednesday, but mostly Thursday or Friday. Starting on Tuesday has completely stopped. My flow is absolutely unpredictable. My Ob-Gyn has me taking Lysteda to control the heavy bleeding that starts on day 1 & length ranges 4 - 9 days & has even gone for 3 straight weeks. These are seriously the worst pills.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started this in February and have noticed so much change in myself. I've gain my weight back that I worked so hard from high school to having my kid getting it off now it's back. Then finally got boob sized to go down now that's back and tender from taking these again.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I tried Sprintec and Tri Sprintec before this and experienced more migraines, anxiety, and heart palpitations. I’ve been taking this for over a year and experience only good things like less bloating, clearer skin, and stable mood. I do feel like I get dehydrated faster so make sure to drink more fluids with this. I would definitely recommend this if you have bad side effects from other birth control.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Was on Gianvi for about 2 years before CVS/Aetna switched me to Loryna.  While I was taking Loryna I was a raging lunatic the entire time.  I am typically a very laid back, easy going person, very non-confrontational, but on this pill, I literally could not control myself.  Every single thing made me so unreasonably mad.  I knew at the time I was overreacting to everything, but I couldn't help it.  I never felt so out of control in my entire life.  Eventually lead to me crying hysterically in CVS begging for them to fix my prescription, telling the pharmacist she should be in prison for changing my meds, causing a scene and getting kicked out.  After that I stopped taking the pill, and never returned to that cvs.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is the second birth control pill I tried after the first gave me very bad mood swings immediately, I’ve been on this for about a year and a half now and my periods are short and I know exactly when I am going to get it every month with no spotting in between, it has been like this since I started it. It also really helped with acne, I never got acne very bad but I would always have a few spots, now I very rarely break out and when I do it’s usually not that bad and I barely take care of my skin. The only bad thing I’ve noticed is how it’s affected my sex drive, I had no problem with it before I started this a few months after starting my current long term relationship and everything was great at first but about 6 months after being on it I had absolutely no sex drive anymore, a year after that it is starting to come back but I’ve had to take measures to help myself. Overall I like this birth control and it hasn’t caused any problems that negatively affect my life.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I know there are a lot of bad reviews but honestly I don't mind this birth control. I dealt with some tender breasts and noticed I cried more frequently and felt in general a little more sad but we’re also in a pandemic. I haven't noticed any other side effects which is why I feel it should be an 8/10. I think people tend to write reviews when they have a negative experience but people should know it’s not all bad. I have definitely noticed the effects here and there but I overall feel good and it doesn't really effect my life other than remembering to take it. I would recommend it. The only thing is the heightened risk for blood clots and other deadly stuff which sucks.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):10/10 for preventing pregnancy Made me very sad and irritated all the time.Made me bloated and had bad bowel movements.Absolutely zero sex drive I basically had to force myself to do it and I’m in a long term relationship so it wasn’t very good.I’ve been off of it for a week and WOW. Mood 100% improved.Sex drive is ALREADY back to normal!!! I’ll just stick to condoms now for preventing pregnancy because wow this birth control was not it.
