Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I changed to this pill after I was told to stop Dianette due to its increased risk of blood clots. I’d never had an issue on the pill previously. Since beginning this pill I have realised my mental health has slowly declined. This is probably the scariest thing as I didn’t actually realise how much I had changed as a person until it was already doing damage. I began having low moods, energy, and worst of all having such a lack of confidence compared to myself before this pill 8 months prior. Everybody is different and we will all react differently to contraception but I just want to let those know who don’t feel themselves on this pill don’t just brush it off and ask to change if you feel something isn’t right for you!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was taking the generic version of Yasmin off and on for 3 years. I would take Month long breaks because of the side effects I was experiencing. Recently I stopped the pill because of severe heart palpitations, the last episode lasted 20 minutes and I considered calling an ambulance. I would have left sided chest pain weekly. I was light headed when standing up. I had blurry, fuzzy vision constantly. When I was NOT running everyday I would instantly get sore, stiff calves. My hair is super thin at the crown, when I lift the crown hair up I can see the scalp two inches in. My mood is horrible, irritable, and depressive. I did have very dark thoughts and cried a lot. I cried even over happy things which is not how I usually am. I will never take this pill again. I recommend everyone to do their own research about Yasmin and the lawsuits others have filed. The side effects are real and life threatening.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yaz (and/or Yaz  generics) for over a decade now. I amcurrently taking it continuously (skipping the 4 placebo pills) as a preventative for Menstrual Migraine. It has worked wonderfully for me with regards to all intended aspects with very little to no side effects. I did try another popular low-dose bc pill for about a week years ago (I had a gap in insurance & got samples from my Gyn.) and it made my migraines significantly worse. I was happy to switch back, and have been extremely pleased with this pill overall!

Jasmiel (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I used to take another generic version of Yaz and it has no side effects but jasmiel has made my cramps worse and I often get heavy spotting and I’ve noticed my acne still flares up too, I’d recommend yaz or gianvi instead.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I haven’t gotten pregnant, I did gain like 5 pounds, but probably from quarantine and I have taken it off now. I don’t think it has affected my hunger. I have so much more hormonal acne though which was the purpose of taking this pill. I get monthly periods, but on the like 5th day of the inactive pills or when the inactive pill week is over it’s so weird. It took a whole year for the cramps and period to get lighter. I didn’t notice right away, but I think my mood swings are from this pill. Whenever my period is coming I feel like I need therapy and can’t control the way I behave to my boyfriend or family. I'm finally switching to Tri Lo Sprintec next month to give it a go. If it doesn’t work out I’ll go over to Junel Fe. I took that one for 3 years and felt fine and the only reason I switched was because I hoped it work clear my acne and improve my periods. While it did help the periods it took so long to work.
Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking them for only 3 days and noticed I've been having SEVERE ANXIETY & bad mood swings ... I do not recommend this birth control to anyone !!!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So in March I got infected by coronavirus and had side effects after recovery. One side effect or after effect of COVID was irregular periods. My gynac recommended Primolut N for about 5 days to kick start my periods but it didn’t really help. So I started taking Yasmin on suggestion by my doctor and let me tell what this pill does. It’s just so awful, it made me gain some weight, gave me acne, made me constipated and I was nothing but a walking catastrophe. Got severe anxiety and I cry CONSTANTLY. I’ve never felt so unstable in my entire life. Going off it in 2 days, really hope this pill has worked and that I don’t have to take it anymore cause if I continue taking this pill, I’ll have to go live alone as my family will not be able to tolerate me anymore.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Took this pill for about 2 years. It really affected my mental health, and it took me a while to realise that it was the pill. I was really depressed, anxious and crying despite nothing objectively 'bad' happening in my life. I also felt this tension throughout my body and didn't feel like myself. So glad that I'm off this pill now. As for skin, it didn't make my skin significantly better and potentially made it worse by all of the stress that I was experiencing.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Syeda for almost 2 going on years. I’ve never really had a major issue with it. I do find when I’m on my break week that I’m very emotional and I get upset by the slightest inconvenience. Other than that, I’m on track from Sun-Sat and when I’m on the break week my period doesn’t usually start till the Wednesday and I have a full 5-7 day period. Everyone’s body is different, find what works for you!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking Loryna about 3 months ago and I've never felt worse! I feel bloated all the time, get severe headaches (which I normally never get headaches), have gained stomach issues and to top it off I have put on few pounds. Plus, Loryna also makes me feel sad 24/7! And if I'm not sad the I'm having outrageous mood swings. This oral contraceptive is definitely not the one for me. However, everyone is different so take my experience as you please.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill helped my PCOS caused me to gain 8kg and my boobs are way larger. I’m really bloated a lot of the time when I eat any kind of fast food. The first few months on this pill I was quite emotional and bled constantly but this stopped after about 3 months and felt better. I got depressed when I stopped taking a pill for a break (which was advised by my doctor). But it made me so sad and anxious. I would cry every day and think that my boyfriend was cheating on me. I take a pill break to allow a break from the hormones which stops them from building up in my body and I feel way better. I started working out a lot to help my mood swings and anxiety which helped with mood. The pill helped my skin a tiny bit (I am also on oxytetracyline now which has helped so much in combination with the pill).  If you take this pill you need to be working out a lot and eating really healthy/just looking after yourself in general in order to minimise the negative effects. It is a good pill compared to others

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Sprintec and Zovia and I never ever had a problem with birthcontrol. I asked my dr to switch to Nikki (or generic) because I was not getting my period every month with Zovia and it was kind of freaking me out because I am sexually active and that’s how I know if I am in the clear. Once she switched me to Loryna I was very miserable. My mood was insane, I was crying and annoyed at any little thing. I had no control of my emotions. My stomach was also so messed up and I had a splitting headache. I know BC is different for everyone but damn I have never felt a reaction like this. I'm switching back to Zovia immediately

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been using Gianvi for over 5 years and have had a great experience. Clear skin, light periods, no weight gain, and no pregnancy :) My previous birth control made my hair fall out but it has grown back since I made the switch to Gianvi. My pharmacy always has a hard time keeping it in stock but I always insist on this brand vs another generic. If you’re having trouble, try a local pharmacy instead of the big chains.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I was on Nikki before and loved it, but my pharmacy was out and gave me Gianvi. The positives:No acneNo changes in sex driveNo weight gain (but I did go up a cup size)Negatives:Bloating, bloating, bloating.Unfortunately, I will be switching back to Nikki.
Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Wasn’t the best made me feel very down and tired all the time also had a lot of mood swings for no reason

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Took Syeda a week started feeling weak, tired and depressed. Second week my face started breaking out; now I stop taking them and my period started I’m guessing this is what it is because I’m  not due to start my period for a few more weeks.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had a pulmonary embolism from this birth control in 2011 and almost died. Literally died and was brought back to life. This pill leaves you 4x more likely to have a life threatening side effect than other birth controls. That being said, if it didn’t have that risk I would say it’s an awesome option because it kept my endometriosis at bag, I felt good, didn’t gain weight and wasn’t moody.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I went on Yaz about 8 months ago, my skin is pretty clear, during my period and stressful times my chin breaks out but that is normal. However,  I gained SO much weight 20 kilograms. Just like Peggy the other comment. My mood is fine however, I have depression but it has been very very manageable while on Yaz. I experience spotting but I'm not too bothered by it

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So, overall Yasmin has been pretty good! I was pretty put off by all of the reviews but I decided to give it ago because every body is different! Lets start with the positives- I feel less stressed about pregnancy (I still use condoms just in case though), my acne has stayed the same as it was when I took pills just for acne - providing I have a good routineNegatives- I had quite a lot of nausea which comes and goes but overall is manageable but can make me quite tired! I had a lottt of spotting and bleeding but I didn't find it much of an issue apart from the fact that I have to wear pads all the time. Sometimes I was a bit achy- especially my boobs but they definitely got larger! Before taking Yasmin, I had been diagnosed with depression and anxiety and my biggest concern about taking Yasmin was that I'd heard it makes your mental health worse, but for me it has stayed the same with sometimes feeling a bit more emotional over small things, but it's manageable!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The worst birth control I’ve ever been on. I was on it for 3 months and the third month I started experiencing awful anxiety and panic attacks to the point that I became very depressed. I have never experienced any of these things so to have all three come unexpectedly was scary. I finally got off of it and feel so much better. My anxiety isn’t bad anymore and no longer experiencing panic attacks daily. The worst experience on birth control that I’ve ever had.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I LOVE Nikki! I read several negative reviews when I was prescribed this birth control, but I still took a chance. Since starting, I have had no period whatsoever. My PMS symptoms have dramatically decreased. My skin is so clear I can’t remember the last time I had a significant breakout which is huge for me. I was surgically diagnosed with endometriosis 2 years ago, so having no period & no pain every month is amazing for me. I know every birth control is different for every woman, but I wanted to provide my positive review.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on microgestin for years and it didn't keep my periods regular. I have PCOS and I've been on Ocella for 4 months now my periods are regular now but they don't like to stop and it takes 3 days into the packet before it starts to stop my period. During the first three days I get really bad headaches where it affects my vision I am extremely nauseous and it makes the skin on my face flushed red and sensitive to touch not to mention hot to the touch. I'm kind of at a loss at this point I was told it would lower things and it's caused me to have IBS really badly. Among the issues I have in the first few days of restarting this pill. Very mixed feelings about this pill!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on birth control for over 10 years. First Yaz, then Ocella. I was on Ocella for about 7 years. After I quit 2 years ago it has been a nightmare. I got horrible acne, stomach problems, PCOS.  I have celiac genes but didn't have celiac until I quit this medication which activated my symptoms. It has been 2 years since I quit and I am still sick from this medication. I have horrible acne scarring all over my face and I am lactating since quitting even though I've never been pregnant. I've gone to many doctors and there is only solution is to get back on birth control pills. I do not recommend this medication.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I love it while I’m on it but on the weeks break I feel genuinely insane. I will start on anyone, cry for no reason and have no impulse control. I never manage the full 7 day break because the mood swings are so much

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I did not like this birth control at all. For me, it helped me not get pregnant but that was the only positive. It made me very hormonal, depressed, cramping 3/4 weeks of the month, and I experienced my first migraine I’ve ever had in my life, and it was insanely painful and agonizing.  I stopped taking it after having that migraine and I had only been taking it for 2 months. I finally decided all the negative side effects were outweighing the pros and it wasn’t worth it anymore. I’m 28 and have taken birth control since I was 17 on and off. This was, by far, was the one with the worst side effects for me, personally.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):In the beginning the pill was just fine, couldn’t be more happy with it - cleared up my acne, basically had no side effects apart from bloating within the first month. 6 months in I started getting crazy mood swings, happiest person alive to the saddest girl on earth. Some of my friends and family brought it up, I was so down most of the time in the last 2 months that whenever I was energetic and happy I’ve been asked whether I consumed drugs to increase my mood.Mind you I was never depressed prior to taking this pill. I am 7 months in now and I will either stop birth control completely or swap to a new pill. I rate it a 6/10. It did prevent me from getting pregnant. It did clear up my skin. It helped control my periods and completely got rid of the cramps. All things considered, I virtually had no side effects.However, it made me feel miserable on too many occassions.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this for 10 years and LOVED it! I suffered from anxiety prior and this was given to me to help and it took it away completely! I had zero side effects on this BC pill. My pharmacy had a hard time ordering it and I missed taking it for a week and my husband and I wound up pregnant haha now that I’ve delivered my daughter I've specifically requested that brand (all other similar brands are NOTHING like Gianvi.. beware I tried 5 of them !) I swear by Gianvi

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking Gianvi birth control for about a year now. It started taking it in July 2020. It did great on curing the symptoms I was experiencing with PMDD; such as the anger, depression and anxiety I had experienced before taking it. Now what I don’t like is the excessive bleeding. First I was spotting for typically a week either before or after my period. Now recently I’ve been bleeding more than just on my period. This month I bled a medium to heavy flow for a the entire month. I got tired of seeing blood and anxiety as exhausted by the cramps. Seeing gyno and Wednesday thankfully

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I couldn't be on this medication for more than a month because I bled, had diarrhea and vomiting NON-STOP from the moment I started it till I finally stopped taking it. I had never been so sick in my life to the point I'm scared to try other hormonal birth control again, regardless of what format it is in. I don't want to scare anyone too badly, but remember this drug has been recalled several times for causing blood clots and causing death in many young women, causing Bayer millions of dollars in lawsuits (Yasmin and Yaz). If you want hormonal BC, I'd go with another form of progestin like Levonorgestrel or something and NOT drospirenone. I know that having reliable birth control is important, but so is your health, wellbeing and your life!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Nikki was my first BC, my 2nd week of taking it. I started experiencing very bad migraines, blurry version, nausea, low sex drive, and depression. I stopped taking it and spoke to my doctor about it.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I went on this as a form of birth control. I had been on depo provera injection and decided to try something new due to the weight gain. I have been on Yaz for a total of 9 days and I hate it. It has made me so emotional, depressed, anxious, and antisocial. I absolutely adore hanging out with my boyfriend and ever since starting the second week of this medication, I have been not wanting to due to my mood and anxiety. I’ve been worried about anything and everything and my sex drive is non existent as well as it made me super dry. I do not recommend this to anyone who is just using this medication as a birth control, it’s just not worth it. I stopped taking this pill last night and am hoping to have improvements like others experience after stopping Yaz.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m not sure whether Yasmin has caused the negative feelings I’ve experienced but from reading other reviews it does make me wonder. I’ll start with the positives- it does it’s main job of preventing pregnancy and has definitely helped my skin clear up. I’ve suffered badly with acne all my life and this has been the only thing I’ve tried which gives me nice skin.  My boobs are a little bigger too. Now onto the bad stuff. Every month when I come on I get really bad headaches. I also get really moody and upset over not very much at all. It feels like you have to pick whether to have nice skin or be a nice person! It really has made me feel the lowest I’ve ever felt on some days.
Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The best birth control pill you could be on

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My pharmacy gave me Syeda as a generic for Yasmín and just now I'm realizing this birth control is the cause for my longer periods and on going spotting. I’m definitely going back to my doctor and switching to a different one. This one does not work.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yasmin to get rid of my shocking period cramps and it took for 1.5 months before the effects fully kicked in. It made me extremely depressed with serious thoughts of self harm. I had massive breakdowns for days on end and have never felt so low/depressed in my life. I completely changed as a person when was on this and I could not stress enough to not go on this pill.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Yaz for almost a week now and I feel great! However I’ve definitely noticed my sex drive go UP. I can’t go 2 hours without wanting my fiancé. So I’m not sure how much of an issue that’s going to be (I’m only on this pill to regulate my cycles). But other then the extremely high libido I feel amazing. I also do suffer from PCOS.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I went on Nikki for bad PMS symptoms, acne, and birth control in general. My moods were very stable, my skin was clear, and ultimately I had a great experience on it. No PMS either! Only symptom was that my libido was somewhat lower, and I switched to lo loestrin for that for a few months, but I’m about to switch back because I liked this pill a lot better!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yaz for five months now, about to start my 6th pack. I used to be on Blisolvi-Fe, which made me extremely depressed. I got off the pill for a little less than two years, and started Yaz as I got into a serious relationship. At first, Yaz was great; it cleared my acne, shortened my periods. The down sides of it are that my periods never come on the placebo days, which gives me anxiety about being pregnant. Yaz has also suppressed my sex drive A LOT. This has caused many arguments in my relationship. My mood has been affected, but not as much as it was on Blisorvi-Fe. I have been tired a lot, which I’m not sure is caused by the pill, but it could be. I also feel like it has suppressed my personality, and made me a little bland, if that makes sense. I want to switch pills to get my sex drive back, and to lessen my anxiety and mood swings, but I do not want to gain weight, get acne, or get on a pill that will cause worse depression and mood swings.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been using Yasmin for around 2.5 years now. Originally I loved it! I wasn't really noticing many side affects. It has kept me from becoming pregnant so it worked. But in the last year though, things have changed. My mental health has spiralled, I cry all the time and generally feel depressed. Only now looking back do I see that I actually did slowly start to change when I went on the pill. I did gain weight, not at a fast pace but I feel it is noticeable. I have horrible cramps and also the worst migraines that would leave me crying and wearing sunglasses in my house so the light wouldn't irritate me. I thought it was just stress but I've been stressed before the pill and never felt this way.I would cautiously recommend this pill. It did it's main job in stopping me from becoming pregnant but it just isn't the right form of contraception for me anymore.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I gave a one month review and said I'd do a 3 month update: no problems! I have some breast tenderness, but not enough to worry about. I do get weepy the week before my period, but that happens when I'm not on the pill too. I'm maybe a bit drier for sex, but hard to tell. History: Was on tricyclen-lo for a while, tried nonhormonal bc methods for a while, and was prescribed Yaz when diagnosed with PCOS. Overall I responded fine to both tricyclen-lo and Yaz.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've almost finished my second pack. During the first pack, I was concerned because my period started much earlier than expected. The doc said irregular periods can be normal for the first 4 months. With this second pack, my period has also come earlier. My periods usually last 4 or 5 days and are almost exactly 4 weeks apart. My first period after beginning the pill lasted 9 days. 2 weeks later, my period started again, and I am on day 10 with bright red bleeding. Some days it slows, some days it is really heavy. I haven't noticed a difference with acne yet, but I'm just wondering...is this irregularity really normal? I see most people say their periods have gotten shorter and lighter. I started taking this a week before I married so we could make sure we had at least a year of marriage first, being we already have 6 children between the 2 of us. But this has made the beginning of our marriage lacking sex because I'm on my menstrual cycle more than I'm off it!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 25 years old and this is the first time I’ve been on birth control and it’s been great! I’ve had no weight gain, no skin changes and no mood changes. I honestly think this actually helped me quite a bit since I was pretty anxious and sad for a few months right before I started Loryna. I’ve been on it for 3 months now it helped regulate my periods since I was always irregular. They’re also a lot less painful, super light and only last 2-3 days. I’m so glad the first bc I chose worked well with my body.  It was covered by my insurance through pill club and I got a 9 months supply delivered to me!

I’ve been on birth control for almost 11 years now, so this generic version of Yasmin is the 4th birth control I’ve tried. I know how they all affected my body in a different way.Name brand Ortho-Tri-Cyclen lo saved my life at 15 years old. Cleared my acne, my period was regular and I wasn’t hurled over the toilet the day my period came anymore!! The generic version was not for me, so I switched to Yasmin.Loved the name brand product for the past two years abs I have only noticed my boobs were more sore around my period!! My sex drive has actually increased and I lost weight. Started the generic a month ago...regular pharmacy was out for a few weeks and I needed my birth control before going on vacation for a week.Haven’t noticed any changes but it’s only been a month. I have noticed a few blackheads but it could be from stress and little sleep this week. So far so good though..best part is I was paying $26 a month for name brand & the generic is free!

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Syeda worked on the positive side of middle ground for me. Nothing notably amazing, but certainly nothing terrible. I do not recall any weight gain or changes in acne,affected my breast size only slightly (did experience some breast soreness during the first month or two, but was expected). The first month was a bit hectic emotionally. Periods were regulated, but cramps were only slightly lessened and periods did not decrease in length (stayed at my normal 4-5 days). I decided to go off of Syeda after I moved pharmacies and was unable to take it for a month. After getting off for that month, I recognized my mood/anxiety being noticeably better than when I was on. Maybe it was my own placebo, but I decided that I had probably not noticed the mood changes while on Syeda, and it was time to switch. Overall though, no complaints! Just was not the exact best fit for me.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started on Yasmin when I was 17 due to terrible cramping, mood swings, and back pain. The pill is a life saver and I cannot recommend it enough. I will say I did slightly gain weight but that was probably the only side effect I noticed.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I used Yasmin for 4 months when I decided to stop due to the side effects. I had terrible mood swings, headaches, I was always bloated.  I gained some weight as well, but most importantly, it ruined my skin completely. I had huge and painful pimples on my chin and jaw area that were never healing. I noticed that during the 7 days break, I would not get new breakouts so eventually I decided to quit the pill. Few weeks after stopping the pill I felt a huge difference. My weight is back to normal, no headaches, no mood swings. My skin cleared in just one month and I have no breakouts now, but the damage on my skin was so big that I'm still struggling to heal the scars left. I felt from the beginning that something was not right and went back to the doctor to ask for advice, but they told me to wait few more months for the pill to work. I waited 2 more months. However, I just felt it was getting worse and worse and decided to listen to my body and quit... And I'm very happy I did so.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Yasmin a year ago after some complications with my birth control. I found not a whole lot of side effects while on it besides being very sad and angry. Reading the reviews, I think my hair has thinned out as well. Going off Yasmin is a whole different story. I stopped my birth control on hopes to prepare my body to get pregnant. Going off I did not get my period for 2 months to begin with now, it's all irregular periods since October. Since my last period, it has been 50 days. I'm concerned for my fertility now too. Besides not getting my period, I have gained 15 pounds. Summer is coming fast and I am struggling to get back to my normal weight. I am making a doctor's appointment today as I feel this pill possibly have me pill induced PCOS or something along those lines. I will never take birth control, especially this one.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):WORST birth control experience. Made me breakout super bad. I was on estrostep before this and my skin never got as bad in my life as it is now. I think I’m going to switch back to estrostep.

Took this pill for 1 month.  Had some mild nausea and headaches on and off the first few weeks, but I took the pill in the evening before I went to bed and that seemed to help.  But then during week 3-4, I became UNBEARABLY bloated and constipated.  I would go days without having any bowel movements and I was so uncomfortably bloated I looked pregnant and couldn't fit into any of my pants.  I've never been so bloated in my life.  Not worth it.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this pill for 6 months, and I loved it. My skin was dewy and plump and clear, which in turn made me feel great. After 6 months, HOWEVER, I could feel my anxiety levels rising and paranoid thoughts started. I wasn’t sleeping and felt panicked all the time. I decided to come off of the pill, and that’s when things got really bad. I was having severe panic attacks that were making me dissociate and become very detached from reality (making me panic further), and my paranoid thoughts became delusional! I had to start therapy and 3 months later I’ve finally stopped dissociating but I’m still paranoid and my hormones and mental health have a long way to go till they’re back to pre-pill state. I know its different for everyone there’s many reviews from women who’s anxiety levels go through the roof and others who became suicidal. I’d say if you have any pre disposition to depression or anxiety or a naturally anxious brain, avoid this pill! It just isn’t worth it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It is important to remember that only people who have had either awful or a great experience review things... most people are just average! Anyways I LOVE Nikki. No side effects other than spotting a week before placebo for a few months ( very light, only needed a liner so it didn’t bother me!!) No weight gain, depression, NOTHING. OH and she cleared my acne! I can’t remember the last time I’ve had a pimple. Remember that everyone’s body is different, so don’t get scared reading the reviews.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I used this Yasmin pills for about 2 months now but IDK what happened to me. I feel that I am easily to get angry,  I feel so sad and crying always with out any reason, I feel that anxiety attacks me. I  read all the comments I think I get this from Yasmin :(

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I went on Nikki for acne and it was great for acne, my skin became clear within a few months. For birth control though, it was the absolute worst. I developed painful stomach problems, I became depressed, and a lot more anxious. It  worsened my mood. I recently stopped taking it and I couldn't believe how much better I felt mentally. I do not recommend this pill.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I loved Yaz. Never had any problems with it and I love how it only has 4 off days which allowed me to skip my period by starting a new  pack on vacation :) so we love that. I recommend this one.

I like and don't like this pill. I took this medication non-stop from the age of 15 to 23. I never got pregnant. It made my acne completely disappear to the point where I had BEAUTIFUL skin. At 23, I was off it for about a month and I realized the depression I had experienced my entire high school/college career was caused entirely by this pill. I didn't even know it affected my mood! I was never suicidal; however, I was definitely depressed! I feel like I lost 8 years of my life. This birth control made me horny- to the point where boyfriends have been concerned. I miss that part of it honestly. It got rid of period gas. I didn't even know period gas was a thing but now that I'm not on the pill I'm so gassy! Apparently this pill has a diuretic affect which can reduce bloating and gas. I had no gas before, like ever! Watch for changes in mood & possible depression cause I genuinely am not a depressed person in the slightest now that I'm off it. If it doesn't give you depression, this pill is a godsend!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Since taking Yasmin my period symptoms have gotten worse. I used to never get any symptoms. Now the first day of my period I get physically ill (severe migraines, nausea and sometimes vomiting). My skin has been insanely clear while on Yasmin, I used to get hormonal breakouts. But I don’t think it’s worth the excruciating day every month that makes me call off of work.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Yasmin for 4 months. My periods have gotten way better (no more pain really), but I can't stress the ill-effects enough. Plain and simple taking this pill, my emotional well being went downhill. I'm angry, I cry daily, I started really not liking myself. I even started getting way too many self harm thoughts which has never happened before. I am literally the worst version of myself on this pill. My heart is always beating quickly, I feel like I'm on edge. I'm shocked it's even on the market. Please do not risk it, find something better.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Tried many different pills and had the implant in and struggled to find one to agree with me. Suffered depressive moods, random spotting/bleeding, acne, may the list continue. I had read up about Yasmin before taking it and was very on the fence as there is so many negative reviews but it has changed my life! It is the only form of birth control I have taken that has giving me ZERO side effects and has even improved my acne! The best thing about a pill is you can stop taking it as soon as you feel like it’s not agreeing with you so I definitely recommend trying Yasmin before knocking it!!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I do not recommend Yasmin to people who suffer with PCOS, I had the worst experience and continue to have health problems after 1 month of stopping Yasmin. I took Yasmin for 2 1/2 months. While taking Yasmin I had constant nausea, abdominal and back pain, my nails became brittle and my hair was falling out a lot. I had major migraines on a daily basis and to the point of vision loss. I was constipated a lot, had no energy and my legs were weak.(After stopping Yasmin) constipation has got worse and now suffer with digestive health problems, I have had awful constipation since taking this pill and I’ve also suffered with rashes head to toe and really bad dry skin on my face and scalp. I’ve never felt so low in my life that I hate the way I look and feel!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Gianvi for, I want to say, about 2.5-3 years now. For the most part, it's been a pretty good experience. However recently, I've been experiencing low sex drive and dryness during sex. It might have to do with being in a global pandemic, accompanied by anxiety and seasonal depression, so I'm reluctant to say its all from Gianvi. However I will be speaking to my PCP to see if she recommends a new brand. The new development of low sex drive/dryness has started to affect my relationship & I want to nip it in the bud

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Honestly I was quite scared to start taking the birth control pill for the first time after reading so many bad reviews and hearing all these horror stories about it. But I have to say although I've only been on it for 2 months I've had almost no side effects at all. Only on the first few days I was a bit nauseas and my breasts were tender but besides that its been smooth sailing. No emotional changes, no weight gain, nothing. So don't let bad reviews about it get to you and give it a try, everybody has a different reaction to it.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking it to regulate my period a year ago and it has been a rollercoaster of a year. About 5 months after taking it my mood swings started to get really bad, I always had headaches, my cramps were bad, and started to have symptoms of anxiety and depression. I used to be so full of energy and always happy, now my mood swings are 24/7 and I have 0 energy whatsoever. Definitely going to switch birth control pills. I don't recommend YAZ.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on this over a month all I do is cry and bleed I really don't like it. The Nurex nurse told me be patient it will improve but no way - this is horrible how my hormones are off the chart

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Gianvi for about 2 years and have recently gotten off of it. The first 5 to 7 months I felt quite emotional/anxious, I also went up about 1 cup size and my skin was perfect. However, it did prevent pregnancy, so I'm thankful for that. It also decreased the heaviness of my cycle. And it was free with BCBS! About 1.5 year in, I began noticing that I had vaginal dryness and my libido was super low as well. Since I was so dry, sex started becoming very painful and it seemed like no amount of lube could help. It has been just over 2 years and I have decided to get off Gianvi for a few months to see if my problems disappear. So far, it has been about 1 week and I feel really good. To anyone  reading this post, I suggest you always listen to your body and find an understanding provider who can help you create a plan that you both agree on. Good luck!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Yaz for my PMDD, first it was pretty normal, nausea, headache and sore boobs. Then the second week hit and I completely lost my appetite, lost all sex drive and felt awful mentally and emotionally. I would feel depressed and anxious right when I woke up and would have breakdowns everyday in the middle of the day. Once night time came I felt numb and lazy. My PMDD wasn’t good before getting on Yaz but it was at least manageable. I felt like my reality changed, I didn’t feel normal. I didn’t get my period while on it. I called my doctor to see if these symptoms will persist and she suggested I wait a couple months because my symptoms were normal...but later that day I had a panic attack and decided to get off ASAP. It’s been 3 days since I stopped (was on it for exactly two weeks) and I feel slight relief knowing it was the Yaz that made me feel so awful but I still have the bad thoughts and anxiety and my appetite isn’t back. Hoping I feel normal again soon

I am going on month 7 of taking this.  That being said, my periods are way heavier than before. I have started using super plus tampons!!!! First time ever needing one. I also have awful cramps. Tylenol didn’t even really help. Acne gets awful as well the two weeks leading up to my period. I’m not sure if it’s still regulating or what but I will definitely be getting off this soon if things don’t get better relatively quick.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Gianvi after being given my previous birth control made my face swell and look huge she gave me Gianvi because of my fear of gaining weight and my painful periods.  being a very fit person with a strong desire to lose weight and stay fit she said this was the best option - which it wasn’t. I started Gianvi at 165 now after almost 7 months on it I weigh 186. Being that I’m tall people couldn’t tell but my clothes were all tight around my hips and my breast doubled in size. also my sex life wasn’t the same being that I was very dry at times. Not to mention I would cry at absolutely anything and sometimes had such bad anxiety that I couldn’t even sleep.  The only real problem this pill solved my periods being very light which was sometimes scary being that I was sexually active. I did not get pregnant, so if those are your main goals I recommend it. If not I strongly suggest you don’t.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m on birth control for PMDD, and have tried a bunch of different birth controls, but Gianvi has been the best for me. I feel mentally normal with minimal PMS and I haven’t noticed any side effects. The only downside is that there have been some manufacturing issues so I wasn’t on it for the last two months.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Gianvi for about a month and so far my experience has been great. I have experienced a little weight loss (but I am also a very active person so I am not sure if thats because of the birth control), and no major mood shifts. I switched to Gianvi from Junel Fe, which I had a terrible experience with, and my acne has improved tremendously. I still have a few pimples but they are slowly going away. It does it’s job preventing pregnancy, however I do experience a bit of stomach pain about 30 minutes after I take it, so I suggest taking it at night so you don’t notice it

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yasmin for about 2 years. Everything went pretty well. It’s different for everyone so don’t go in thinking your experience could be horrible. It was my first ever birth control. I’m not a very emotional person, I don’t cry a lot really but on Yasmin I cried constantly. I did lose weight, but that also could have been from my constant working out. It did cause my appetite to go down within the first 8 ish months and then after it had gone up. I kept working out the entire time so my weight never changed. My acne did clear up besides the few spots here and there when my period came around. My period was also light and only lasted about three days. Intimate wise I was fine, maybe even more into it than usual-but it did cause pain sometimes when doing it. I cried a lot after we had finished as well-for no reason. Definitely a good pill, but I wouldn’t recommend for going on it for over a span of 2 years.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 33 and have been on the Yasmin pill for 3 months now and I have to say I’m really happy with it! I am a bit more emotional and sad but nothing out of the ordinary being me. Lol Little discharge here and there, shorter and lighter periods and no cramps which is amazing. My skin is clear and my boobs have grown also. I do recommend this but keep in mind every pill has different effects for everyone:)

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking this pill when I was 14 to help regulate my periods and to be prepared when becoming sexually active. Fast forward to now, I’m 24, and have quit taking it altogether due to severe depression and anxiety. Reflecting back, I didn’t have any depression or anxiety symptoms prior to starting this medication. I read recently (within the past few years) that this birth control in particular can make depression and anxiety worse or start it up - so I quit taking it for awhile as a trial run and felt TREMENDOUSLY better. I was happy again and didn’t have mood swings like I’ve had for years (I’m also on antidepressants and anxiolytics if that tells you anything). After a few months, I restarted it and the same depressive and anxious episodes returned. I’m not sure if every birth control does this, but I do not recommend this one for the sole fact of maintaining mental sanity (depression, anxiety, intrusive thoughts).

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz was fine at the start for the first 3-4 months but after that I’ve been having the worst headaches, I feel constantly low which has never been an issue before in my life. My eczema began to flare up extremely bad and I’ve had tonsillitis 3 times, an ear infection, styes in my eye due to a weakened immune system all within the time period of 6 months. The only positive is my skin which has been completely cleared.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was prescribed Gianvi to treat hormonal acne. I have never taken another form of birth control prior to, and was hoping it would help with my cramps as well, though I had a regular period that was heavy and would last 6 days typically. Unfortunately this drug didn't help me. In the beginning I noticed my acne actually got worse. My mood began to fluctuate far more frequently than it normally did. I started experiencing the most severe cramps I've ever felt, with diarrhea that lasted days. I also had a very light, inconsistent period which made me nervous that I would lose my period entirely. There were a few days where I stayed in bed because of the pain. I know everyone’s different, and this drug may work great for other people, but I personally would not recommend it. I stopped taking it after a month (even though you're supposed to take it for at least three), and don't know if I want to try a different one at this point.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):DO NOT TAKE Syeda! During Covid-19 my pharmacy switched me to Syeda from Ocella, didn’t think anything of it. Oh boy was I wrong. Gained 20 lbs FAST, had severe acne, and crazy depression and anxiety. Thought it was all due to Covid-19 stress. However from doing my research, I am now learning Syeda messed me up! Throwing it out now.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on YAZ for three years now and it works really well for me, I don’t think it’s changed me much emotionally/mentally but also hard to say because I have been struggling the past 3 years... so that is sus. My boobs went up a whole cup size but eventually went back to normal. Periods are regular no breakthrough and it does help with my acne, I still get pimples but not big cystic ones like I used to. I think it widened my hips too. I want to go off of it soon, If I do I will be able to tell you what was really side effects and what wasn’t (:

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yasmin is my third contraception pill and I was on the combined then the mini and now back to the combined, it has made my periods regular however I will have days when I’m nauseous just all over tired and have a bad belly ache and go to the toilet; it’s made me gain weight. The pros is that it’s stopped pregnancy and I’m protected on using this contraception so far so good with the pregnancy thing. But as this is my third pill , the pain of periods on all of the pills didn’t help one bit, and none seem to agree with me as well as Yasmin has but I might have to change it due to the side effects it’s giving me . So overall it isn’t that good .

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I decided to switch from Dianette to Yaz after doing research and heard Yaz was good for acne and Dianette was making me extremely depressed and having random bursts of sadness and crying for no reason. I have been taking Yaz for 10 months and although it did help to clear my acne, for the last 3 months I have not been myself, feel lower than I ever have before and my anxiety is crippling. It makes me not even want to get out of bed most days and has made me so unmotivated. My cramps are worse than ever before and have a constant headache throughout my 'period'. I am coming off this pill for a while and will then try the minipill (progestin only).

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Switched to Loryna to help with acne and didn’t notice a change a first but it gave me severe anxiety and I felt hopeless and depressed everyday, even to the point of having suicidal thoughts. I thought I was going crazy because of how fuzzy and out of it I felt. Didn’t feel like myself at all, had no appetite, GI issues, and heart palpitations. It is not worth it for a little less acne, I've only been off it a couple weeks and I feel SO much better.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):DO NOT TAKE THÌS. My 16 year old has just attempted to take her own life after 4 months on this pill. She was happy go lucky till taking this. I sit here crying writing this, seeing what it's done to my girl, it should be banned
Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):After being on Nikki I ended up with four blood clots in my lungs and a $4000 hospital bill.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I got on Gianvi at 19 years old when my periods were irregular and I had horrible cramps, to prevent pregnancy and help my acne. It helped my acne a lot and I was excited to finally not worry about pregnancy at a young age. I was skeptical about side effects at first but waited three months before judging my experience at all to make sure I was used to it. I ended up staying on Gianvi for about 6 months. My experience was terrible. I would’ve taken acne over the effects it had on my mental health any day. I had crippling anxiety everyday that I never experienced prior to. It eventually got so bad that I had panic attacks everyday and cried and didn’t eat for 3 days. I ended it immediately and while I still suffer from mild anxiety, it’s a million times better than it was when I took this. Please be careful and pay attention to your body

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I first started YAZ a year ago, and loved it. It helped my acne and I didn’t have any issues. I ran out and was unable to get more for a few months. I started it again a month ago and the depression and anxiety has been so bad. I did not experience this the first time and I’m going to be looking for another form of birth control. The panic attacks and intrusive thoughts are not worth it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I began Nikki after my Paragard IUD had to be removed because it shifted positions. I wasn't comfortable going back to an IUD after that. I also wanted something to help my (moderate) acne. Once I started Nikki, my acne cleared up within the first pack. I took the pill religiously at the same time and my doctor thinks that this helped with the benefits. I noticed my body hair grew less thick. My periods last a day and a half with moderate bleeding at worst. I've also had minimal cramping.I did gain ~7 lbs around my butt and lower tummy which hasn't gone away. I also noticed that my sex drive is decreased. The reason that I'm changing is because my IBS symptoms became severe. I looked into it and research suggests that Drospirenone can cause/worsen IBS.  I think overall Nikki was great, but wasn't the perfect fit for me.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on this pill for 5 years now (I’m 19). Never experienced any change in my mood or emotions. It cleared up the small amount of acne that I had and it did not make me gain weight. The only bad side effect I have noticed is that my hair has become thinner (that could be caused by something else but I can’t think of anything else). Over all I like it but this is the only pill I have tried.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on this birth control for about 4 years. I was prescribed Gianvi for acne. I noticed that for 3 years my acne improved greatly. However, throughout the last year on it I noticed my acne was suddenly going back to how it was prior to taking birth control. I am considering switching to a new birth control because of this or just stopping birth control all together. I personally did not experience any side effects other than my period changing. I get my period about every 6 months now instead of every month and it’s very light. I asked my doctor about this and she said this was normal. This was nice plus as my period was rather heavy. Overall, I had a very positive experience on this birth control, however it’s no longer helping with my acne so I might have to switch.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m a runner and have no history for blood clots. I started using Yasmin mid September of 2020 and November 21st I went on a run and passed out. The first hospital visit they told me I just had SVT and was sent back home. My heart rate stayed at 120 and I felt like absolute garbage I couldn’t even walk two steps without feeling like I couldn’t breathe and was about to pass out again. I went back to the ER on the 23rd, they did some tests and I came back with an abnormal test for pulmonary embolism. I got a CT and they told me I had a large clot above my heart and going into my lungs, called a saddle pulmonary embolism. I was sent to  ICU and spent 5 total days at the hospital. They told me it was the largest PE they had ever seen in a person of my age I'm a late teenager). If I hadn’t gone in when I did they told me I could’ve gone into cardiac arrest. I’m not saying this is something that is going to happen to everyone but I want to share my story.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is month 2 of Yaz. 1 year ago I was on Yaz for 9 months roughly and I had experienced heavy breakthrough bleeding, very painful cramps, and at one point it got so bad I felt I had miscarried. I hadn't but the blood was pouring out of me in gushes. Far worse than my regular heavy period. After a while it levelled out and I stopped getting my period even on my "off" days. My blood tests were normal and so was my ultrasound. After a while I went off them to try and get pregnant but never did. Periods came back the same as before and decided to try Yaz again. So back to month 2 now of yaz and I'm still on my period. I has not stopped since before I went on Yaz. (Total 4 months on period) painful cramping has started again I'm exhausted all the time, moody, in pain and I'm going to talk to my doctor about switching BC. Cannot keep living like this esp since my bleeding wont stop. Horrible pain makes me want to cry and sleep all day. 1/10 stay away from yaz

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Yaz for about 8 months, it works perfectly but about one day a month, it gives me manic depression and I’m emotional for no reason. I figured I could take one bad day a month but it has gotten severely worse and gives me suicidal thoughts. I’ve never ever experienced any form of depression before. I’m actually happy in my life but this makes me feel so low.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have just completed my first month on Yaz and may update my review. I was a bit annoyed when my doctor prescribed Yaz to me because "that's what she prescribes to all her PCOS patients" - but I don't struggle with the typical PCOS problems like excess hair and acne, and I was worried about the potential side effects. In summary, it's only been a month, but I can't say that I have observed any definite side effects - my emotions, acne, etc, are all within the normal range of what I would expect for my current circumstances. Re: libido, while I might be a bit drier, I was using condoms before and not having to use those more than makes up for it. One thing I did notice was that during the first couple of weeks I was waking up at around 2 AM feeling slightly off and struggling to get to sleep, but that seems to have gone away. As far as the positive effects, I haven't noticed any difference; acne is slightly worse than average but within the range of normal, no difference in body hair.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been taking a generic version of Yasmin for the past 4 months (almost 5). I've had issues with breakthrough bleeding before and Yasmin resolved that issue completely on the 2nd month. However, starting towards the end of month 2, I noticed that my hair has lost a lot of volume and I have bald spots in areas that were once full of growth (I have naturally thick curly hair that grows quickly). I've also heard of a lot of people losing an incredible amount of hair once going off Yasmin but for those people Yasmin was helpful in promoting hair growth.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):THIS WAS THE WORST BC EVER! My doctor prescribed me to name brand Yazmin and somehow my pharmacy gave me Syeda for months. I have bled almost every day even when taking it, cramps like NO OTHER, knee pain, rash on my chest, anxiety as well. This is generic birth control that DOES NOT WORK! If I could rate a 0 I would.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):When I was a teenager I had two really bad stages of acne, so much that one time I had to go on accutane. I used another pill but it made me have a few pimples here and there. I decided yasmin since I didn't want acne problems. I was on it for 1.5 years with no issues at all until I got this throbbing leg pain that could best be described as what felt like growing pains. They hurt so bad it would wake me up in the middle of the night and I could barely walk. Went to the doctor and got an ultrasound, found out Yasmin gave me a DVT (blood clot) in my leg. Have been on blood thinners and am now switching to an IUD since it is the only option for me personally. Overall okay experience but the clot was terrible.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was taking LoLo and I had almost no side effects but since I needed more birth control and I am in a different country, I took Yasmin because they didn’t have LoLo here. It’s literally my 3rd pill on Yasmin and these side effects are horrible! I feel so tired, I feel sick, nauseous, like I can eat. Then the next day super tired. I also felt my heart racing and a lot of anxiety. And lastly my vision started getting worse. I have an astigmatism but I feel like birth control makes it worse and also as if I am not fully able to be in the present. Just horrible. The dose on this is way too high for me. And I don’t like how there is no option for placebo pills. Even the pamphlet is not very clear on how to take the pill correctly.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):If you have IBS or any issues at ALL with your stomach, I do not recommend this pill. Not only was I severely depressed, moody, and anxious more than I had ever been in my life, but I also had terrible bowel movements and stomach pain and pelvic pain. I could not eat anything normally for 3 weeks and I've been off the pill for about 2 months now and my stomach is finally just now regulating. Everyone is different, but this pill was the worst mistake for me. (I was only on it for a month)

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My doctor prescribed Yasmin (later Yasmin plus) 3 years ago for severe dysmenorrhea and for the first time in my life, I had mild and regulated periods. But a few months in, it all went downhill. Headaches, low energy levels, intense weight gain, cupsize increase, hair loss and pretty much chronic bloating and constipation. Also started losing interest in daily activities, was short tempered, developed severe anxiety borderline depression. I consulted both a psychiatrist and a psychologist. I was placed on Fluoxetine (antidepressants) for over a year. It's been a month since I quit Yasmin (I'm also off Fluoxetine) and my mental health has improved. I have swollen legs now and my body feels weird. Hoping to get back to normal soon. I'm yet to see my periods post the pill and I'm working so hard to get rid of this weight.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Gianvi after 3 months of using Yaz. I’m not happy at all. I’m due to start my 2nd pack today but I think that I’m just going to discontinue using it. Yesterday, I experienced serious mood swings and today isn’t any better. I’ve been an emotional wreck and I don’t like the way that it makes me feel.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):AWFUL. I was given Syeda by my pharmacy and the first month I felt weird and different. More emotional. The second month I am a total wreck. I’m stopping these today - do not recommend at all. And I broke out more.

Triggered IBS symptoms that I never had before, lowered sex drive, increased anxiety. It took me many years to realize this was the culprit, but after coming off of it, it is clear that this pill was wreaking havoc on my body! I wish my doctors helped me piece together the puzzle sooner. Although it regulated my periods perfectly, wasn’t worth the side effects at all

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My OB chose Loryna for contraception after I had my baby. I didn’t really know anything about it before I started taking it. My insurance filled a three month supply. Then when I picked up my next three month supply, it was a different kind. Different brand, everything. Then when I picked up for the third refill, they switched back to Loryna. Now that I switched to something else and back again, I’ve noticed that this pill makes me moody as heck. I thought it was just normal hormone fluctuations after having my baby 8 months ago, but it’s definitely this pill.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Decided to try Yaz after having bad side effects on Levlen, I have been on this pill not even a month and my mood swings are absolutely insane. I have very intrusive thoughts and I go from happy to sad to furious with absolutely no cause. I’m at the end of my pack now and I have stopped it completely. Safe to say I’m staying off contraceptive pills as the side effects just aren’t worth it. Not only that, it’s $93 for a pack of 3, no thanks!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It's been 4 months on this pill, and the 2nd month was probably the worst. I had nonstop spotting for a week. After that month, however, I had much lighter, shorter periods. Appetite: noticeably increased, not sure if bc or cold weather or holiday season Weight: no noticeable changeEnergy: no noticeable changeMood: no noticeable changeNegative Symptoms: headaches/migraines, temporary spotting one month Positive symptoms: shorter period, significantly less acne

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Yaz for a about three years now. I've been on the pill for 12 years. At first it agreed to my body but then I realized that he caused awful anxiety and mild depression. Every single day I am low and when I on the placebo pills I feel so happy. I feel like myself. I don't feel like I am being controlled by a medication. As soon as I start taking the pill again I feel down and anxious. I still ovulate on this pill and I have still gotten endometriosis and burst cysts on it. It helped my skin but it causes more damage elsewhere. I am planning to get off of the pill once and for all.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m really happy with this birth control now. The first 2-3 weeks were rough. The side effects made it difficult to get through the day, as I felt sick and could barely move. It may have been a bit better if I’d taken it with food; I do now and have no side effects.As for acne, since that was important to me - it’s all cleared up! I’m really happy that I’m not getting big, painful under-the-skin zits on my chin anymore. It gets 5-stars just for that. If you’re considering this pill, I recommend it. Just make sure you take it with food!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m almost 35 and I have been on several different birth controls since I was 16. Yaz was my favorite but I recently switched to Yasmin. I worried my skin would break out because the FDA didn’t approve Yasmin for acne like Yaz is. My skin has continued to stay clear and I personally haven’t had any issues with Yasmin.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yasmin for about 5 years because I experienced horrible cramps due to cysts. At first, I gained weight but then after I lost it. My cramp pain decreased and it regulated my period. I didn't experience acne but I did have constant breast tenderness. After so many years of taking it, I stopped because I was experiencing bad headaches. Now I'm currently looking for different birth control.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My experience on the pill is bladder pain and stomach aches really bad when I eat meals but when I eat snacks it isn’t that bad. Try it for yourself  it has caused me anxiety problems

I’m very happy with this birth control pill. I’m 27 and healthy, never been overweight, but when not on birth control I get acne and have regular but very long cycles (35-45 days), so I wanted to be one the pill again for the benefits of clear skin and regular cycles, in addition to the obvious birth control benefit. The first three months I still broke out occasionally, but by the fourth pack my skin was clear and has stayed clear. No weight gain, maybe slightly bigger breasts, but no tenderness. I do crave sugar more than I used to, but that may not oven be from this pill. Overall I feel great!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I liked how clear this pill Nikki made my skin, but that was really the only positive. I experienced headaches, very heavy periods with bad cramping, and bleeding between periods (at times as heavy as a normal period!) I thought maybe my body needed time to adjust, but after 8 months of feeling like I was bleeding all the time and always in pain, I switched birth control. I love how clear my skin was, but it's not worth it.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am 36 and have been to this circus before and have used Gianvi in the past. I have been on Loryna now about 2.5 months. The first month wasn’t bad but after week 3 I got horrible GI issues to the point of embarrassment. Let’s leave it at that. They continued into the second month but then about week 2 of month 2  as I got used to this medicine my stomach has been fine since. I notice my breasts have been sore and have grown in size. I actually lost a few lbs. nothing significant. I am hungry though. All the time. Like ravenous with horrible cravings. I won’t be shocked if the scale eventually goes up. Overall I don’t see why this pill is rated so poorly. It’s not terrible and my mood has been stable. On other birth controls that has not been the case.
Jasmiel (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been taking Jasmiel for 3 weeks and started coughing up blood. Do not recommend.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking the Yasmin pill two months ago because I saw how clear my friends skin got and because I had problems with acne but it wasn’t that severe. Within the first week of intake my mom could already see the difference in my skin and I got compliments from people which really did make me happy, until the 7 day break it was torturous endless anxiety, depression, confusion, mood swings I just wasn’t great company and it did have an effect on my mental health. The worst part is that you need help but from where will it come from because your mind is a war zone. Pretty hurts.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I live in Korea, and had to switch from my ortho-tri-cyclin in the US to YAZ here in Korea. I went to a doctor to talk about it and she suggested YAZ as it was fairly close to what I had been taking in the states. I got it for 6 months, and now that I'm nearing the end, I am thinking more seriously about finding something else. The biggest side effect for me is the decrease in my libido. I went from desiring intimacy with my fiancé almost every day to never, within a month of starting YAZ. It was an extreme loss of sexual desire that I am 100% sure was due to YAZ. I also gained a few pounds and have not been able lose it. I did start to notice more extreme mood shifts towards the end of each cycle as well. Feeling depressed, fatigue, and anxiety every 4 weeks is tough on me.I am nervous about switching to something else because I have only ever taken ortho-tri-cyclin pills, but YAZ is just not for me in the long run.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Ocella when I was 16 for about three months. In those three months I became severely depressed, I was uncontrollably angry and sad every day of my life, I gained 20 pounds, and I became recluse. This might just be a unique experience for me but please talk to your doctor before you have your mind set on this birth-control. It barely helped with my cramps which is the reason I was taking it. I don’t think, in my opinion, that it was worth it. It took two years for the effects to wear off.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this pill for around a year and I can’t believe I put up with it for that long. My appetite would change constantly. Sometimes I would eat everything and sometimes I couldn’t eat without feeling nauseous. I’ve tried this pill and tricyclen, this one made me gain so much more weight. I was on both for a round a year. Finally the MOOD SWINGS. I would cry every single day for NO REASON. Even if something inconvenient happened, I’d start crying. And I felt like I couldn’t control it. Out of no where, the tears would start falling. It made everyone around me annoyed. It helped my acne for a bit, but then I started getting a few pimples again after a while. I do not recommend this one ! :(

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This was my last resort to try to fix my PCOS. I asked my doctor, and she said Yasmin might work. It did, for a little. I had my first period in over 18 months! Which was great because I want to settle down. However, over the last 10 months I have gained over 40 pounds, and I can NOT get rid of it. I am sleepy all the time, I am water bloated CONSISTENTLY. I only had my period one time in that 10 months. This was horrible, and I am going to go back to my old BC.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I really don't like this birth control Loryna. I switched to it and was told I would not be getting my period any more and for the last 4 months, I have ha a period. I am constantly bloated and irritable and I wake up nauseous a few times a week. Loryna does not agree with me.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I am on week 2 of taking the Nikki birth control and the pros are great no acne, see improvement, no nausea, no insane mood swings, no anger maybe one super sensitive day but that was it. My weight is great I have noticed some bloatedness but goes away when I workout so not a big deal so for the cons. If you suffer from gingivitis like I do and gum disease I am on week 2 of taking the meds and noticed my gums are swollen and super inflamed I now am flossing day and night and 4 times now after every meal you cannot skip at all! Or your gums just will get inflamed and swollen so idk if there is other birth controls that maybe won’t do the same thing but if not please let me know but ugh just other side effects I would have to worry about and this one I like because I’m not angry or moody or irritable..

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Nikki overall has been good, but has not been the right birth control for me. Benefits: My skin has never been much of an issue (I would only break out around my period) but this birth control completely cleared my skin. I don’t remember the last time I had a painful pimple.My moods have been somewhat consistent. I just get really anxious and irritable the week before my period. The bad side effects that I’ve had are: Heavy flow. It’s so heavy and I’ll go through a super plus tampon in less than two hours.  Horrible headaches that last for 2 weeks. They’ve gotten worse the longer I’ve been on this medicine which is why I’ll be switching! I really don't want to switch because of the benefits to my skin but it’s just not worth the headaches and heavy flow for me.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This makes 5 months on Nikki for me. My body acne has completely healed. I was on the Mirena IUD right after my second child and it completely messed up my hormones. I gained 30 lbs in two months.  Now being on Nikki, I have officially lost 20lbs without any real change to my diet . Wondering if I'm crazy or if this BC has actually straightened out my hormones. Has anyone else experienced weight loss?

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So this is my first time taking birth control and I'm 19 and I'm only starting my second week on Syeda. So far it has been very bad for me. i already have anxiety and so far it has made it 100% worse to where I feel like I'm back tracking with my mental health like I can't control it. My acne is starting to have redness and I never really had that before and I'm eating so much. I'm getting my birth control changed asap and would not recommend

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Syeda, because I am an athlete and need a birth control to help me not put weight on. The pharmacist told me women gain weight because they think that the birth control alters their eating habits, but this hasn't altered my eating habits at all. It helped me stay at the same weight and has worked very well with my skin after just taking it for 3 months. My eating habits are very healthy, and this birth control has not put weight on me whatsoever.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Yaz for four months and am about to get off of it. It hasn't made a difference in my acne (which was slight) and I've noticed some weight gain. I work really hard to maintain my weight with regular workouts and eating well. I hadn't changed anything in my lifestyle yet have been gaining weight, so I can definitively attribute my weight gain to this pill! And no, it is not water weight; I literally do not fit into my slacks for work. I've also had a lot of breast tenderness along with my breast size increasing - which I do not like at all. But I will say that this pill drastically decreased my period in length and bleeding. This pill has not been terrible for me. If it weren't for the weight gain, I would stay on it.

I was prescribed Loryna as my birth control because I needed to be on a contraceptive (in a relationship) and I had hormonal acne. I’ve been taking it for over 8 months. First, I want to let you know the positives of this pill. I have clear skin and don’t even have to wear an ounce of makeup, I get to skip my periods, which means that I get no cramps or any blood/spotting, I am not more anxious or depressed than I was before I started taking this pill and I haven’t gotten pregnant! Now, I want to inform you of the negatives I’ve experienced while taking Loryna. I have been 108-113 for years (I’m 27 years old) and within the first 6 months of being on Loryna, I’ve gained so much weight that I am now 135 pounds. I am constantly upset about my body and cannot lose the weight no matter how hard I try. So if you get on this, keep track of your eating habits so that you don’t end up in my position!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):By far my favorite birth control I have ever taken. I have been on the pill since I was 16 (22 now) due to heavy periods and to help with my acne. I was on Loryna from 16-19 years old then tried the Kyleena IUD which was a nightmare for me. I ended up getting it removed after 6 months and went right back to Loryna. I have been the same weight since I was 16 and the IUD caused me to gain 5-8 pounds within 6 months, but my weight went right back to normal when I went back on Loryna. My skin rarely ever has any acne on it and the best part... I haven’t gotten my period in 2 years on this pill! Ignore the scary reviews and give it a try!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I regret ever taking this.Took it for 7 year. Everything was great while on it, but I lost about 40% of my hair volume (telogen effluvium) and had severe cystic acne for 6 months after it. On top of that it messed with my humour. I felt angry and sad for months. It's now 1.5 years since I stopped it and even though the condition has improved I still have a long way to. I had to cut my hair short and I'm trying to fix the and scarring of the acne.

I was on a different birth control prior to this but requested something to help my acne. For almost 6 months my acne was severely worse but my skin is pretty much clear now. Not sure if it was the pill or just my skincare routine. I haven’t gained any weight from the pill but I do also go to the gym regularly. Besides the acne the only other side effects I’ve had are spotting/longer periods and moodiness. I’m extremely irritable and cry more frequently. I do wish I had stayed on my old BC instead of switch to this, but it hasn’t been the worst experience.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Does anyone experience stomach pain and discomfort from their birth control? I keep having to switch generic versions because after a few months by stomach will just generally ache all the time. Nikki seems to be bad as well as Loryna. I’m back to Giavani which was fine for the longest amount of time.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had high hopes for Ocella with all the good reviews I read, but no.....back story: I'm really 30s, PCOS lean and have already had to have a hysterectomy. This BC absolutely wreaked havoc on my stomach so bad that I've become intolerant to red meat. On top of all that awesomeness(sarcasm) it gave me horrible anxiety and turned me into an emotional mess.... I've switched to Happy Hippie Go With the Flow supplements and have had WAY better results. Because I'm PCOS and experience PMDD I've also switched to a low carb diet and pair that with exercise and I feel amazing.....but eating red meat now has me praying to the "porcelain god" for almost 2 days.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking Nikki for almost a full month now. At first I was so nervous it was going to make me depressed and gain weight after reading all these reviews. However, I started working out more and watching what I eat and I’ve only lost weight in the last month. My mood seems the same besides I cry easier than I did before starting Nikki. Don’t let all these reviews scare you it’s important to see how your body reacts to it.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My doctor recommended this birth control to regulate my period. I was on this for about 3 months, I gained 10+ pounds from this birth control, and cried nearly everyday about the smallest things. I was so emotional and depressed. I have taken about 5 other birth controls in the past and they have never given me any side effects like this. I strongly do not recommend.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The Loryna birth control pill has worked pretty great for me. No weight gain, a little less acne than normal. I still have a period but it is so much more manageable and light.

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started this to see about balancing my hormones. I was adamant that I had to be on something that wouldn’t cause weight gain. Well so far no weight gain, but the acne I’m experiencing is a 100% no go! I have little bumps everywhere, like texture.I have cysts on my neck. I won’t be taking this again!

I started taking this birth control because I read a lot of positive reviews. However this birth control made me very hormonal, really bad breast pain and nauseous. I felt sick all the time with this birth control. I’m so glad I stopped taking it. I really don’t recommend.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Blisovi for over a year and switched to Loryna to treat acne. I would not recommend this pill. I experienced horrible anxiety and nausea. I lost my appetite completely. I was having panic attacks and heart palpitations. It took me about 2 months to realize it was the pill giving me the side effects. I have stopped taking it and feel a lot better.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve taken this Yaz pill for about 2 months and I’m going off of it now. The anxiety and depression that came with this were not worth it.
