I would continue to take if I wasn't in a big life transition right now I can't risk blushing on big interviews!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is one of the worst birth controls I've used. Before this I was on Loryna and it was perfect. Even Nikki was ok the only side effect being extreme nausea. This one doesn't give me mental/issues although I've never had a birthcontrol that has.  BUT the big negative on this is it not only kills my libido, but it also makes me dry and for some reason I'm not able to fully stretch out when having sex and keep getting tears, it is both frustrating and painful and my partner is extra cautious and considerate and its so frustrating to have this problem. I know its this BC because I went off of it for 2 months and sex became great again. As soon as I got back on boom problems came back. Never had this issue with Loryna or Nikki and I am furious. I've been trying to get loryna but the pharmacy is out and they gave me another genetic instead, so I'm hoping this new one isn't as bad as Gianvi.  Even tho the active ingredients are the same in all these pills..the inactive ones seem to either make or break it for different women.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz was horrible, within 3 months of starting it I began to experience bouts of depression during my period and migraines as well. I was on Yaz for 11 months. By the time I got off it I was experiencing severe panic attacks and serious depression. I had never before in my life experienced these mental and emotional problems. I was 41 years old. I thought I was going nuts and never suspected that it was Yaz causing the problems. These symptoms  came on gradually and progressively got worse and more pervasive. After I stopped Yaz and went back to my previous BC pill, it took about 18 months for the symptoms to fully resolve themselves. But there was some immediate improvement at the initial discontinuation. I can’t believe after all the negative things known about this pill and all the big lawsuits that it’s still on the market in the US. Be very careful with use of this pill....

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Before taking Yaz I did have the tendency to overthink, however I would never consider myself depressed or anxious. Ever since being on this pill, my mental health has never been this low in my life. I  think obsessively about mistakes I've made in the past, in a way where I feel worthless. I began suffering panic attacks and hot flashes. During my period I became so depressed, I would spend my days crying and not wanting to get out of bed. I'd go to work late because I just stopped caring. I highly suggest staying away from this pill. It is NOT okay for your mental health and it is NOT a risk worth taking.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have used this since it was Yazmin and for the most part it certainly helps, but one huuuuge thing I absolutely hate about this medicine is how emotional it makes me. I took a break from it for a couple of years to try other methods of helping my PCOS symptoms since I wasn't worried about pregnancy. When I started up again I really started noticing the major symptoms again. Nausea is present for me personally for the whole first month and again the first couple of days of each new pack. I cry at EVERYTHING HAPPY OR SAD. This I particularly hate because it's not the cute little one tear or two it's full on ugly, nose running, eyes swelling kind of crying. It's basically like going through puberty. every. single. month. I will say in the positive category it really helps keep my acne under control and my cyst formation is really low. So if you want to roll the dice on the mood swings it's a pretty good pill.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Its my first time trying yasmin, I recently  got my IUD removed after 3 years because of all the wide array of horrible side effects that I experienced (cystic pimples, vision problem, 20lb weight gain) The first week on yasmin my libido increased, my face wasn't as oily as it was on IUD. Into the second week my face is slowly clearing up, but my libido definitely plummeted. Also I started to notice mood changes, I usually workout 4-5 days I week. But second week into yasmin I felt exhausted all the time, unmotivated, and flat out depressed. Going into my 3rd week I started to experience shortness of breath, dry eyes, tightness around the chest and anxiety. I woke up one night unable to breath and I was flush pale. I will be discontinuing this medication from today. I also have to see my family physician for a check up. Ladies I understand you want to be free of acne but the side effects on this one are not worth it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I just wanted to post this for the ladies who are taking loryna and your pharmacy now keeps giving you Nikki. Switch pharmacies and save yourself the time and heartache. I took Nikki for two months and just switched to Walgreens to get Loryna back. My hormonal acne came back, cramps, and I gained weight! I was using it for birth control but if it’s going to make me a chunky, acne  covered psycho I don’t think having sex will be an issue. Stick with your yaz/loryna girl!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Nikki was the worst experience of my life. I was reluctant to go back on a birth control as my experience in the past has been negative. I took Nikki for 13 days. On day 9, I had severe heartburn that turned into vomiting, cold sweats, feeling full when I had nothing in my stomach for almost 24 hours. The next day I was weak, depressed and had a raging headache. Initially I thought I’d gotten food poisoning but the symptoms persisted. I am nauseous all the time, headaches throughout the day and completely exhausted. I would have one or two bites of light meals and immediately feel sick. Not only that, but my anxiety is through the roof. I’m not normally a very anxious person but this medication is making me paranoid, mean, and sad. Don’t let you doctor prescribe it. Find something better.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Personally, I don't think you should take into advice the people who only used it for a month when starting this product. Ofc within the first months there will be some adjusting, breast size increased a little, experienced some nausea, and had some hyper mood changes. Now, I have 0 acne all the time, sex drive has not been particularly affected, have gained some weight but I wouldn't blame it on the pill, and my period is four days long. Unfortunately, there have been some notable side effects:minor headaches for like 5 seconds at a time that hurt a bit (not that often but noticable), sharp pains in abdomen during period. The thing to watch out for though, is the PMS. This drug really doesn't prevent it, and I think it ramps it up a bit. I hate ending every month realizing that I was being really irritable and upset and arguing with people the week before my period. I'm chill 90% of the time- except for that week.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Got on it to regulate my period (which it did, but also gave it to me 2x/month). Developed severe depression, anxiety, gained 30lbs and was all around one of the worst experiences of my life. After my doctor told me to give it time to let  my body to get used to it, I pushed through another couple of months until it was clear the birth control was the issue. Been months off of it and still suffering some secondary side effects but the bulk of it is gone. Would seriously not recommend.
Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had the worst mood swings after taking Yasmin. I thought I was going crazy.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was only on Nikki birth control for a month. While I didn’t experience any weight gain, this birth control made me feel really bad. I constantly was cramping every day on it for the whole month and it felt like period cramps. I had no sex drive at all. But it did make my periods incredibly lighter almost non existent just like spotting at the end of the month. One con I noticed with me was whenever I drank alcohol (even small amounts) on this birth control I experienced the worst hangovers the next day which was not normal for me. I would throw up even 24 hours later and feel miserable any time I consumed any alcohol. Overall, this birth control wasn’t terrible. I read reviews and it said sometimes it takes your body 3 months to adjust to it but I wasn’t wanting to put up with these cramps for 3 whole months so I switched to a different one. But it did make my periods way lighter and I experience no weight gain in one month.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz is great! I first started taking Yaz at 15 years old. Hardly any side effects compared to other brands of birth control, and my skin flawless. Switched over to the copper IUD at 21 for something more long term. BIG MISTAKE. Had it for 6 months before removing it and switching back to Yaz. It's never let me down, with minimal to zero side effects. (increased appetite but that can be controlled with a bit of self discipline.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yasmin for about two weeks and it has caused me so much bad. I started experiencing severe anxiety, panic attacks, lightheadedness and even problems with my vision. I’ve been off for about a week now and things are slowly, very slowly levelling out.. My eyes are still a bit messed up and my panic attacks happen probably every other day or so along with the dizziness. At first doctors had no idea what was going on with me.. which lead me to a hospital visit because the panic attacks were so severe, as well as 3 appointments with my family doctor in just a WEEK! And a CT scan to make sure I didn’t develop a blood clot in my brain from the pill!! Unfortunately I experienced some of the worst side effects of this drug! I’m extremely scared to even consider taking any form of birth control again!! Please if you care for health don’t take this pill!!!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on at least four different types of birth control throughout a span of eight years, and Nikki is by far the worst one I've tried. I find myself constantly nauseous, moody, and I really haven't felt like myself since starting Nikki three months ago. Does NOT help with acne, bad period cramps, or spotting/heavy bleeding. This is a very problematic birth control and it shouldn't be recommended by any doctor, ever.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Be careful with this birth control if you have a history of anxiety or mood disorder. I had history of major depression (episodic) and read warnings with this medication, was skeptical of it but decided to try. I kept journal of my moods for the 9 days that I took Gianvi. I believe it started to make me depressed. Not sure if this was effect of switching to new birth control (I was on trinessa 9 years before it was discontinued) but I believe it was the medication itself. I was very obsessive over minute things at work and in my relationship, irritable and impatient to the point that I was cruel to my BF, and started to have feelings of hopelessness when I was by myself. Two days after I stopped taking it, it was like a cloud was lifted from over me. Be cautious, was not good for my mental health.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Yaz for about 6 months and my body has not shown any physical changes, but I have noticed several changes in other areas. At first, the pill was fine, but when I took my pills to have a period in February on the 6th, the period never went away. I am nearly at the period stage of the next pack, and I am still on my period from the previous pack. I have an irregular heart beat, I will be sitting watching tv or doing work, and I can feel my heart beat, as if I have ran a marathon. The last side effect are headaches, but they come suddenly, and nothing gets rid of them. I never had a headache in my life, and this is the absolute truth; until I started taking Yaz. I went to the doctor and she immediately took me off these pills and prescribed Avaine, which I've read the reviews on here, and they are horrible as well. I am about to stop birth control altogether....

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The best pill you can go on if you need to lose weight and clear up your skin! Before taking Yasmin my skin was terrible, I broke out like crazy and it was a real struggle to lose weight. Within the first 2-3 months of Yasmin my skin was beautiful and clear, and within 6 months the amount of weight I lost was crazy! At least 10 kilos lighter (along with a decent diet). The only con about Yasmin is I did get a little depressed and anxious so I decided to get off the pill, a month or two after the pill I started breaking out and I gained weight. That's why I know Yasmin helps with acne and weight loss! It's literally your best friend. I've decided to go back on the pill, can't wait to look thinner and have beautiful skin!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Although this pill did clear up my acne (that was caused by a different pill) and prevent me from becoming pregnant, it caused me to be extremely depressed and anxious around the 9th month of usage. It also caused me extreme mood swings. If you're prone or already have anxiety or depression, I would not recommend this pill.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This was the worst birth control I've tried. I didn't become pregnant which was certainly good, but I became incredibly moody with obsessive thoughts, anxiety, and depression that still haunt me. If you are prone to anxiety and depression I might recommend NOT trying this pill.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on this pill a year now. Cleared all my skin and I don’t have bad cramps or mood swings when on my period! It’s worked MAGIC! I feel much more happier and capable to do things on my period as it’s not heavy. My mood swings aren’t bad anymore and my depression has gotten better. I still suffer from anxiety but the pill has not made it worse. One down side is headaches, which may or may not be caused from the pill. But over all I do recommend this pill!

Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking this pill as soon as I got my first period (age 12). I can truly say I regret being on it for so long. I was on this pill for 8 years before I decided to stop it to see what would happen. I am a completely different person without the hormones from this pill and every other pill I’ve tried. The pill made me gain 17 lbs which fell off within 2 months of stopping the pill, gave me anxiety, increased my appetite, effected my digestive system, I could go on and on about the negative effects the pill has on your body. It sucks because I hate risking pregnancy but it’s really not healthy to put these hormones in your body.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill is MAGIC - I have tried multiple pills, rivegdon, microgynon etc all of which have given me horrible mood swings to the point of feeling depressed. Fast forward 2 years birth control free I was prescribed Yasmin to treat my acne, within 3 months my skin was the best it had ever been, it suppresses my appetite so I've lost weight (gone from size 8 to 6), and literally saving my relationship I used to be a horrible moody clingy cow and was pushing my boyfriend away, this pill has taken the 'edge' off that usual PMT rage and has just been an overall god send. If you can get this from your GP I would recommend however everybody is different and may have a different experience to me

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am just now into my third week of this medicine. The first week I was nauseous and had a headache and just felt terrible. This past week I have been so unbelievably irritable. I have three small children and just can’t be the moody single mom. I have to be here for my kids emotionally. I have noticed my patience decreased and my anxiety increased. I’ve been more down than usual. I have ZERO sex drive with my boyfriend which is completely unusual. And I’ve also wanted to EAT everything!The main reason for this medication was to regulate my periods because I have a small fibroid. I’ve noticed a lot less pain from that and no bleeding so far. But I’d honestly rather have that than all these side effects.I do not recommend this medication. It has been awful.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Yasmin a year now and honestly if your doctor offers you this pill say no. They don’t tell you about the really bad mood swings you get or the anger attacks or the anxiety and depression and even the nausea I get everyday. I am now suffering with all of this because of Yasmin. I never knew how bad my anger was until my partner said about how bad it actually was. I’ve only just realised that my anger has been ridiculous over the past months. If any of you are experiencing these things I’d suggest you stop taking Yasmin and go back to your doctors for another pill. It is dangerous.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I first started this pill 6 months ago. It cleared up my acne very quickly. However, continuing the pill, I became very moody and anxious about everything. I have also experienced some weight gain and major cravings, and while I am very active, I found it hard to resist cravings and work out more. I have become very tired, pissed off, and unmotivated. I am in high school and there is no reason for me to feel any of these symptoms, but it has messed with my hormones terribly. Before BC, I would have up to 5-day-long light periods. Now, I bleed up to a week and a half, heavier than before also. I do not recommend; the only positive factor is clear skin (and not getting pregnant I guess).

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've just started my 3rd pack of Syeda and I break out less, my boobs are bigger, no real side effects, less moody during periods, and it does it's the main job pretty well. My periods are also a bit lighter now too.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this for PCO's and to  to regulate periods Really bad experience on Yasmin, had really bad side effects such as extreme mood swings/ changes, depression (generally just not feeling like my usual self at all), breast tenderness and swelling, nausea, abnormal appetite (major craving that are not usual for me) and weight gain. The one week I stopped taking yasmin I lost weight, my appetite decreased a lot, my mood was back to normal, I didn’t cry all the time or feel depressed. I would not recommend yasmin, whilst it has helped my skin, it has caused more harm than good overall!

I've never had an acne problem, usually just a few pimples every once in a while.  This made my whole face covered in acne. Painful acne too. Like the ones underneath your skin that you can't pop and they feel like welts. It also made me cry over everything. If a sad commercial even came on I would cry and I know for a fact that I am not pregnant because there is no physical way I could be lol. Might be different for you,  but it was terrible for me.
Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Effective birth control but caused non stop spotting the whole 3 months I was taking this pill

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Used this birth control for almost 3 years. It was the first BC I've used. Prior to taking it I had so many break outs and I noticed a big change in my skin within a week of taking it. Ever since it has done wonders for my skin. I also did not gain any weight while on this pill. But it did kill my sex drive. Stopped taking it because my obgyn needed me to come in before getting a new prescription. I've been off it for 3 weeks now. My skin hasn't changed much. It does feel slightly oiler, but the break outs are small and go away quickly. The major change I've noticed is how much more normal I feel now. I used to get extremely anxious and I thought it was just me. But I'm starting to think maybe it was the pill? Regardless Gianvi was a great pill. Giving it an 8/10 because of decreased sex drive and anxiety. But the pros outweigh the cons. I would definitely take it again. My pharmacy just switched me to Nikki so hopefully it's just like Gianvi.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Ocella seemed ok for a while until I started getting dark brown spots on my face. This was odd because my skin has always been like porcelain (even toned, no acne.)  I went to a dermatologist because I thought it may be a side effect to Botox injections but upon evaluatinon, he said it was from my birth control. I was confused but he said that the hormones can cause MELASMA.. He said it may take years to go away after I stop taking birth control or it may NEVER go away.  He said I can try bleaching creams but there is no permanent treatment for it. I have spent $600 on bleaching creams and nothing seems to work. I can still see it through my makeup and it makes me self conscious. At least with your guys’ issues, they go away once you’ve stopped. But for me, this may be a lifetime effect :( I really wish I was more informed. It’s sad the things us women put our bodies through while men merely complain about condoms. No more for me. It’s not worth the toll on our bodies.
Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control gave me blood clots. Do not take this medication.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Gianvi for 3 months and had to switch to Loryna because I had to switch pharmacies and they didn’t carry Gianvi. I’ve been on it for a little over a month and I wake up sooooo hungry. I feel like I’m starving I’m so hungry. Like I have to eat in that very moment. Also, my overall appetite is increased like crazy. I always have to snack or eat. So far I haven’t gained any weight but I could definitely see how it’s a possibility. Overall it’s an okay birth control. I’ve definitely been on worse.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Been on this for 2 days and I’m so nauseous and terrible headaches. The hour after I took it my headache started and today (second day) been nauseous all day. I even want to just throw up and get it out of my system. Ugh not taking it anymore

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I'm 39, a full time working mom of 3 young kids. My husband and I feel that our family is complete but after trying for 10 years with multiple fertility attempts, we just couldn't go through the process of making it "final" so I chose to go on birth control. After trying a few other horrible brands, I was prescribed YAZ. I read the horrible reviews but still decided to try it. At first, it was great! No acne, levelled my moods-kinda but after a year, all hell broke loose. I have horrible anxiety, depression, anger towards everyone-even my children, tired ALL the time, wanting to be alone. My relationship with my husband is hurting due to me not wanting to be by anyone which means absolutely no sex drive. I might have a tinge of a period during my placebo pills but all the other symptoms of bloating & mood swings. Then after a year, I got my period  & bled through the month. I am starting a new pill next week. Hopefully, I can get my family and my life back...

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I moved on to Yasmin because I was looking for a pill to sort out my cystic acne.At first, my skin cleared up and my boobs got much bigger (which I loved).After a few months though ,I started to feel exhausted and nauseous most afternoons. I felt like I was pregnant and it just didn’t let up! I also started to get horrendous period pains that resulted in black/dark red discharge for days at a time! I had multiple tests done at the doctors bout he couldn’t explain my symptoms.Then however, the worst side-effect of all kicked in....hair loss!!!This was extreme, everytime I touched my hair I would pull out clumps!I stopped taking Yasmin straight away and it took about 3 months for my hair to stop falling out. I think I lost about 1/3rd of my hair in total and it was one of the scariest times of my life.For anyone who is suffering hair loss, stop taking the Yasmin and IT WILL STOP and IT WILL GROW BACK! Stay positive it’s never as bad as you think it is.

I've taken this pill for 4 months now. The reviews on here are obviously quite disheartening, but I think that is the case because those with negative experiences are prompted to write one. I found I experienced virtually no side effects from the offset.  My mood has always been relatively steady and that didn't change; my weight hasn't changed; my acne has improved, and I no longer experience heavy periods - plus I can control timing of breakthrough bleeding!I wouldn't say it is a miracle drug by any means, but the benefits outweigh the disadvantages - especially being protected from an unplanned pregnancy!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Nikki for a week and a half and it completely messed up my stomach. I am always nauseous, always hungry, and I have been having diarrhea. I also constantly have a weird taste in my mouth that won’t go away no matter what I do. I haven’t been spotting or getting headaches but I did break out a lot and I have been very irritable. I cannot wait for this month to be over so I can switch birth controls again.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):When I first began I was on Yaz, then I got switched to Nikki. For at least 6 months I had no problem. Now I have frequent headaches and nausea.  It is like I can have a huge appetite and can’t stop eating or I’m not hungry at all

Syeda (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was taking Zarah for a while which is the generic for Yasmin it was working perfectly for years.  Then all of a sudden my mail order pharmacy started sending me Syeda in December 2018.  As soon as I took it, the first week I was breaking out non-stop on my chin.  If you're breaking out on your chin, most likely it's related to hormones.  Every day I was getting a new zit and new bumps I was really upsetting.  Until I called my Dr and then she prescribed me Gianvi and after the very first day, I saw a difference in my skin almost immediately.  I will never take Syeda again due to my horrible experience.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Been on this birth control for about 4 months now. Switched from my other pill because it made me super susceptible to UTI’s to the point where I’d get one once a month.  No UTI’s anymore! Not only is it an effective birth control, gianvi cleared my skin and my skin has never looked better. Haven’t noticed any changes in weight, and haven’t experienced crazy mood swings or anything from this pill as well. Overall it’s a great pill.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've got into a serious relationship this past year and I opted to get birth control. I have had the Xulane birth control patches and the generic Yaz, Gianvi. Xulane gave  me every side effect possible- mood swings, nausea, and headache, and Gianvi made me have mood swings. I asked my pharmacist to give me the non generic version and I finally got YAZ. I've had zero side effects, no mood swings, no weight gain, and GLOWING SKIN! If you're hesitant to try because of previous bad reviews, give it a shot! I am the person who has every possible bad side effect of every drug and I highly recommend it!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on this pill for just about a week now. Since having it I have felt very down and not myself I have been arguing with others such as friends and my boyfriend and distancing myself. So far my skin has made no improvement but feel as if I can not judge that as I have only been on this pill for a short period of time. My sex drive has completely gone, and also just feeling very lazy . But I am already fed up of these moods and feeling Down. I don’t recommend this pill feeling so low is not healthy. If doctors give you this pill I would maybe suggest for a different one. Maybe more safer after reading certain reviews.NOT worth it !!!!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was originally put on Gianvi for acne. I was on my period for about 4 weeks between the first and second month, but I figured that was just my body adjusting. After that, I loved it because I had very few side effects, and my skin looked great. After the third month, however, I was bleeding for about 3 and a half weeks per pill pack. It was absolutely awful, I had cramps all the time, I always had to worry about using the right products, and I wasn’t happy because that’ not why I was on birth control, so I switched after my 7th month. Apparently, bleeding how I did is regular up to the sixth month, which is really ridiculous, so just be forewarned.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am 18 years old and started Yasmin when I was 17. I had side effects such as nausea, abdominal pain, irregular bleeding only the first month of the pill. I’ve been on it for about 10 months now and I feel fine. My periods are much lighter but unfortunately my PMS symptoms are the same as before so I can’t say that this pill has stopped them. Overall I am happy with it and haven’t had any abnormal problems.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 30 and have been on some form of birth control since I was 15. I started Yaz/ Gianvi maybe 7 or 8 years ago and loved it!I was given Loryna 4/5 months ago. I must be an idiot because it took me up until yesterday to connect the dots. I’ve gotten my period every single month 10-3 days before finishing my active pills. I thought I was going absolute crazy because I never missed any!  I’ve had horrible cramps and bloating; my breasts have increased a full cup size and are extremely sore - the only time of the month I get any reprieve is when I stop the pill for my period which is now 10 days long and super heavy and full of clots. I also have insomnia (fall asleep after 3 every night) cystic acne (this is new), depression, lack of energy, constant yeast infections/ BV, and a feeling of constant PMS....Did I make myself clear that I am bloated and have cramps and breast tenderness EVERY DAY?DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Probably one of the worst pills I have taken so far. I am starting my second pack, and I am very well done with it. My sex drive has completely gone down. I have had headaches, nausea, and muscle pain. I do not recommend this pill at all to anyone!!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):After reading all these reviews I can’t believe  I didn’t realise and associate my incredible irritability, moodiness, anxiety and depression with this birth control pill. Also very mindful just recently of the link between Yas and my blood clots ! Never taking this killer again

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started Yaz about 7 months ago because I had found out that I had developed ovarian cysts. I had been on Yaz for two years as a teenager and had side effects but I didn’t notice them as much as this time. Over the time I had taken Yaz I had developed low mood, temperament, and a bad attitude towards everything. The change was so slow that it wasn’t obvious that it wasn’t me and not the pill. On my last month I took this pill I had just started a new job and had to quit after one day because of extreme nausea and anxiety I was experiencing. Other side effects I experienced on Yaz were depression, suicidal thoughts, withdrawn, violent (kicking in a wall), angry, argumentative, irritable, extreme nausea, dizziness, hypoglycemia (if I don’t eat every 3 hours I would get nauseous) and no motivation to do anything, random pain in the legs, jealous of others, tired all the time, foggy head, crying all the time and distrust of people. Please be aware.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Yasmin now around 9 months non stop and I’m going to stop it forever!!!! Sisters I advice you to not take such pills, because side effects really there! I’m having mood changes daily, I fight with my husband for nothing and sexual drive is getting low as well. I’m over emotional and making drama for small things. Those things are nothing comparing my breast pain now and strong headaches. Before to take any pills just think and talk to your Dr!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz is the first birth control method I've used so I can't compare with others but it's been great overall for me. I am more emotional and have moments of irritability that I didn't before but it's not unmanageable or extreme. I have clear discharge which is more of a welcome thing for me as, prior to taking this pill, I had a hard time becoming naturally lubricated. It does its job nicely at preventing pregnancy. My libido has only gone down a notch, which is also fine. Breasts larger, weight unaffected, skin clearer, even my hair feels healthier - though I'm not sure if that is typical. My periods are predictable and light. My urine has a different smell since I began taking Yaz. It's not unpleasant but it is noticeable. I'm more than satisfied with this birth control

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Both my GP and gyno wrote me a prescription for birth control for my endometriosis and I never filled it because I was weary. My prescription lapsed from my GP and my gyno said it would be the best to fill for me because I've had bad experiences on other pills. The first day on it I was fine but as days went on my mood turned ugly. I'd lash out and have a short fuse around everyone for the smallest things around 1pm until the time for the next pill (9pm). In between that I got a foggy head and felt dull and blank. I zoned out and couldn't think at all. My anxiety also skyrocketed. I was on this pill for TWO WEEKS and couldn't deal with these side effects. It's not worth sticking with. $84.00 straight into the garbage.
Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I experienced depression, zero sex drive (almost ruined my marriage), and massive weight gain. The only thing it did was prevent birth.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yasmin the birth control for my periods, to see if it would clear my skin, and to stop me getting pregnant. While I was on the pill my periods were lighter, my skin got alright but not that clear. I do not recommend this pill because instantly after 3 weeks or so I had major anxiety and depression which led to not going to school, work, and to relationship problems. Now my doctor prescribed me ortho-cyclen.. and I’m loving it so far!!!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):At first I was really scared to start with Nikki because I’m a first-time birth control user and I saw so many bad reviews here. But I tried it anyway and I’m so glad I did. I’ve been on it for a full month now and I didn’t experience any spotting or extreme nausea or things like that. 3 days after I first started taking the pill, I had a bit of cramping but nothing intolerable. I just have a lot of discharge (which is probably caused by the pill) so I have to wear pantiliners frequently. However the withdrawal period came just in time (3 days after I took my last active pill). My skin is already clear before I took Nikki and it still remains clear until now. No weight gain, no acne whatsoever. It also didn’t affect my sex drive at all, in fact it gave me a peace of mind. All I can say is that everyone has different reactions to this pill and it’s worth trying!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My experience with this drug has been terrible. I was prescribed it to treat my endometriosis, and although it began to help that, it had other crazy side effects. I began to get severely depressed (not wanting to do ANYTHING, not even shower or brush my teeth), my anxiety has been through the roof, began having heart palpitations which then made my anxiety worse, headaches, difficulty sleeping, and tingling in my arms/legs. My doctor took me off of it over a week ago and I’m still struggling with these side effects. If given the option, DO NOT take this pill.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking birth control before I married my husband.  I was extremely worried because I have depression and did not know how the pill would effect me.  My doctor told me to expect some nausea with the first month or so of taking Ocella and for that first month or so I definitely had some nausea but after that I have been fine.  My acne has cleared up and I haven't had any unexpected mood swings.  The only negative I saw was weight gain which made fitting into my wedding dress a little more difficult but it wasn't too extreme.  The positive was that I went up to a C from an A in cup size.  I have been on Ocella for almost a year and have had a positive experience overall.  Especially before I took Ocella my periods have always been long and painful.  Now on it I have noticed that my periods have progressively gotten shorter and I have had a lot less pain from cramps.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I  switched onto this pill about 2 months ago and they have honestly been the worst months. I've been feeling incredibly emotional, lazy, developed eczema on my face and felt very depressed. I have started anti depressants after visiting the doctor but after reading reviews I believe it could be the pill causing these issues. From my experience, I would not recommend this pill.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I began taking birth control when I was 16 because I went to my doctor concerned about acne. She prescribed me YAZ and it helped clear up my acne right away. I continued to stay on YAZ/Gianvi for 12 years after. When I got married I decided to go off of the drug. My doctor never mentioned anything about the possible changes my body would go through when I discontinued the drug. Turns out that birth control can completely alter the flora in your digestive tract. I began experiencing serious digestive issues and my doctor told me that I had IBS and was put on Viberzi. A few weeks later I was having severe gallbladder pain and I had to have my gallbladder removed. I have read that birth control can cause gall bladder issues too so I think I just had an all around bad experience when I decided to go off of this drug and I was not given any warning. I just want to let other women know that this drug is effective, however you need to be very aware of the changes it can make to your body.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on and off Yaz and Yasmine for nearly 10 years now and I had never particularly noticed any negative side effects. It made my boobs a lot bigger and my skin clearer which I was very happy about. I recently went off the pill for 3 months and have just started back on it to get my skin better and my boobs bigger. About 2-3 weeks in I started to suffer from anxiety attacks, which I have never ever had before. I have felt anxious every single day since and have finally realised it is the pill and have stopped taking it. I am hoping that the anxiety will subside In a few days once the hormones have been flushed out. Do not take this pill.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking this pill to clear my acne. This has been such a terrible pill. All I want to do is sleep, I’m constantly tired and nauseous all the time and I have normally have very strong stomach. Smells make me feel super sick, like the smell of popcorn made me gag and I love popcorn. I can barely eat- today I had a piece of toast and some pretzels and that’s IT. Normally I snack throughout the day. All I want to do is lay in my bed and drink ginger ale. I’m stopping this medication tonight. Even if it did clear my skin, feeling sick constantly isn’t worth it. Try other birth controls!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):If I could give this a zero and wipe the pill off the earth FOREVER I would. I was on Yaz until March, I had an issue with my insurance, and got switched to Nikki. I already have anxiety and depression, all of which were completely under control at the time I switched to Nikki. The first few months were fine with no side effects. About 6 months ago my attitude took an insane turn, my anxiety and depression had reached levels I could not handle anymore. I kept putting it off thinking I was finally just at my breaking point. And now, exactly 1 and half months ago I have not stopped bleeding/spotting. Seriously, not even for one day has it stopped. The past 6 months I've gained near 10 pounds because I can NOT stop eating, the hunger cravings will not go away. I finally looked up all the reviews I possibly could and I'm now seeing how many people are saying the same thing happened to them.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Unfortunately Yasmin just isn’t for me. I started it about a month ago and after reading some mixed reviews I was hopeful that I would be one of those who had no side effects. Shame to say that has not been the case. First week I had awful headaches, nausea and fatigue followed by extreme mood swings. By the second week the mood swings had gone but I became bloated, constipated and ravenously hungry at random points during the day. I have gained weight already and my muscles have started to ache. Throwing them in the bin tomorrow and hoping to feel better as soon as possible! With that being said, pills work differently for  everyone so I would recommend trying it first.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had no initial issues with loryna, but 6 months in I started to notice different changes with my body. My cycle was off, mood was terrible, low libido, and my breast were larger. Overall I just did not feel like myself. I shared my concerns with my gyno and she said that my body was 'adjusting.' This didn't make sense because at the time I was 36 and had been on birth control before. You adjust the first 6 months, but not after taking for 6 months. Needless to say, I had an abnormal pap. I stopped taking loryna immediately. 6 months later after stopping loryna, copolscopy and folic acid... my pap was normal again. Unfortunately, I also found a lump in my breast. LADIES PLEASE REFRAIN FROM TAKING THIS GARBAGE . It is not worth surgery, chemo, radiation, or the lifelong worry of dying from cancer.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Yasmin now for 5 months, I was put on this pill to help my skin as I have mild acne. Since I was 15 I was on lymceline and I stopped taking them when I was 18, my acne came back and my doctor prescribed me Yasmin. 5 months in and my skin is the best it’s ever been! I’ve had no side effects, my periods have improved (never late and less bloating), I feel great in myself! Would suggest this to anyone it’s amazing!! It’s changed my life!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have only been using the pill for 6 days, I never had much acne just some pimples that pop out but I completely stopped getting them on my face, sometimes I get them on my body which is weird. In these 6 days, I have lost about 1-1.5kg due to yasmin. I have had the symptoms start on the 3rd day but they are slowly resolving and are almost gone. Not sure, if this is a good pill for me but will have to wait to find out.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Started this birth control 2 weeks ago, I’m on week three and I can barely eat. When I try to eat I can only get a couple of bites in then I’m full. One day I spent 5 minutes straight gagging in the bathroom. This did not clear up my skin, I actually broke out more. I stopped taking it yesterday and now I can eat again. I’m already pretty thin so I do not need to lose anymore weight. I do not recommend this birth control.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was sooo scared of going on birth control bc I didn't want to gain weight, and also wanted to prevent pregnancy. My skin has gotten spotless clear, and my weight is the same (unless I wait for my withdrawal bleeding then I wait 3 days after my period to go back on it) but it ranges from 98-101 and it really hasn't affected it! I love this pill. Yaz has regulated my cycles and reduced my PMDD symptoms such as bloating, acne, etc. no mood swings. the only reason why its an 8/10 is because my skin broke out the first 2 weeks but after that its clear as day

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I was on Junel for about three months and it all seemed fine until I wasn’t fitting into my swimsuits (competitive swimmer) and my cup size doubled. So I switched to Yaz and the first week was miserable with the migraines and loss of appetite but after the first pack I was back fitting in my bras and normal weight. Yaz is pretty great.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.  Took it two times and was overcome by horrible irritability, depression and ridiculous thoughts.  I am a positive person and this was AWFUL.  As soon as I stopped taking it my mood went back to normal.  I felt as if Dementors (from Harry Potter Series) were sucking my soul.  AVOID!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Gianvi for 5 months. The first month I had bad mood swings but that went away. My period is lighter. I still have some PMS symptoms before my period. My moods have been better. The pill has cleared my skin. I have not gained any weight. I really like this birth control.

Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been taking Vestura for at least 3 years. Last year, this was discontinued and the pharmacy switched me to Nikki! It was terrible. The emotional rollercoaster I was on was horrible. After calling my Dr and the pharmacy, I was able to return back to the Vestura on "special order" but over the last couple of months I've noticed an increase in moodiness, (seriously emotionally wrecked) thoughts of jealousy and paranoia. This is the ONLY medicine I take. I have decided to stop BC all together and see if I can't reset my system for a happier and healthier me.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been using this birth control for over a year & a half & I literally love it! It works so good for regulating my period & clearing my acne. I literally used to have pizza face acne & on my back, & I gave it about 2 months & it just all went away. My skin is so clear now, every now & then I’ll get a bump but it’s not bad. Also I used to have 7-10 day periods & it regulated my period to 4-6 days one & my cramps really aren’t bad. I have a bad period maybe once every 5 months & it’s just bad cramps. I love this birth control & I totally recommend it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So far I’ve been taking (Nikki) for 2 weeks now almost 3. So far so good! Only thing I’ve noticed is feeling nausea during the day, I’ve read that, it is normal when starting a new BC pill. I had really bad acne on my back & on my face. I’ve already started to see a difference on my back & I haven’t been taking even a full month yet. I’m hoping that it continues to do good for me!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on this birth control for over 6 months. My doctor prescribed this to me, and I looked up the reviews and was terrified.  But, everyone is different so I started taking it anyway and I am so glad I took the risk! I have no side effects on this birth control - if anything, it got my emotions more under control than they were before. I'm a lot happier on it than I was off of it! I get a consistent period, so I don't ever think I might possibly be pregnant. It does it's job by preventing pregnancy and I'm still sane and that is all I was hoping for.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Started Yasmin around a month ago for treatment of (adrenal) PCOS because of its anti androgen properties. I'm not one to write anything online, but I desperately searched for reviews when I was going through my initial breakout after starting this contraceptive. The breakout came around 3/4 days after I started taking it and it was horrendous - I won't lie.  Painful spots all over my jaw line and on my T zone (which I don't normally get)... However... After about a week my skin started to clear and has continued to clear since to the point I am absolutely over the moon with how clear my skin is!! If you're going through this initial breakout - stick at it girls... it's worth it in the end. Had a few ups and down emotionally but nothing compared to other contraceptives. So far, Yasmin, despite a lot of negative stuff online, has suited me.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This has been the worst experience of my life. I’m doing nothing but bleeding and bleeding and bleeding constantly for the past 5 months. Coming from someone who used to have bad anxiety and overcame it mostly... it has made me have anxiety attack’s a few times a week. I feel lack of motivation don’t know if that’s due to my constant period or the medicine. I’ve never had a good experience with any BC pill or depo shot.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Terrible. I’ve been on this pill for 3 months. I’ve only had about 1 week cumulative in those three months where I wasn’t spotting or bleeding. Terrible mood swings and depression. Extremely painful periods. I did not get pregnant, which means it did it’s job, but honestly there weren’t many occasions where there was a risk of getting pregnant lol. With constant heavy period and cramping there was hardly any desire to have sex. Worst birth control I’ve ever tried.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I went on this pill the first time at about 17 years old. I had lighter, less painful periods, clear skin and all was good. When my long term relationship ended I went off it. When I was 24 I went back on it again because I wanted clear skin for my up coming wedding (when I am off the pill I suffer from hormonal acne on my chin) I was on it again for about 6 months, clear skin, no issues. Went off it again when my script ran out and now, age 27 and 3 kids later I have just started back on it again as I’m so sick of my monthly breakouts. I’m on day 5 and have been feeling really nauseous since last night. I hope it passes soon or I won’t be able to stay on this pill because at the moment it’s like having morning sickness it’s terrible! Will see how I go. Main con is it’s not a funded pill so it is expensive

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I've been on Ocella when it was yasmin... Since 1996. No issues at all. It helps my mood swings and no endometriosis since on it. Migraines yes but it runs in my family..so no issues with it.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Disrupted (ie ruined) my mental health, made me unable to wear contact lenses, and made me feel lethargic and just.. bad. I would not recommend this drug to anyone. Only good thing is it reduced my period pain, but the other side effects were not worth it (and I vomit and can't move for a day while menstruating so thats saying a lot)

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started this birth control and it made me nauseous I gave it another week. 2 weeks in it gave me diarrhea and my mood was through the roof. I was always so angry anything set me off and I'm normally not like this. It was a horrible experience, but hey I didn't get pregnant but maybe because I was a monster on this pill lol. It works for others but definitely not for me.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Out of all the birth control's I've taken throughout the years, Ocella has been an absolute blessing! I started taking it a little over a month ago. Since then I haven't experienced any bloating or my usual hormonal acne breakouts! My skin hasn't looked this great since elementary school (and I'm 25)! Only side-effect I have experienced is I'm a little more frustrated near my period, but it's so worth it! 10/10 would recommend!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yazmin was my first birth control and last. I regret the day I went to the doctor to get the pill. For the 2 months which I had taken the pill I had instantly turned crazy, I was over emotional crying every day without a cause and felt so lonely and depressed. It was the worst experience, I then checked with a couple friends to see there thoughts and they told me to immediately stop as Yasmin has a common side effect of depression and going ‘crazy’. When I stopped a week later I felt so much better and normal again. Everyone reacts differently but after consulting with the doctor and a few friends it could be a common side effect to feel really down and eager to cry or start a argument . Now I don’t take any pills as my health was really bad so trying to get back on track again!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz did what birth control is supposed to do in the sense that it regulated my periods and lessened my severe cramps while preventing pregnancy, but the downsides were enough to get me to go off of it. My breasts grew very quickly, almost 2 cup sizes, and were very painful. Previously they were so small they didn’t even fit in a 32A. After Yaz I was looking at a B or even a C cup and it was very uncomfortable because I have a very very petite frame. Unfortunately, that was not the worst of it. My libido decreased, my anxiety and depression worsened to the point of missing college and work for days or even weeks at a time, and  was extremely depressed and irritable.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My daughter was prescribed Yaz to help regulate her cycles. She is prone to having anxiety attacks. The pills exacerbated these attacks. She has crying fits for no reason. I'll ask her why she is upset and she'll reply that she doesn't know why she is crying. She said she feels crazy. All these symptoms started within 2 weeks of taking Yaz. I was told she had to give it time for her body to adjust. She is into her 2nd month with no improvement. I placed a call to her Doctor to switch her to something else. Parents who have teen girls taking these pills, please be wary of the side effects.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My anxiety level has risen drastically in the past few days of taking Nikki. I was on Loryna which was fine, but the pharmacy gave me Nikki instead recently.It's the only thing that's changed in my life in the past few days and I'm positive I can attribute my increased anxiety to this pill. It's so bad that I've decided to stop taking it. I've never had to do this with a birth control.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I’m going on my third month of yaz and I skip the placebo pills. So far everything is good. The only things that I have experienced are extremely sore breast and increased vaginal discharge- like it feels like a period (no pain) flow if you were wearing a pad. Yes that much discharge!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I kept trying to figure out why I felt so much better this month and why I’ve finally been able to lose some weight and abdominal bloating. I follow a pretty healthy diet and workout hard usually around 5 days a week and sometimes twice a day. Sadly, it never occurred to me it was my birth control! I’ve been taking Loryna for 3-4 years and will definitely NOT be taking that again. Previously I was on Ocella and Yaz. I’ve been on Gianvi for almost a month and feel so much better. I’ve lost weight and definitely the bloat. I haven’t noticed any changes in my mood and if anything my sex drive is better.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this birth control for three years and I absolutely loved it and put up with it solely because it cleared my skin up beautifully. But ladies please please be aware that this specific birth control can increase digestive flora and give you terrible IBS symptoms. My symptoms were so bad to the point where  I required surgery and I failed to recognize that this birth control was the reason why. After this, I began to develop chronic yeast infections/ irritations. Making sex a nuisance and me being EXTREMELY uncomfortable. This pill may work for others just fine but be aware that the high levels of estrogen can take a huge toll on the female body.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been using Yaz for the last 5 months. Even though it has made my periods absolutely regular (every 4 weeks on the dot), it has made me experience depression, anxiety and panic attacks, as well as incredibly frequent mood swings. One moment I will feel extremely happy, and 5 minutes ever I will be crying my eyes out for a long period, then I will suddenly be much happier, and the cycle repeats. Its the only available contraceptive pill for me, so I have to continue using it.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was told to start YAZ by my doctor when I was 17 (had a boyfriend, but also had irregular periods) so my main reason for using it was as birth control. Was fine for the first year, boobs grew which I did not complain about, I lost weight, felt happy- only thing was my liver levels elevated. Then when I turned 18 (1 year on the pill) I turned completely crazy. Didn't want to go out of my room, I started crying once because I found 3 little pimples on the side of neck, I was rude to my boyfriend and my family for no reason, I hated everything, I felt awful. I decided to go off it and was off it for 2 months and I have never felt so good. My moodiness slowly disappeared, my skin was so clear without it (although, I have never really suffered from problematic skin), regular periods, and my liver levels returned to normal...I did not want to go back on Yaz. I decided last week to go back on it as a method to prevent pregnancy. If I experience bad symptoms again I will never see Yaz again.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am on my third pack of Yasmin  and honestly couldn’t be happier. My skin is completely clear and my appetite has actually decreased. I’ve lost 4 pounds along with moderate exercise and healthy eating. I don’t find myself craving things when I shouldn’t like I have when on previous pills. I can’t praise this pill enough. I wish my doctor would have recommended it a long time ago.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Never had this problem with a birth control before. Intense discharge, crying, anxiety that prevented me from going to school/sports/work, lucid dreams, impossible to get out of bed and exhausted all day. I hate this pill
Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Worst pillllllll ever!!! Breast pain and stomach ache! Depression anxiety and mood swings!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):39yr old. I took Yaz this year (2018) for 5mths. From the outset I experienced negative symptoms - bloating, swollen tender breasts. The worst side effect was extreme mood swings - each month I experienced extremely negative thoughts, paranoia, high levels of anxiety, crying, highly emotional and reactive...you name it. I changed to another brand and I’m back to my normal self. No real cons with this pill that another pill won’t provide.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It's the first time when writing in forum, but I can't be in silence now! I was on these tablets for six months. I didn't realize that the  panic attacks, dizziness, anxiety and tears for little things because of BC pills! My skin was brilliant, really! But it wasn't worth for decreased libido, emotional instability and depression!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I decided to try Yaz to clear up my skin as my twin sister has been on the same pill for almost a year and her skin is absolutely perfect!! Its been about 6 weeks since I first starting taking Yaz and I have completely lost who I am!! I started getting bad thoughts, anxiety, mood swings, depression, unable to fall or stay asleep and meanwhile my skin has only gotten worse. I blamed myself for being broken and unable to just act normal and now after reading everyone else comments I realise its all from Yaz. Please do not take this pill....... its not worth the side effects and the hefty price it costs as well!!!!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started using Gianvi 2 1/2 months ago and it has been great! I have PCOS and before I started taking Gianvi my periods were a nightmare! I couldn't use tampons because I would bleed over them in ten minutes. I would bleed 15-19 days straight. The cramps were so bad, I would rather give birth. The first 3 days of my period if I stood up blood would run down my legs. Since starting Gianvi my periods are light and last 4 days and hardly no cramps

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I took this pill for 2 1/2 years. It was great the entire time I was on it, up until the last 3 months. Before these last 3 months, my acne breakouts were greatly reduced, my period would last 5-8 days with no pain, cramps, or a very heavy flow. I had no mood swings, headaches, or anything of that nature. I don’t remember if there was any initial weight gain, but I’ve been in the same 10 pound weight fluctuation over the duration of taking this birth control. There were a few times I didn’t have protected sex and out of those few times I never got pregnant. I would give it a 10 if it weren’t for these last 3 months, where my period has slowly turned into a longer duration (the only change). My last period was almost 3 weeks long (no pain, just a LONG, heavy flow). But I used to love this medication. I would recommend it with warning!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Gave me amazing skin and super light pain free periods and no mood swings or anything, but after 6 months of use l developed a DVT in my leg. Wish that didn’t happen because this was the best birth control I had ever been on but I guess that’s just part of the risk. I do recommend yaz but if anything starts to feel weird do not hesitate to go get it checked out if you are on this pill. For me I got a pain where my leg met my hip that would shoot down my leg and made it difficult to walk and my leg swelled up and it turned out I had an extensive clot from my hip all the way to my ankle. I am only 20 years old and am very in shape and active. This can happen to anyone so if you take this bc just be cautious.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am 46. My gynecologist said not to believe the reviews after prescribing  yaz to me. So, I didn't read the reviews.  I stopped taking it yesterday.  Here is why: severe bleeding,  even now...20 days later, depression,  suicidal thoughts, and depletion reserves of my vitamin B12. This drug should not be on the market  I have put forth a complaint to the company and suggest everyone does the same. I am still suffering the consequences of taking it. And I hope my suffering ends soon, and I feel better. If you are suffering like me...feel better...stop  taking it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):If I could rate this pill with a negative number I would because I ended up with a blood clot.  I have been on Yaz or Loryna for the past 10 years or so with no issues. Two months ago my pharmacy switched me to Nikki for whatever reason. Within 3 weeks of taking it I had a pulmonary embolism and the doctors are fairly certain the cause was my birth control. Nikki is dangerous....don’t take it.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It's the first time when writing in forum, but I can't be in silence now! I was on these tablets for six months. I didin't realize that panic attacks, dizziness, anxiety and tears for little things because of BC pills! My skin was brilliant, really! But it wasn't worth - weakness and numbness of legs, ams, coordination problems, decreased libido, problems of digestion, emotional instability, depression! Be careful!

Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've taken this before a few months at a time and it has never affected me this way until now. I have been on it for 3 weeks and it has truly been the worst 3 weeks of my life, emotionally speaking. I am so emotional that I am crying daily, anxious and just generally not enjoying life the way I was before starting this medication. I am wanting to be on birth control but am afraid to continue taking this very one due to the emotional impact it has on me. I've taken Yaz before and bled for 6 weeks, but eventually was levelled out.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve just started to take this pill I believe 5 days ago and I would say it’s working great. I haven’t had any problems other than fatigue and moodiness. I was skeptical about taking this pill since there was mixed reviews but one of my good friends said that birth control pills work differently for everyone, so don’t be afraid to try it. My doctor prescribed me this one. This is the first birth control I took and I don’t have anything bad to say about it. Don’t rely on reviews because it may work for you unlike others!!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Just finished my first pack of Ocella. I am pleased so far! This is the 3rd birth control pill I have tried, first two were nightmares. I quit the pill all-together for 2 yrs but decided to start up again w/ Ocella. I was on Kariva then switched to Minastrin. I had AWFUL weight gain with both. I didn't change my diet, it was all water weight that was lost w/in a week of stopping the pills. So far on Ocella I have not gained any weight and do not feel bloated/ puffy. I am assuming that has to do with the  diuretic  effect of the progestin?  which I am all for if it keeps bloating at bay! The first few days of taking this pill I had extreme nausea but that went away. I also had a few headaches but I got that before taking Ocella. Given my past experience I was terrified of taking this pill. So far, it has been a breeze. I am hoping that it continues to be like this! Give it a shot and see how it works for you. If you have struggled with other pills in the past this may be the one for you

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I really liked Gianvi, I'm a little upset about the one side effect that's making me cease using it: extreme hair loss. Gained a little weight and my breasts are bigger but I recently noticed bald spots on my scalp I started using rogaine 4 weeks ago but it's too soon to notice change. And last night I noticed a new balding area. It is quite upsetting. Other than that, I get headaches often and have 7 day long periods. Apparently, desogestrel birth controls are "hair friendly pills." I may have to pair that up with "a testosterone blocker, like spironolactone, can be additionally beneficial for those who have experienced hormonal hair."

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was prescribed Yaz but my pharmacy gave me Nikki because it's the brand my insurance would cover. I started on Monday and by Wednesday I was having hot flashes, nausea and diarrhea. I take 10 mg of fluoxetine and it was as if Nikki cancelled it out. Thursday I went into a severe depression. I also have very clear skin and I woke up with cystic bumps and inflammation. I have never had major issues with other brands of birth control so I did some research and talked to a doctor. Nikki is linked to gastrointestinal issues and can trigger a gastritis episode in someone who already has digestive issues. I have been taking 300mg of Ranitidine everyday since March and it doesn't seem to be helping since I started Nikki. I have been unable to work the last 4 days. I discontinued use on Saturday. Do not take it especially if your prone to digestive issues, anxiety and depression! I should have considered the negative reviews beforehand.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I hate writing bad reviews, but PLEASE DO NOT use this birth control! I have been on it over a month and bleeding non stop, having anxiety attacks all day long while at work, intrusive awful thoughts, vision feels different and blurry, feeling depressed and moody one minute the next I’m fine. will not be taking anymore pills on this brand. I was on Loryna (which they say is comparable) and it is not. I felt perfectly fine on Loryna, and figured it would be the same on Gianvi. It’s not, I don’t want this to happen to anyone else, so please girls watch out.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am literally in day 31 of my period since starting this medication! I'm well into my second pack of Nikki and it shouldn't be like this. I however, don't have any other side effects.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I would not recommend this pill to anyone. It straight up tried to ruin my life. iIve only been on this pill for a month and I had normal side effects for the first week (moodiness, nausea, etc.) but as time went on it just got worse and worse. I started to have major anxiety issues which is something I haven’t dealt with in years and it also caused me to have depression that’s gotten so bad in such a short time that my doctor had to put me on anti depressants. I’ve been angry ALL the time for absolutely no reason, it almost ruined my relationship because I would get mad at my boyfriend every single day.over the most stupid things but it was absolutely uncontrollable. This past month I’ve felt like I was going insane. My acne did get better and my period has been a lot lighter but it’s not worth it. I’d rather bleed for the rest of my days than have to go through that again. Just don’t do it. Spare yourself.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Gianvi for 7 years now.  It has prevented pregnancy, which is the main point of taking it.  I can't remember having any issues with nausea when I first started taking it, but I usually take it with food.  My periods are normal, I wouldn't say lighter on this pill.  I still get cramps and moodiness, and it definitely kills my sex drive.  One odd fact about this pill is that since I've been taking this brand, I developed IBS.  I've actually seen research studies that link IBS to Yaz and it's generic counterparts.  I'm finishing out my last pill pack of Gianvi and switching to something else to see if the IBS diminishes.  I wouldn't say Gianvi has been terrible, but I think I could feel better on something else.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This medication made me feel moody, achy, tired, and I gained weight. Never have I struggled with birth control before, name brand or generic. This medication has sent me on a rollercoaster and after nearly 8 months it’s not levelled out. Why does the pharmacy just change on you with no good reason? It only gets more than a 1 because it has proven effective in its one job, the rest are horrible.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have only been on Gianvi for a month and a half and absolutely do not like it. Started spotting while on active pills, then started bleeding heavily for over a week and still am. It’s a never ending period!

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Gianvi for about a month. At first, I think it gave me mood swings. I was very irritable. But it seems to have calmed down. There's no other negative thing for me to say about it. On the positive side, it has cleared up my acne and my skin looks and feels better. I haven't had my first period on the pill yet.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control was terrible. Not only did I have bad depression and anxiety while I was on it I also got pregnant with twins. Don't trust this stuff at all.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been taking this birth control for years now. About a year ago I had to come off of it for a month or so. During that month my moods drastically changed. I felt happier, had tons of energy, and I was less hungry. I thought for a second that this could be attributed to me stopping Nikki, but I convinced myself it was all in my head. Recently, I inadvertently skipped a week of my Nikki because I left my pills at home while I was traveling. Again. My mood was amazing and I did it feel the need to nap during the day. I thought nothing of it until now. I started taking Nikki again after returning home. It’s been 2 days. I’ve been in the worst mood all day. Crying, angry and depressed for absolutely no reason and a horrible headache. This cannot be a coincidence.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Last year I had to start the pill due to an irregular menstrual cycle. My gynocologist recommended I take this brand for 6 months. I was always the happiest and brightest person. I would be the one to cheer people up and make their day. This pill gave me depression. It took away my identity. I was on it for 4 months and I would have extreme mood swings every single day. I had to stop taking it due to severe spotting for the last 2 months of it. I would bleed everyday and a heavy amount too. I gained so much weight (10-15 pounds) and was very bloated. My appetite was amplified to the max. There wasn’t a single moment where I didn’t have food in my mouth. I tried to stay on yaz but it was an absolute disaster. I didn’t realize why these awful changes were happening to me. After I got off of it due to heavy spotting, I realized my mood improved. This pill ruined my life. I still have depression and I resent this brand for giving it to me.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m 18 and I was on this pill for about a year and a bit and in the last week I was getting extreme anxiety and panic attacks to the point I was sick , even depressed outrageous thoughts. I didn’t know what was happening till my sister said she had problems with this exact pill after about a year and it just made complete sense. It was almost as if my hormones had gone hay wire and for no apparent reason.  I suffered like this for about a week then I decided I had to go off the pill so I stopped taking it but the mood issues did carry on for a bit longer which I’m guessing was my hormones levelling out. It’s been about a week since I stopped and I’m feeling 1000 times better already, would never suggest this pill to anyone it’s not worth the tears!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Loryna for years, and I fell in love with how well I adjusted with no side effects, THEN CVS switches me to Nikki & promised it was the same exact medicine (yea right), & that I should have no issues. But what they don't tell you is that the inactive ingredients can fluctuate from brand to brand and have horrid interactions with your body, and  let me tell you Nikki is the pits!! The first week I couldn't stop crying, 3 months in IM STILL CRYING! I have broken out in  hives, struggle with severe headaches, & constantly endure tender painful breast. The straw that broke the camel's back for me was the recent 2 weeks of nonstop bleeding I experienced while not even being scheduled to start my cycle. This was it! I was done. I switch my pharmacy to Walgreens and I am back on Loryna and within 4 hours of taking the first Loryna pill my bleeding stopped. I wouldn't give this BC (Nikki) to my worst enemy.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I just started Nikki a month ago.  For the first week I had terrible nausea and headaches.  However, now my skin is so so clear.  For the past 2 years I have been struggling with terrible bloating to the point where I look pregnant.  Nikki helped me feel less bloated and I have lost 10 pounds in one month!! I am 120 lbs now so losing 10 lbs was a big deal for me!! I am so happy and thankful for this pill. It really HAS transformed my life.  Best of all, my copay is 0!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have used this for about 6 months now. It definitely helped with making my periods lighter and a lot less painful. They went from being irregular and lasting 7 or more days to only lasting about 4 days with barely any cramps. The only downside of this is that it defiantly affected my mood and I’ve felt more anxious and depressed since being on this, so I will be switching to a different brand.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on this birth control for a little over a year now. It has balanced my mood, the placebo pills give me a short & light period usually 4 days long, it cleared up my acne quite a bit, with the exception of the week before I bleed, I’ll get a minor breakout. For the 14 months I’ve been on Loryna, 7 of those months I had irregular spotting every other month or so. I did not experience any body soreness that I’ve experienced on other BC pills, no sore breasts or sore muscles. I also did not experience any nausea on this BC.

I was on this birth control for a few years when I was a teenager. Over the years I tried many other birth control options and had no luck with any that worked right with my body. Flash forward to a few years later. About 6 months ago I decided to get back on this. I was happy go lucky before and now no one wants to be around me while I'm on my period or a week before. The mood swings are awful and the depression is awful. My poor boyfriend tries to bear through it until I'm done with my cycle. It does do what it suppose to. Prevent pregnancies and it has made my period lighter and shorter.  But to me they way it affects hormones it's not worth it at all. Thinking about trying the patch. I'm at my last option

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control has been a nightmare for me, extreme moodiness, anxiety and crying spells. Not a normal thing for me, please be careful on this. I've taken it for 3 weeks. Never again.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill is terrible! I was originally on Gianvi, then CVS switched me to Loryna. Both of those were wonderful. This month CVS gave me Nikki. I’ve been on it a week and a half, and I am an angry, anxious mess. I’m noticing that my appetite is increasing, I am extremely tired, my body is sore, (I haven’t started a new fitness program or anything like that) and I am uncontrollably mean to everyone. I switched pharmacies and got my beloved Loryna back. If you have any issues with anxiety, minor or not, do not take this pill!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It upsets me to see all these horrible reviews because I have had little to no problems on this birth control. I have been taking this pill for 6 months, my skin is great, my period is short and light, and I have had no nausea with it. I do have occasional mood swings, but nothing horrible. I highly suggest this brand.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been taking Gianvi for approximately 2 years. Switched from Tri-Sprintec because it made my acne 50x worse. This medication is very affordable and works well. I haven't had any pregnancy scares or major issues. I will say the cons to this pill is that I am virtually always not 'in the mood', even when I want to be. It also can cause moodiness sometimes in stressful situations. Lastly I get exhausted quite fast but I just power through it. I still get occasional breakouts but they are nowhere near what I used to get (cystic acne around my chin/neck area). I can personally deal with the side effects since, again, it seems quite effective at preventing pregnancy which is the most important aspect for me.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Ever since starting birth control, I have used Gianvi. I recently switched pharmacies, and the new pharmacy gave me Nikki instead of Gianvi (the new pharmacy is not eligible for Gianvi). After the first week of using it, I have already experienced: - headaches throughout the day - depression/mood swings- weight gain - inability to concentrate/focus- fatigue I am only on day 6 of this and have already called to switch back to my previous pharmacy so I can get Gianvi again.
