Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking Loryna for approximately 4 months, within the first week I had horrible mood swings, almost like there was a monkey on my back at all times. I have also been dealing with headaches almost daily since I started these pills so excedrine is always nearby. I thought I would give my body time to adjust to the new hormones but to no avail. I have absolutely no energy and want to sleep all day and have no issues sleeping at night. I have been on birth control for roughly 19 years and have never experienced this with any other birth control before. So now on to figure out what avenue to go down next.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I wish I could rate this with 0 stars. I took ONE pill and it was the worst thing that ever happened to me. I took the first pill at 10pm and by 1am, I couldn't breathe. The worst anxiety I've ever experienced in my life hit me and it hit me hard. And coming from someone who has suffered from anxiety and depression and takes Prozac, this wasn't anything close to what I've experienced in the past. I've dealt with death, loss, body dysmorphia, etc. This was the worst pain I've ever felt. I said rash things to my boyfriend and almost lost my relationship. I stopped taking it but the hormones are still in my body after 2 days. I haven't eaten for 48 hours and I'm still extremely anxious and my had has been flooded with intrusive thoughts. Please, do not take this pill.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My doctor prescribed me Gianvi to help my debilitating cramps and terrible heavy bleeding. My cramps would make me puke I couldn’t even talk or get up. And I would bleed through if I didn’t change my tampon after 20 minutes. But after being on this pill it has drastically helped my bleeding and my cramps are still kinda bad but definitely not as bad as they used to be but I have to say that this gave me terrible nausea and bad headaches. My pimples cleared up as well. The only con for me is the nausea and headaches but it did it’s job

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):You guys are all freaking me out. I’ve been on Yasmin for 15 years!!!!!! I decided to go off it to see if my melasma would go away. But those 15 years were great. Good skin, no issues, or so I thought none that were related to my birth control. Now you’re telling me it causes anxiety, depression, and even eczema! I suffered from this not knowing it could have something to do with my birth control. Now I’ve been off it for 3 months and my skin is an acne nightmare, my hair lady told me my texture was totally different ( thinner) and that I had hair loss at my hairline, hair is greasy, and I’m totally depressed! Not to mention I have no health insurance so I hope everything is ok internally with blood clots and stuff! I’m freaking out. I thought I liked yas but if this is what I get for being on it so long, I’m scared.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The nausea is intolerable. I’ve tried everything, taking with food, taking it at bedtime. It makes me feel so sick. I’ve had to take a pregnancy test twice because it feels exactly like being pregnant.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My dr put me on Yaz 11 years ago, within several months of being on this pill I began to experience bouts of depression during my menstrual cycle. After 6 months they were so severe I began to have serious panic attacks and could not leave my house. My world crashed while I was on this pill. NEVER touch this pill, it should not be on the market!!!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on yaz for 5 weeks. I used to break out a little bit every once in a while. I wanted to go on birth control to completely clear it. Within a week I was so badly bloated I couldn't fit into my clothes. I bled heavy nonstop the entire five weeks I was on it. I am prone to a bit of anxiety/depression but I have NEVER experienced anything like the kind of depression I had on this pill (panic attacks, constant crying) But WORST OF ALL - it gave me severe, nodular cystic acne. My skin went from near perfect to clogged pores covering my entire cheeks, which became HUGE DEEP nodular acne that have left my face scarred. Even after being off the pill, I remained sick. Finally almost 2 years later I saw a naturopath who found that the pill had COMPLETELY thrown off my hormones. With her help I was finally able to balance my hormones, clear my acne, and fix my sleep. This pill almost ruined my life. There are WAY better way to fix your acne (diet, hormone changes w a naturopath, exercise).

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am so glad there are other reviews here. I thought I was losing my mental health. This pill has made me an absolute crazy person. I can't tell you the effects this has had on my life and my relationships (friends, work, boyfriend) I've been extremely depressed and have had bursts of rage and or tears, I started to realize (in the midst of an emotional breakdown) the way I was reacting to things was not normal, I finally connected the dots and realized it was because my pill changed to Givani 3 weeks ago. I've  been on BC for 10 years so I don't think it was just an adjustment. Also had really bad acne but that was the least of my worries.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):NO SIDE EFFECTS!!!! I'm at a loss for words.  I'm 35+,  so it actually took all these years to actually find a pill that didn't have me sick or looking like a bumpy Nestle crunch bar.  Just 1 small thing, it seems to have a diuretic effect and you will be peeing A LOT - LOL.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been taking Loyrna for 6 months now and I'm 90% positive this is what is making me feel nauseous. I've been eating healthy and even try taking my bc with food but everyday I'm so nauseous to the point where I barely want to eat and the smell of food makes me want to get sick. I'm switching back to Lo Loestrin Fe . It did help my acne but it isn't worth it!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I got switched to Loryna from Yaz because my insurance wanted to pay for the generic version instead. Everything Yaz did successfully, Loryna does not. I can't believe this drug is on the market, and they say it is the same - it seems to do nothing. I have spotting every month for 2 weeks at a time. Where Yaz helped stabilize my moods, one of the notable reasons I knew Yaz worked was because it resulted in breast growth/tenderness, and Loryna creates no change. So I feel like Loryna is a placebo. I am thankful I'm not relying on Loryna for birth control as I shudder to think how ineffectual that would be.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have taken two other kinds of birthcontrol that gave me negative side effects so decided to switch to Loryna which worst decision of my life! The first week I had terrible nausea and couldn’t eat anything and I have also been dealing with depression, bad mood swings, low energy, headaches, and irritability. It did make me lose weight but there’s no way I’m staying on it due to all of the other side effects. If you’ve had issues with other kinds, this is ten times worse.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I went on this medication for acne which it definitely cleared up my skin 98%!! However, the side effects of this medication caused me to have a severely dry vagina to the point where it hurt to pee, got UTI's, and I’m not in a relationship but I definitely could not have sex my vagina is so sore and dry. I kept going back to the gyno for months because it felt like something was so wrong... all the tests were always negative and it wasn’t until just now that I made the connection that my irritation was from the yaz. I just stopped taking it a week ago but the doc said it may take a few months for the dryness to subside. It definitely worked for acne I just can’t stand this dryness and burning feeling.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Loryna for 3 months. There were no symptoms up until the second pack, I had heavy mood swings, got really mad at little things, became very impatient. I had never had period cramps before birth control, and when my period comes, I get painful cramps, lower back pain and headaches. People started noticing why I wasn’t being myself. I’m switching because I feel miserable. But my skin looks so healthy. You can’t base your experience with birth control with all of these reviews, because everyone will react differently.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Birth control? Yes.Liver tumors as a side effect? Yes.Inoperable tumors and it's now too dangerous for me to get pregnant (risk of rupture).... So, yeah, it's a "birth control" all right..... for the rest of my life.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill gave me the worst eczema of my life!! I had eczema for 5 years while taking it and stopped for a year. Eczema was gone!! I am on it for 8 days now again and my eczema is back!! It is confirmed!! Yasmin was responsible for my horrible eczema days!!!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was diagnosed with PCOS in January 2018.  My doctor prescribed Yasmin 28 to take for 1 year. I started the pill in February 2018. During the first week, I experienced, dry mouth and loss of appetite. However, that passed. During the week of my scheduled period, I experienced heavy to severe bleeding for the first 4 days of my period. Another side effect that I felt vaginal itching and discharge. However, I started taking Probiotic pills daily and that subsided immediately. Between the months of February and up to this present moment, I have felt depressed and anxious. I don't think Yasmin 28 is worth it, especially based on how it's been making me feel. I officially stopped taking Yasmin 28, 4 days ago. I hope my depressed and anxious moods will improve.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Loryna for about a year and a half! I started taking it because of extremely painful periods and as a form of protection. Before, I would have to stay home for the first three days of my period because the cramps would be so bad that I couldn’t move and I’d cry for most of the day and sometimes vomit. Taking pain meds did not help. After going on Loryna, the cramps didn’t get that much better. But I was at least able to go places and they only lasted about a day and a half. I was also able to get more relief through pain meds. So it did make it more bearable and I also had no pregnancy scares so that’s good! But I also became extremely emotional at all times, as in crying at basically everything, so that was kinda annoying. I didn’t experience any other side effects though. I ultimately had to go off it because I just couldn’t remember to take it every day lol

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was taking Nikki for almost a year and was having a great luck. Less PMS, little to no bleeding every month, no acne, much less migraines. Pharmacy switched me to Loryna and my migraines began almost immediately. I now have 10 migraines a month, fatigue, PMS and major bleeding. I am now struggling to find a pharmacy that carries Nikki tabs. I have had to start taking migraine prevention pills.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Since they discontinued vestura, they switched me ( without my prior knowledge) to Loryna. My anxiety is higher and I have about 5-8 pounds of water weight/bloat that I can't get rid of. I'm no saint with eating but I can usually reduce calories and be back at my normal weight- not now. I'm calling my doctor today; I've been on it three months and it hasn't gotten any better.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is the first BC I have ever taken and I’m generally pleased with it. I started when I was 18 to regulate my periods and clear my skin. PROS I literally never feel the need to have to wear make up anymore because my skin is always so clear. This is huge because I have struggled with acne for a very long time. My periods are very normal with no cramping or PMS (sometimes slight mood swings). I typically do not use condoms and have not had any scares.  CONS the only things I have noticed is weight gain, and the first couple months of taking it I had extreme pain/cramping in my legs in the middle of the night but that has stopped. Also in the first few months my eyes were sensitive and irritated from my contacts but that has also gone away.  Overall I think it takes getting used to and it’s different for everyone, but I have had a very positive experience so far and plan to continue using this brand

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking this pill almost three months ago and I would say it’s been great other than a few side effects. The first month I was extremely emotional and I cried all the time about little things that never would make me cry before. I get headaches more frequently and I get breast tenderness two weeks before my placebo pills start which is annoying. I also feel like this pill has made me more exhausted and sore. Other than those little side effects it’s done it’s job, my skin look fabulous, and I haven’t gained any weight on it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Nikki for a year now. This is my first experience with birth control and unfortunately did not know enough to recognize that this pill is the cause of my symptoms. The worst being that I have been incredibly fatigued and exhausted no matter how easy I take things, or how much sleep I get.I have had difficulty focusing, excessive teeth grinding, mood swings, irritation, very low sex drive, constant headaches, emotional distress, crying, and mild depression.I have been to two doctors who can't find anything wrong with me, and I have had multiple blood draws, with no conclusion. This morning it occured to me to research my birth control.I can't believe that I have gone an entire year with these symptoms and not figured it out.  I am an incredibly healthy woman. I have a great relationship with my body, and I know when something is off. I feel so terrible that I have put my body through this for so long. I will be discontinuing this BC immediately.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Originally went on yasmin as my skin was terrible and I wanted to have more control over my periods. They were heavy lasted 7 days and got severe stomach cramps. Made my skin so clear and also made my boobs go up two cup sizes which worked wonders for my confidence. I suffer from anxiety and take tablets for this also but didn’t find the pill to make this any better or worse. However whilst I loved the pill when I was on it I found it difficult during seven day breaks as my periods were still awful and long when coming off it. Therefore I tried the mini pill instead however found this awful and made me feel depressed. Therefore I’ve come back on yasmin and I’m hoping after a bit longer on it my periods will be lighter.
Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Gianvi made me break out like CRAZY. Whatever additional fillers they use made react poorly. So switched to brand name YAZ and my skin completely cleared up.

Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Was on ortho tri cycles for four months, which gave me unbearable cystic acne that I've never experienced before. My cheeks/jawline  became 80% swollen red and covered in painful acne. But now after two weeks vestura has cleared my skin, just waiting for these terrible red marks to fade. My breasts have gotten smaller which is a bummer but so far so good. No bloating or break through bleeding!Everyone is different so it's worth trying even if something has been reviews or didn't work for some people.

Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I usually never write reviews but I felt the need to share my experience for future users. I was on ocella for a couple years before my pharmacy switched me over to zarah. Ocella was great, I had zero side effects from it and it even cleared up my skin so that was a plus. But when I switched to zarah, the cons outweighed the pros. First off, my acne returned worse than it was before. I also had constant anxiety and moodiness. But the worse side effect seemed to be low sex drive and vaginal dryness. My sex life disappeared for nearly three months, and even if I wanted to have sex there was zero lubrication to do so. The only thing this birth control did right was preventing me from getting pregnant, and that was basically only because I had no sex drive while on it. Once I got off of it all my side effects regarding acne, anxiety, moodiness, sex drive and dryness went away. If you can avoid taking this birth control you should.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am on YAZ for birth control. My first month on it was okay, I had mood swings and a long period which is normal because your body is still getting use to the pill. In the end of the first month my libido was non existant and I got so dry there under. Like the whole time and that dryness caused itching. In the beginning of the month I was extra wet, the dryness was no problem. My gynecologist said that it can't be the pill.

Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I switched to Zarah last year around April/May because my periods had become irregular. I didn't notice any changes in the first few months (I had taken Microgestin Fe 1/20 for about 3 years prior). But two months ago I went off Zarah due to terrible depression and anxiety. I've never had many PMS symptoms but for about the last 5 months of taking Zarah I noticed that my depression and anxiety got worse and worse every month when I was PMSing. It was getting so bad that I switched my pill to Microgestin Fe 1.5/30, but I just completely went off the pill because my anxiety depression have never been worse and I truly believe it was Zarah that messed it up.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on a generic form of Yaz for about 3 years. I have switched from Vestura, to Nikki, and then to Loryna. Once on Loryna, I noticed my hair began to lose life and then ultimately began to drastically thin. I do NOT recommend this product.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was only on this for a year and six months. I love this birth control, my skin looks great because of it and I haven't had any weight gain. Unfortunately at my year mark I started having two periods a month and my doctor has switched me off. Even two periods a month was better than what was happening before I started taking this birth control.  I'll miss this birth control, I would definitely take it again.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):DO NOT RECOMMEND. I switched from the standard pill to Yaz due to intense breast tenderness. After taking Yaz, my breasts went from a 12DD to a 12F - none of my clothes fit me and everything is uncomfortable. I experienced bleeding for several weeks, and severe cramping that made me bedridden. My doctor said I would take up to 3 months for it to kick into my system - I took it for 5 months and still the same result. I have switched back to the normal pill, guess I'll just have to cope with the tender breasts!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had the Mirena for 3 years and hated it! I developed cystic acne and my periods were at least 2 weeks long each month. I got it removed and immediately started Ocella. It's been great. My periods are not longer than 5 days each month and my skin looks amazing! I rarely get break outs; but if I do, they go away MUCH quicker than normal. The only negatives are that I'm moody, bloated, and have heavy cravings during my cycle. The normal PMS effects I guess.

To start: I am diagnosed with PMDD, ADD, Chronic Depression and GAD - yay!Past methods:"the pill", Nuva ringCurrent method:drospirenone/ethinyl estradiol (almost 1 year)Pros: Shorter periods (1-2 days)Lighter periods (little to no cramps)Acne control (I'm still human and break out just not as much).Cons (I'm not 100% this medication is the cause, but since I've been on it, I've experienced these):Weight fluctuations (LOTS of water weight)Bloating and constipationPMDD changes:My diagnosis are pretty far spread out. Therefore it's hard for me to say that this medication has helped me or not.All I can say is, the longer I'm on this, the more upset I get about my body changes (bloat ect.)I'd like to change badly because of this. But I'll I'm afraid to.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Honestly haven’t been taking it long just about two weeks but I have already noticed that it’s lowering my sex drive, making me dryer then usual and also I believe is starting a yeast infection

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I changed from yasminelle to Yasmin because of some spotting I was having and after 5 days of being on Yasmin I started to get extremely anxious and guilty feelings over small things. I knew straight away that it was the pill, so after about a week I switched back to my old pill and after a week I feel back to normal again. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who already suffers from mild anxiety like I do myself as it amplifies it to an unbearable level. I guess it does work ad a contraceptive but it decreased my libido so much that I didn't have sex once while I was on it. It did make my skin clear up nicely but I'd honestly rather have a few spots over feeling awful about myself.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control has been the only one to help lighten and shorten my periods. I've been on a few different brands, as well as tried the IUD and this has been the best by far! While I did have some queasiness and sore breasts the first month, those side effects went away by month 2.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My experience is similar to everyone else. I was on Gianvi for YEARS but then my pharmacy switched me to Nikki. I’ve been on it 3-4 months now and I’m happy to say I’m never going back. I became a lunatic on Nikki - strong mood swings, emotional, crying. I’ve been retaining water. And worst of all my acne is horrible. I had bad acne as a teenager but when I went on Gianvi it went away. Now on Nikki I can count on having at least 6 cystic pimples on my cheeks (I’ve never broken out on my cheeks before) at any given point in time. Not a good substitute.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This medication caused really bad breakthrough bleeding. I’ve basically been on my period for a month, it’s miserable. Its also causing migraines. Effective at preventing pregnancy though.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I got on gianvi after yaz because it was cheaper. It helped to clear my hormonal cystic acne. I started in February of 2016. 2 months later I noticed weird symptoms with my eyes. They were constantly aching and it hurt to blink. Fast forward a year and a half and it’s still getting worse (I honestly thought it was from me getting older). Turns out I had severe dry eye and inflammation, which would cause migraines (never had these before). So I went on some medication to bring down the swelling in my eyes. Come to find out that my birth control is the only reason for my weird eye symptoms and migraines. Got off the birth control and less than 5 days later, my eyes went completely back to normal. Was on this stuff for over 2 years. Took forever to realize.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m a young woman myself and I started Yasmin after my 17th birthday and it was the worst experience of my life.  I experience bleeding constantly for 2 months, developed anemia and suffered severe depression. I was immediately taken off this pill and now have to endure years of taking anti depressants. I don’t advise young women to take this pill.

Insurance Blue Cross Anthem changed the tier formulatory for Beyaz drug after having been on it for years! I used to have to pay $80 for it back when it first came out, until our insurance policies changed for birth control and then it was free! Thanks Obamacare! Well not anymore with new rules and prices hikes in place they just informed me at pharmacy it wasn’t covered and would be $225! Now, I have to use this  generic version and had a horrible 1st experience on it! I had migraines for 2 weeks and chronic and nausea and painful cramping, mood swings it was horrible! I also got a rash all over. I’m fighting the appeal with my insurance to get back my beyaZ since it’s the only BC that doesn’t make me sick, or gain weight and cause cysts to form on ovaries! Stop forcing us to move when we have something working! I’m not going to just suffer when I pay a fortune for insurance! Horrible drug!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was using MonoNessa for 1 year before my doctor switched me to Ocella. I absolutely regret agreeing to the switch. I was perfectly fine with MonoNessa except for being a little dry down there during intimacy. I prefer that than what Ocella has done to me. I wake up with a headache almost every single day, I have a raging appetite, and I’ve been on Ocella since April 15 and started spotting April 18. It is now May 25 and I have not stopped spotting (sometimes heavier) AT ALL. For over a month now and this is just insane. I don’t suggest this pill to anyone.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I don't ever write reviews, but I had to share my experience with this birth control. This is my first time getting back on birth control in almost 2 years and a doctor prescribed me Nikki. I typically have pretty clear skin.. about one or two small pimples here & there, but within 3 days of me taking Nikki I ended up with two pimples on my back and three on my face. Within 4 days of taking Nikki, I also started to experience mood swings and depression. The emotional side effects from this birth control is not worth taking whatsoever. I found myself to be more irritable and emotional for the most ridiculous reasons & that isn't me. I was on it for ONLY 11 days & it was the worst birth control experience I've ever had. Please save yourself the time & pay a higher price for a better birth control.

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on Ocella for a few months now. Overall experience has been good. I am experiencing more cramps and upset stomach than my previous BC. Although that is not fun to experience I have no complaints for mood swings, weight gain, or depression. Overall I am pleased with the medication.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was switched over to Nikki because my insurance covered all of it and I’m here for free birth control. But I would rather pay the $30 for my old birth control then get this for free. After switching my mood swings became noticeably worse, and my acne started acting up. I’m currently on my period on this brand and NOTHING is better. Birth control typically makes my period lighter and a lot easier to deal with, but my cramps are as bad as they are without the pill and I’m throwing up and have diarrhea which is normal for me when I’m not even on the pill. So all in all I’m just disappointed that I don’t feel any better, my acne came back, I’m way more emotional, and my period is horrible.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Gianvi has been a disaster. I was so excited to take it as I needed a birth control method and also have adult acne and PCOS, and it's supposed to be good for that. After the very first pill I felt very bad, with heavy fatigue, nausea, and headaches. I thought I had a stomach bug and just needed a day to rest. Then I started having panic attacks and severe depression. I had to leave work it was so terrible. Over the next 7 days the nausea and headaches persisted, and I alternated between periods of panic, anxiety, severe anger, and sadness. One day I sobbed the entire day for absolutely no reason.It ruined my sex drive. I couldn't get wet enough to have sex at all. I have run 25 miles per week for two years and never missed a week, but for the 7 days I was on Yaz I couldn't run because I was so exhausted. Even doing the dishes or taking a shower was too exhausting. My acne got  a lot worse.This drug is dangerous!

Im 17, i took a pill called microgynon 30. I firstly took it so i wont have a period i thought less pain, less blood thats great right? I started taking it and everything seemed okay until about a week later i had brown like blood and it carried on and i had horrible cramps everyday and its still happening now as i write this. It turned out it was because i was meant to start it on my period day but i must have started it 3 days before but still it was a joke I couldn’t have sex or nothing all because of this silly brown stuff. It was pointless being on it if i was gonna still bleed, its meant to not make you bleed right? This is worse then me having my normal period, I prefer just to have my period now it didnt work for me and never again. I know it may of had to kick in and that but i didnt want to wait it was also messing around with my moods i was really depressed and sad and angry all the time.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yaz is my 5th pill I have tried as a form of contraception & I have been really happy with it, I have more energy, I don't get bad mood swings in comparison to the others I've tried, my nails are longer & stronger, I am now losing weight before hand I found it hard to even though I was eating well & going to gym. However, the sugar pills (period ones) lower my appetite & if I eat too much I get really stomach cramps & last night I got bad constipation. My period is so much lighter though & I haven't ever had bad skin but it's still the same which is good. I personally rather have cramps than to argue & cry to anyone who is close to me, I got so scared sometimes on the other pills & thought that my boyfriend & I were going to break up as I'd get mad or sad at him for no reason. Yaz is my favourite & I won't be switching any time soon

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I just finished my first pack and so far am loving it. For the first few days I felt a bit nausea but that quickly disappeared. I've also notice clearer skin and all my friends has commented on that, proof if it does show. Just a little worried that I actually see red spots under my skin much like bruising at points but those disappear after as well even though they were visible on and off through out the pack.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is by far the worst form of birth control. Ever since I started taking this Sunday (it is now Wednesday) I have had migraine headaches, extremely nauseous and vomiting after every thing I eat, after forcing myself to eat  for energy; even though I am not hungry. The upside is I have lost 3 lbs in 4 days! Someone told me it is just my body getting use to it?!?  I’m not sure if I believe that as I have never had any side effects like this with other pills.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The first probably 5 months of this pill was awful. My skin got worst, I spotted, and I had bad anxiety. However, it's been two years now and I have never been happier. I haven't had a bad pimple in MONTHS and my acne completely cleared. We stopped using condoms and have been fine, no scares. My period is only 3 days and very light, plus it starts always on the hour! It's amazing. Plus, I lost about 10 pounds from 127 to 117 at 5.4'

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Con: Yaz has mimicked my pregnancy symptoms completely. From the nausea, to the bloat, the super sore breasts, to the dark spots on my face Pro: It made my periods super manageable, light and pretty painless. So you get the one week of not feeling terrible and the rest of the month feeling awful.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this pill for 3 months and ended up very sick with an auto immune disorder (erythema nodosum) after I recovered I stupidly got back on the pill (as advised by my doctor) and found I was getting sick regularly. I stopped using this pill and had incredibly painful acne on my body, which stopped after a couple of months and I stopped getting sick so often. Although I have never had a great immune system I believe this pill caused me to get sick.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had been taking this for over a decade, since I was a teen. Never experienced any negative side effects at all. I needed it to regulate my period. No mood swings, no weight gain, no depression, the clearest skin ever. I stopped taking it six months ago. Experienced hair loss, tons of acne both facial and body, greasy skin and hair. It's been six months and these are starting to subside, but periods are irregular again. I'm thinking of starting up just because it was nice to have clear skin and regular periods. I would highly recommend this brand to anyone.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This birth control made me feel AWFUL! I had terrible back and abdominal pain while taking it and even for some time after it. It took my body awhile to adjust and to feel normal again after taking this pill. It caused migraines, fatigue, and mood swings. I also experienced changes in my digestive system and felt bloated most of the time. I felt my personality completely change on this pill. Overall, I would not recommend anyone to put this pill into their body.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is my first time on BC, I am 19 and it has worked really well so far! I have had unprotected sex a few times and no surprises yet! I did have mood swings the first week I was on it, I cried at literally almost anything, but I think that was just my body getting used to it because I haven’t had any since. The second pack my acne cleared up a little bit and I am now almost done with my third pack and my acne is flaring up again but I hope it will go away altogether within the next 3 packs - that’s what most reviews I’ve seen says that it takes about 6 months. Reading the reviews before I began this pill made me very scared but this pill has worked very well for me!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started this birth control a little over two months ago, and let me just say there are definitely side effects but all GOOD!! I never had horrible skin but since I began taking this my skin is more clear than ever. Even some facial hair has stopped growing! All my co workers rave about how great my skin is. As far as other side effects the first few days I was very tired and slight headache but THAT'S IT!! And it went away after the first week absolutely no side effects! I was so nervous about starting this birth control as I have never taken birth control and reading these reviews scared me. Also there is no change in my sex drive and no vaginal dryness! I get married in a few months and I’m so happy the first birth control I’ve tried is actually perfect for my body!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was prescribed Yaz 2.5 years ago to help treat my PMDD and help clear my acne. For the first year I found Yaz great. I no longer got PMS symptoms, my periods were lighter, my skin was the clearest it's ever been in my life. I didn't experience any weight gain either. However, these past 12 months I have noticed a drastic change in my mood. I became depressed, suffering extreme anxiety, and lost complete motivation and passion for life. I cry easily, I feel helpless, I have less self esteem, I feel more nervous around people, I'm constantly tired and lacking energy. I used to go to the gym 7 days a week but now I can't even force myself to leave the house. I'm completely opposite to the person I was when I wasn't taking the pill. I experience constant yeast infections and bacterial vaginosis. I decided to stop taking Yaz and am hoping  I will go back to being the person I was before I used this pill. Please please do your research before taking this pill!!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have horrible headaches everyday. Extreme moodiness & sometimes it doesn’t give me my period. It makes me cramp horribly and stay in pain everyday. I’m giving it a 3/10 because it did clear my face up a lot. This birth control constantly has me stressed out.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):WORST PILL EVER! I have bee on Yasmin for over 5 years and recently I have noticed how depressed I am, jealousy issues, insomnia, how I constantly hate on myself, feel extremely lazy and so much more. Gonna get off it as soon as possible. I have ruined so many personal relationships with the moods it has been putting me in.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started taking Yasmin about 6 months ago & at the start the only negative side effect I noticed was my skin broke out for about a month before completely clearing up. I didn’t have weight gain other than going up a bra size - so physically it looked like everything was great. HOWEVER, I have been extremely emotional, crying all the time over the smallest things which is unlike me and I find it hard to get in positive spirits once the mood swing hits. The most surprising side effect (which I didn’t link to the pill until recently) my sex drive is almost non existence and when I do have sex it hurts incredibly due to dryness. I am 25 and have never had this issue before, and due to the timing of it am confident that’s it is Yasmin causing these problems.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I feel like I am pregnant.... With a girl. Horrible fatigue, terrible acne, nausea/vomiting, headaches, body aches, no energy, no sex drive, and depressed. I was fine before I started taking this pill.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have had no trouble with this pill at all. My period starts the same time every month and I hardly bleed when it comes. I used to have awful irregular periods that came with awful cramps, but now I have a very light flow and little to no cramping.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Trying Yasmin for the first time and honestly, I was freaked out by all the bad reviews in the web!! But a review from someone (a nurse), said everyone's body is different so you can't rely on others, and besides, people usually feel the need to write reviews when things are BAD, and don't bother when it's good ;) So, I'm gonna give it a justice, I've tried it for 2 weeks, expecting all these depression, mood swings, nausea, weight gain, loss of sexual desire, and all other things people say happening to them... to happen, but NO, nothing changed at all! All those did not happen at all ;) I know I only try it for 2 weeks, but this review is to tell you all ladies out there, just try it, if your body 'matches' with the pill (like mine I guess, I hope it will continue like this), it feels amazing cause you have the safety without any side effect ;)

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):every women's body is different so every person has different side affects. The worst side affects I ever had was from Nexplanon (severe depression, weight loss, anxiety, horrible acne, no sex drive) so I decided to switch back to the pill and Ocella was free under my insurance. This is the best birth control method for my body!!! No depression, no heightened anxiety, cleared up my skin 100%, I gained my much needed weight back and I got my sex drive back! Unfortunately you won't know how a birth control will affect you personally until you try it out but this is my favorite one !!!!

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill is the worst! I gained a lot of weight rapidly on this pill, I feel depressed most days or I'll have the odd day where I feel amazing out of nowhere before plummeting back down again. My skin has broken out badly since I started taking it as well! I had none of these problems before starting this pill. My body feels disgusting because of this pill - it's not worth taking! Avoid!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I started out taking Nikki after switch from a higher dose because I had bad mood swings. So we lowered it I now have this weird feeling on my left boob.  I've had it for two months now. It comes and goes. Not sure what it is I have appointment coming up so. Bringing it to her attention and possibly changing

Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Was on this pill for 8 years slowly began to notice my weight increasing. My diet was nearly perfect and I was working out 5 times a week not seeing any results. I didn’t know what the issue was so I decided to stop taking the pill. Within weeks of stopping this pill my weight decreased by 10 lbs and I was way less emotional. Now trying to find an effective method of birth control without the terrible side effects.
Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Worst birth control. Acne became out of control. Horrible.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Nikki for about 5 months and I definitely think it has its pros and cons. On the pro side, it literally performed a miracle on my skin. I've had the most stubborn cystic acne for half of my life and right now my skin is the clearest it's been since age 11. So if you're looking for a birth control to treat acne, I highly recommend this one. (Keep in mind that it took about 2 months of being on the pill to clear up my skin). On the con side, my anxiety has been pretty out of control ever since I started taking it. I cry a lot for no reason, and I've been experiencing a lot of paranoia (which I've never really had before). I'll keep taking the pill because I'm so amazed at how my skin looks, but be aware that the emotional side effects are real.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Wow worst generic oral contraceptive ever!!! I have been on this for three months (was on YAZ for 1.5 years prior without issues) and my PMDD is HORRIFIC for 7-10 days before/around my period. Severe depression, anxiety, panic, crying...just awful. Please request YAZ and not the generic.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I got non consentually switched from BeYaz to Nikki because my health insurance stopped covering brand name meds and I was forced to trial 2 generics. I was on BeYaz for 13 years with absolutely no problems or symptoms.After being on Nikki for 6 months, I can attest to this being the worst medication I’ve ever taken, with horrible side effects. I gained 15 lbs resulting in an auto immune disorder flare up, felt emotionally beaten down, incredibly tired, lethargic, my migraines increased by double the amount, and anxiety/depression made their way into the picture, causing me to take myself off of this med. My health insurance refuses to cover a name brand BC, so I will be using a card to get my $278 (out of pocket) BeYaz for $58

This is probably the third birth control I’ve tried, I used to have severe cramps and birth control stopped that but after a few years It came back. So  then I tried one where you take 3 months of pills without a break and that was terrible, I was bloated and had acne that would not go away. Then I tried the generic form of yaz and it was great, cleared up my acne, no bloating, light periods that last around 3 days.  It took me a long time to realize but towards the end of the pack, right before I started bleeding I would get really depressed and anxious, which was nothing new to me, but it would always happen on the same day every month. My doctor said it could be withdrawal from the hormones after I stop taking the active pills to get my period. I started taking anti-depressants about 4 months ago and although it helped my mood overall, that one week was still so bad that even that didn’t help it. Overall this was a great pill though, had no other issues except for the mood changes.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My pharmacy switched me over from Gianvi to Nikki. Since taking Nikki, which has been for about 4 months now, my once clear skin has become a playground for acne. Not only is my skin a problem but my periods, my horrible cramps have come back and I never know when it's is coming. One of the main reasons for being on birth control is to regulate my cycle and also help with my PMDD. I plan things around when my cycle will be and with this I have had to miss wax appointments because my period just shows up randomly. Can't forget to add the headaches, nausea, weight gain, blurred vision and the biggest problem being mood swings and aggression it has caused me. I have found myself becoming increasingly aggressive and that's not me. Thank goodness I went and saw my doctor last week and I have now been switched back to Gianvi, I can't wait to feel back to normal again.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yasmin for almost 6 years and it worked wonders for me, I never suffered with bad skin. I was prescribed Yasmin for heavy bleeding on my periods and it helped a lot with my flow of bleeding. I never noticed any mood changes or negative things to say about Yasmin pill. A few days ago I was diagnosed with low serotonin levels in my brain ( Neurotransmitter responsible for your moods ) doctors and pharmacists say it  was because I have been on the pill for so long. I would cry all the time, became negative, moody, so anxious and depressive. I had to go on anti depressants to get my serotonin levels up again. I have never been a unhappy person or anxious person, I was always happy and an out going person. So if you want to go on the pill for any reasons make sure you do not stay on it for too long!  Yasmin is a good pill for a short while but not for a long run.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this for less than 2 years. It cleared my acne and had no bad side effects until about a year and a half in. I couldn’t breathe and had horrible chest pain. Couldn’t walk 2 minutes without having to sit down and catch my breath. I am 21 years old and have never had a kid or miscarriage. It formed a saddle pulmonary embolism in my lungs and I was in the ICU. I was told I would have died if I would’ve gone in a day later. I am now having to take a life threatening blood thinner 2x a day. Don’t take Loryna.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I switched to yaz after trying traditional pills that caused me to break out in acne because of the increase in male androgen hormones. Yaz helped my skin but gave me terrible migraines so I had to stop it.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The absolute worst birth control that I have EVER taken! I had to stop taking this pill halfway through the pack because of the side effects. One day I found myself crying totally out of no where, I was also becoming depressed which is very uncommon for me, being that I'm a pretty jovial person. Another terrible factor for me was the heavy bleeding even after my period had ended. I already have extremely heavy and painful menstrual cycles as it is, so the fact that I was bleeding even more was a no-go for me. My appetite fluctuated from day to day but I still gained a few pounds. I'll be switching to a different one ASAP.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking yaz for a few months now and each month my anxiety, depression and dependence on my bf has gotten worst. I thought I was just being a psycho until I read these reviews. Like I’d get so jealous and tell him off and I couldn’t figure out why because I’m usually not this person. I’m very easygoing and he’s trustworthy. Don’t do it. Find another birth control. I’m done taking this as of today.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is the first birth control I've tried and I am a fan of it! However, for the first day or two days of taking it, I was in a terrible and irritable mood. Luckily, since then, I have been completely normal. Additionally, some of my acne has cleared up. I have not noticed any weight gain or loss, change in appetite, headaches, etc. I'm very happy with this med and will continue to use it!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Yaz for 6 years now and I cannot relate to most of the posts on here. I've had a great experience with it. My skin is clear, my hair growth reduced and I have not gotten pregnant - yay! Moodiness is here and there but I had that before the pill, we're hormonal after all! Great birth control overall, I would recommend.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been on Gianvi for years. Loved it- and it worked perfect. I steadily was 115 pounds, 5’4. A month, not even the entire full month into taking Nikki (our pharmacy stopped distributing Gianvi and supplemented for this)- I am now a whopping 143 pounds!! I am constantly cramping in my lower right quadrant. It’s unreal. I’m going off this on my own and talking to my OB next week. (I gave it a three month trial and thought it may take a few weeks to kick in — nope, it’s worse).

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So I started yasmin mid Feb 2018 and about 3 weeks in.Initially I had nausea and breast tenderness but thought thats okay.Anyway days go by and the symptoms get worse. I've had insomnia, a dull headache daily, pelvic pain and bad fatigue. I literally feel tired as soon as I wake up and can't be asked to move all day. This is definitely all down to the birth control pill as I've done tests for other things. I told my doctor who reported I finish the pack and get the IUD instead. However I won't be getting the IUD as I don't want anymore contraception after all I've been through on them.I was on mini pill and I'd say they're better than combined. Just be careful of acne flares with mini pill.Good luck all.

This is my 7th week on this birth control and it helped dissolve my cyst and a small fibroid that  had after only a few weeks of use. My period or hormone withdrawal period was heavy for one day and then I experienced brown spotting for the remainder of the days. I have experienced severe morning mid day and night time sickness for the past 2 weeks and I plan to stop taking the pill immediately. I feel my body is rejecting the man made hormones and telling me to get off of them now! Scary part is I have breast tenderness and their swollen so I have to take a PT just to make sure these aren’t pregnancy symptoms. It’s all just too much.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I will switch from vestura to this medication and ever since I have stomach ache all the time. I always have to eat something before I take it if I don't I will have the worst nausea and stomach pain. My acne got a little worst and I cramp when I get my period which it didn't happen with my other medication. Nikki is not so good

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):PLEASE DO NOT TAKE YAZ! After 4/5 days I had a huge emotional break down. I hadn’t cried that hard in months. It was not something to get so worked up about. 2 days later I had one of the worse panic attacks I’ve ever experienced. It was absolutely terrorizing. Why the hell is this drug even available? Those are the just the extreme side effects. Please don’t risk your life! I’m also worried I could have a blood clot due to medicine.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I'm in my second week on Yasmin, and I have already noticed my skin is significantly clearer. In that respect, I'm doing fine. But I also happen to have a mental illness, and have noticed a drastic change in my mood. Because of my mood disorder, I pay constant attention to how I feel, and this pill has definitely downwardly shifted my mood. Also breast tenderness :/

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I went on this after having a bad experience with another pill. I had no problems on this one, didn't experience spotting or anything also. I naturally have bad acne and this didn't help one bit, but it was effective BC. My periods were light and I didn't have cramping. Once I went off my period came back like a nonstop waterfall and that's how it's been ever since, which is annoying.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was 17 when I was prescribed Yaz, primarily as a birth control but also to clear up my skin.I was only on it for 11 days and had to stop taking it because I would wake up with really large pimples under my skin, causing pain and very low self esteem. It made my skin much worse when it was intended to clear it up. I was crying because of how painful my face had become.I had my first panic attack and would often become overly emotional and unstable, lashing out at my partner out of random (which was very out of character for me).I saw other reviews which said that Yaz had caused meltdowns and panic attacks, and I thought it would not happen to me. I was so wrong.Although I did not get pregnant, I would not recommend Yaz at all.

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been using Gianvi for the past two months. I have started to get horrible migraines, chest pain, nauseous and anxiety. However, my acne has been in control. I am planning on getting off this medication because the migraines are unbearable.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was switched to this from Vestura because Walgreens stopped carrying it. I didn't notice much of a difference. Seems to work fine (not pregnant), I get the occasional headache, and my period has remained regular and has become very light. Don't ever spot or get crazy acne. I like that the Vestura came in a little pouch and this one is a pack with a cardboard flip front.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking yaz for over a year now and recently switched to the generic version, Gianvi. After reading all these reviews about yaz, I’ve been putting pieces together and it feels like everything makes sense now. I haven’t had an actual period in a year, about a few months after I started yaz. I also get a lot of mood swings and irritability. I get feelings of extreme jealously and anger over small things with my boyfriend that I normally wouldn’t care about. The only upside of this pill that I’ve experienced is super clear skin (I haven’t broken out in nearly a year), no pregnancy, and no extreme weight gain.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on this pill for 2 weeks now and its horrendous. My skin was perfect now my skin is really bad and I'm having outbreaks every day. My mood swings are bad and all of a sudden from being the happiest person on earth I'm becoming depressed and distant. I have a 8 month old daughter and this is not on. I am also feeling so nauseous all the time and I can't stop eating. I'm a professional dancer and I've gained weight despite dancing 12 hours a day. This pill is absolute rubbish

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):If I could give it less stars I would. Had strange side effects from day 1 on this birth control, drastically lost weight (I am already thin could not afford to lose pounds), huge cysts on upper back, nausea..By month three I was having debilitating menstrual cramps all month long, diarrhea, and my heart was racing all the time. I ended up in the ER..based on symptoms they thought I had a ruptured ovarian cyst..then all scans showed nothing!! Stopped the birth control and in less than two weeks all symptoms had vanished.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I had the WORST experience with this birth control. I have been taking Gianvi for years, which is another generic form of Yaz. I had to switch pharmacies and my new pharmacy doesn't carry Gianvi, so they gave me Nikki instead. I took one pill and within 12 hours I saw all the side effects. I woke up and my heart was racing, I was sweating, and I had severe nausea. I would rather pay extra for the name brand Yaz than ever take this again.

I was on Loryna for six months and had no major problems. CVS switched me to Nikki (3 weeks) and my face has broken out horribly and I have had stomach cramps terribly which is something I did not get experience on Loryna. I am trying to wait a month to see if my face breaking out will clear up before I visit the doctor again.

Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been through the wringer with Yaz generics over the last 7 years and Vestura worked best for me. Completely helped clear my acne and keep it away. Though I do feel it's difficult to lose weight on I feel that way about all the BC pills I've been on. For me personally it was the best of the Yaz generics for everything - super light and non painful periods, no acne, and minimal other side effects. Currently on Nikki and I HATE it. My acne is back and I'm way too emotional. Vestura was the way to go for me, hopefully I can get back on it.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So far, so good! I've been on this pill for about three months now and the only side effects I had was nausea within the first few weeks of taking the pill and increase in boob size (not complaining). I previously struggled with weight gain with other brands of the pill as well as heart palpitations, mood swings and severe bloating. My skin has never looked better on Yaz, too!! People have said it's glowing. I loooove Yaz!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Negatives: I've felt on the verge of crying all day every day. I've only wanted to be alone, but when I am alone, I'm depressed and feel a sense of heaviness. It just amplifies all my negative emotions. For a couple of weeks, I was also ravenously hungry all of the time. But, at the same time I felt slightly nauseousThe positives: I got on this birth control in an attempt to clear my cystic acne. At the end of month one, I see ever-so-slight improvements. The redness has faded slightly, and my skin, while still bumpy, is a bit smoother to the touch. I also noticed a very small increase in breast size in the first couple of weeks. Nothing major, I am very small chested, barely an A cup before, and am now a more full A cup. Again, not something that would be visually perceptible, but is noticeable to myself and my boyfriend! I also feel that, while I've always been thin, this medicine has made it even easier to keep the weight off.

I started Lupin almost a year ago to date. It has been the WORST. I never had cramps, bloating, heavy flows or anything bad (went on this for pregnancy protection) and ever since I have had all the above symptoms. I would say once a year before this I would have some cramps but would just take a nap or lay down and it was fine. Since starting this it has been almost unbearable. I have to leave work sometimes, and if I know I am getting my period make sure I have enough Advil in my purse. I also have some weird lower back pain during my cycle as well. I mean I'm happy to not have a baby right now but this has been such an awful experience with this brand.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This is my first month on Yaz and the first 2 weeks were horrible. I got REALLY nauseous everyday at the same time, but now I feel really good. I don’t feel as irritated or annoyed as usual and I haven’t gained weight which I was worried about. If it’s your first month beware drinking  on Yaz and you feel like rubbish when you drink but  just push through it because it gets better.

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this BC for three months (they tell you to wait three months to test it out). The first month consisted of horrible mood swings and headaches. For the past two months I have been bleeding brown blood discharge daily, and my acne has gotten ten times worse. I had acne before I started Loryna but by the third month mark I had cystic acne on my chest and back. PAINFUL acne. I am going to my gyno tomorrow to switch.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Yasmin works great for me! I’ve been on it for about 6 months. During the second and third month of being on it I was experiencing nausea and heavy periods. I decided to stick it out though! My periods are now back to normal and I don’t experience nausea. I haven’t gained any weight on this birth control, I’ve actually lost a few pounds. It’s a very reliable birth control. A lot of people say something about losing their sex drive this could be because of the mood swings a lot of people experience. You just have to let your body get used to the new hormones being place into it. I love this birth control!

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I️ was on this birth control in high school and ended up switching back to I️t in college. Everything was great. I️ has no side effects and my skin is flawless!! The only reason I️ am switching after being on I️t for about a year is I️ would experience spotting every two weeks-heavy enough where I️ would have to use a tampon. I️ am sad to be switching from this pill because I️ liked I️t a lot, but just cannot take having my period every 2 weeks. I️ think my body just may need a higher dose.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Walgreens stopped Vestura and switched me to Nikki.... I was on it for 3 months and it caused me to have horrible acne that literally never went away.. and I mean like the same blemishes stayed on my face for 2 months straight, and didn't go away until I stopped taking Nikki... It caused me to have bruises ALL over my legs to the point I actually looked like a dalmation. I counted 43 bruises at its worst. As soon as I stopped taking Nikki the bruises and my acne cleared up in a week. It also made me abnormally tired. I am an early riser and usually wake up around 7 or 8 on my own. When I started taking Nikki I couldn't wake up before 10 and even then I still felt tired. DO NOT TAKE NIKKI

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I just recently switched pharmacies and unfortunately the new pharmacy doesn’t have gianvi but instead Nikki. I will be finishing this pack and going back to my old pharmacy and getting gianvi back. I started my period well before I should have and it just feels awful!! I never had this problem on gianvi ever! For those that switched back to gianvi...did your period in between bleeding subside right away??

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Please, please do not take this drug. Do extensive research on the side effects of this drug. It is not safe and causes many complex emotional feelings. Please don't take it!

Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):It took me a few tries to get the right birth control for my body and once I found Loryna, it was perfect! All my acne disappeared, I went from an AA cup to a B cup in bra size, and it made my painful and irregular periods go away and make them bearable and regular. I never had any mood swings, just normal PMS like everyone has. Slight weight gain but it went away after a month. This pill also goes well with anxiety medication I take so I highly recommend it.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’m not sure why there are such bad reviews on this. This is my first time using this product and so far I haven’t gained any weight, if anything my appetite has changed in ways that I’m not as hungry as I usually am. I had headaches the first few days but I’m assuming my body just was not used to it. Don’t have any mood changes and sleep fine. My skin has cleared up quickly

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I would NEVER recommend this birth control to anyone! Although it did help prevent pregnancy, after not even a year of being on it, I began to experience heart palpitations and moments of feeling as if my heart paused and stopped for brief seconds throughout the day. I had to be admitted to the hospital because they found out I have a 2nd degree heart block and are now having to consider putting in a pacemaker. I am a healthy, active, 23 year old with no significant medical history or family history. Never again will I EVER take this BC. This is an awful feeling.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Wish I never went on this. I started gaining weight rapidly. I gained 150 pounds in less than two years.In that time, I did NOT change the way I ate or how often I exercised. So, it was not due to lifestyle changes Constantly short of breath. Made my hair fall out. Made my eczema worse. I had been off it for 8 years but was getting heavy periods where I would have blood clots the size of baseballs for at least 32 hours. I went to a doctor who told me that because of this medication, I had polyps on my uterus. I had to get them taken out. Just an all around bad medication and I don't know how the drug manufacturer does this to people.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I tried Nikki for less than 1 month and for the first week I thought it was good as my old pill but then, after 10 days I started to have: nausea, problem with my eyesight, headache and vaginal discharge. I stopped it. This bc didn’t work for my body.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This BC changed my life!! I was on Taytulla previously and it was awful (made me break out worse than ever before, long, horrid periods, etc). Nikki has made my skin clear so quickly, and I can go without makeup without feeling self conscious. My periods are still pretty heavy, but it synced up with the pill pretty quick and my cramps aren’t too bad. Feeling no nausea or weird pains either. :) Highly recommend.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):So, I had a weird experience on this pill. I was on Ortho Tri Cyclen Lo before this with fewer problems. First 2-3 months were okay, then I started having problems. I had 2-3 days of spotting before my period for the last two cycles, which would last at least 7-8 days. Then I also had 1-2 days of spotting after my period. I had super heavy discharge (which was extremely uncomfortable) as well as horrible mood swings and unbearable night sweats. The only good thing it did was clear up my face. I stopped taking it, and now all of a sudden I started bleeding again. Please use caution when choosing a bc so you don’t end up in a situation like mine.

I absolutely hated being on this birth-control. I was on it for six months and it made my period longer. I would have spotting before and after my period. Also, I had very bad PMS. I was very emotional and felt like a crazy person while taking this medication.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I am 23 years old and I took yasmin as a form of birth control for 4 months. It caused me vaginal dryness, low sex drive  and pain during intercourse. In the beginning I didn't make the connection but the longer I took it the worst my symptoms were. I didn't have any weight gain or mood swings though but overall not a pleasant experience I stopped it for a while now and noticed a lot of improvement

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I stopped taking this after 4 months. The main reason I took it  was to clear my skin up and after 4 packs my skin wasn’t really any better unfortunately. I could have dealt with that and just used it as birth control but it was giving me vaginal dryness during intercourse which I could not deal with! Didn’t have any noticeable effect on my weight or mood, which is a plus.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My personal experience was awful. Had major mood swings , abusive towards people I care about.  First I thought it was me and was finding reasons for my behaviour. Of course I happened to breakup with boyfriend so I stopped taking it and after 3-4 days was completely normal self.  Than I read all these reviews and found out same experiences happened to others.

My pharmacy randomly switched my birth control to this about 3-4 weeks ago without warning, calling, or telling me AT ALL anything about the pill and I did ask and all that was told to me was  "oh you shouldn't notice a difference at all, it should react just like the birth control you have been taking" Not. At. All. Since being on this my anxiety has sky rocketed, I bleed for a few days stop then bleed for a days or longer and repeat this has been happening since day 1 of taking this pill. Pretty annoying after a month of this. Makes you feel depressed for no reason, and makes you have no feeling of fullness so you're always hungry which I think is why so many people have weight gain from this pill. Basically don't do it

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Hi, I have been on Yaz for five months and I have suffered really bad with chest pain, mood swings, anxiety, really dark thoughts , feeling of ugliness, no concentration, bad sleep,  feeling that I was pregnant , no periods at all. I thought I was losing my mind . This has an  a significant effect on my life, partner and my children. There is so much info on the net about how bad this pill is and badly affect moods. One thing all feedback that has had similar experiences to mine, is that after a few weeks your body gets back to normal . My GP didn't tell me the side effects , told me to read up on it - this is my part of this - had I read about this - and made an educated choice - I just wanted better skin .

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Now I’ve shared on this pill before, but I’ve been on it for almost a year and a half now. Even though it sucks stick it out for AT LEAST 4 months. Yeah the beginning sucks, you’re spotting, acne gets worse, moody. However, I’ve had the best skin of my last this last year. I also went from 127 to 119 pounds, but my boobs got slightly larger (win-win am I right?). I thought it was giving me bad headaches, but in reality it’s mostly from dehydration. While my anxiety is still bad on the pill, a lot of it is probably natural. CONS: ~can be slightly moody and have bad anxiety some days ~some months I begin my period A WEEK early, before the placebo pills (usually due to stress)PROS: ~no pregnancy ~clear skin~lost about 10 pounds
Loryna (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've had no noticable symptoms while on Loryna. I've been on it for a few years now.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I never post on these forums but its nice not to feel alone! Started taking Yasmin one month ago for BC. Going to wait it out a couple of months as that seems to be the best option. I had a TERRIBLE breakout of acne (no major issues in years). I'm on the first lot of sugar pills now and skin has calmed down drastically so I'm hoping it won't break out again. Also I haven't had any bleeding yet on my 'period' week but heard this is normal. My boobs feel HUGE and tender, but I haven't noticed any weight gain, possible weight loss, but thanks to unusually large boobs I do feel large and heavy. Also just started to notice some irritability and anxiety. Skipping my period next pack due to a holiday so curious how that will affect any side effects!

Vestura (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on this pill for about two years, besides it killing my sex drive I loved it!  I'm currently on Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo and the side effects really suck.  Heavier, more painful periods, dryness, etc.  I'm really hoping I can get back on Vestura!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was not excited about starting this pill because of previous hormone sensitivity, but my OBGYN recommended it for irregular bleeding that started after I got my IUD removed. It completely altered my mood which I ended up ruining my 3yr relationship and threw me into a deep depression. I would sit on the couch under a blanket crying for hours and not leave the house (which is totally not like me). I was on it for about 6 months before getting off. It was like the fog had cleared and I looked back and was like what happened. But upside it got my period back to normal so far, just sadly had the worst 6 month I've had in a while.

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This medication is horrible. I had been taking Vestura for over a year and had no problems, but my pharmacy randomly switched me to Nikki and it was AWFUL. I have had terrible mood swings and my acne has gotten significantly worse. I went from having a pimple occasionally to my entire forehead and chin being constantly broken out from the time I started taking this medication. I do not recommend taking Nikki. I was only on it for a month and switched immediately.

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Its important to remember that everyone will respond to birth controls differently. I have been on several birth controls and for me, this is the ONLY one that does not cause any side effects. I have been taking this for 10 years now and my period is light, only 3 days. I would not stop taking it just for the benefits of having a short period and being able to skip my period every other month. I have tried generics of YAZ and they affected me very badly, I only take the name brand. I know everyone says generic is the same but I had very real changes in my body every time I tried a generic.

Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking Zarah since for around 2 Years & I’ve had mixed feelings. I began taking it because I had really bad acne and nothing I was doing was working. I started seeing results after around 5 months and after using it for 8 months- 1 year my skin completely cleared up. The real reason why I wanted to write this review was to educate others about a side effect I did not know was going to happen. While on this BC my breasts have gone from a 32C to a 32E and it has so badly affected my life. I am stopping the pill and actually getting a breast reduction because of it. I’m 58 and 115 with boobs that weigh 6 pounds. I loved this pill at first and I’m so happy about my skin, but before taking the pill please research! I hope this helps!

Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was on Yaz for less than 1 year. I developed blood clots in both of my lungs and was in the hospital for 7 days. I was part of the Bayer/Yaz settlement. Thousands of women developed blood clots from this birth control. Why is it still on the shelves????!!!!!

Ocella (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I was using Sprintec for about 4 years with no issues until I started experiencing breakthrough bleeding every month 2 weeks before I got my period so I talked to my PCP and decided to change. She prescribed me Ocella (generic for Yasmin) and the first two initial days all I experienced was nausea, which is to be expected, but about a week into it I got the worst anxiety attacks... worse than I’ve ever had along with a very rapid heartbeat. I have had anxiety my entire life but never have I experienced what I went through with this. Other than anxiety/panic attacks I had no other major symptoms. I did decide to stop taking Ocella about a week and a half into it and wait until my body is ready for another BC pill.
Yaz (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My bleeding is way way heavier but my cramps way lighter. I'm spotting nonstop right now. Hopefully my cycle will rework itself in month two

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I took Yasmin for 6 months. I started feeling dizzy and fainting a lot. Twice I ended up in hospital with very low blood pressure. I told doctors and my GP the only thing I had changed in my lifestyle was taking Yasmin. I was dismissed. I tried to continue exercising and noticed throbbing in my arms and legs so painful I had to stop. I told my GP I thought it was Yasmin. I went off it and 3 months later he checked my blood pressure and it was back to normal. I had never experienced these symptoms before Yasmin or after discontinuation. My sister was also on Yas and got an embolism/blood clot in her lungs and similar symptoms to mine. This contraception causes blood clots and loads of women have sued as it has lead to deaths. Don't risk it

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I’ve been taking Yasmin for 6 years now and have had no issues! I switched to a cheaper brand that was similar to Yasmin for a couple months and I started to get multiple bladder infections so I switched back to Yasmin. Still no problems other than decreased libido.

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):Worst experience ever. Haven’t even made it through the first pack and have started getting zits, something I never had an issue with and also became extremely depressed, another thing I never had. I know they say to wait a bit longer until your body gets used it, but depression is nothing to wait out and see. I would be afraid if someone who had an underlying mental health issue and this drug could potentially kill them. Use this with caution if you have no other choice.
Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):All that I can say is that it has done nothing but good for me

Nikki (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):The birth control pill Nikki improved my acne significantly after only a month of use. I had previously taken Gianvi for many years, but discovered it was the cause of my depression. Following that I tried numerous other brands and they either worsened my acne or depression, sometimes both. Nikki is the only birth control pill I have found that does not trigger depression and has completely cleared my acne. However, I rate it at an 8 because I have had frequent light spotting in between periods and they are not as regular as they normally would be. Overall, this pill is a great option!

Zarah (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):My experience with this birth control was pretty good. I am 5'4 about 115 lbs- 120 lbs. Never made me moody, never felt bloated. I felt pretty good on this pill. Before this pill I never broke out!! My face was pretty clear.  When I started this pill I noticed my right cheek started to break out. It was more of red bumps and a rash on my face. I noticed others having the same symptoms.  My diet didn't change after this pill. I ate the same and exercised too. I will be returning to Othro-Tri Cyclen until my face clears up and hopefully try something else.

I got this for acne and it didn’t change my skin at all. It made it less greasy but that still didn’t stop the breakouts. Also made me really depressed so I switched to ortho novum. It didn’t change me physically - weight gain or bigger boobs or better/worse skin or bloating - except it made me hairy and depressed and didn’t fix my acne

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I've been on Yasmin for 11 months, I switched this year because on Yaz (5 years on it) I was spotting fairly regularly (more in the last 1.5-2 years).So we decided to try this one because it was the next closest to Yaz (just higher estrogen) and I did not do well on Mirena (18 months on it and I got awful cystic acne along my jaw line, I was losing my hair, and getting body hair in weird places lol I'm not a hairy person, nor do I have acne problems). I love Yasmin, it stopped my spotting, but my sex drive is basically non-existent. My skin is fine, I didn't have any strange side effects other than the decreased libido. It isn't 1 pill fits all Don't let the negative reviews scare you, talk to your DR and pharmacist about what's best for you

Gianvi (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):I have been on gianvi for about 4 years. I was previously talking Lo Estrin but it made me really depressed and I never had a period. As soon as I switched I felt a lot better and I get a mild period the same time every month. It also really cleared my face up I get almost no breakouts and also didn’t experience weight gain but everyone is different. I did recently get switched to the Nikki version of the pill and it was TERRIBLE. I got lumps in my breast had horrible migraines and also experienced multiple hot flashes throughout the day. I finally got gianvi back and almost immediately this side affects went away. If you are on a brand of pill that works for you don’t let them switch you just make them order it or find a new pharmacy

Yasmin (drospirenone / ethinyl estradiol):This pill ruined my life. Before taking this, I had very mild acne. 2 weeks into the first pack and my skin was so bad I wouldn’t leave my house.
